Reviews.Title: “Venice on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: anita57
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace was a great hotel. We arrived at the hotel's private dock in our water taxi, were helped into the lobbe and brought immediately to our room. The hotel is light and airy with large well appointed rooms. Loved Venice and the hotel. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: fascor
Reviews.Content: Took the vaporetto from the Main stop near the train station. It stops at the Ca d'oro stop which is only 2 minuits to the hotel. Great location in the center of Venice. Very nice room. No view, but hey we weren't in the room too much anyway. They had a very nice roof top deck overlooking the Grand Canal which we went to every day after exploring Venice. Not many people knew about it as we were the only ones up there. Good breakfast selection. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not wowed.”
Reviews.Author: SassTraveller
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Right on Grand Canal; gondola crossing to Rialto market right there. Vaporetto Ca d'Or is only one building away. Easy walk or quick vaporetto ride from train station. Small deck, one table, on waterfront for cappucino or cocktail. Lobby was quite comfortable and nicely decorated. So was small bar, although no one ever there (no patrons, no bartender). Bathroom fancy marble, but dated. Useless super-shower: multi-jets sprayed all over. Stayed in Superior Room with window/view onto Piazza S. Sofia; could see canal if you stuck your head out. Beds and pillows provided basic comfort; you can sleep because you're tired. Pretty quiet location for Venice. Room decor was basically okay but dated. Room safe and stocked mini fridge provided. Could not get a decent Wi-Fi signal anywhere, including lobby. During the two days, got a snippet of a connection for two minutes once, while in lobby, then it dropped again. Front desk was helpful and efficient when asked for assistance with reservations, but was not overtly warm or welcoming. Were I to do it again, would pay the extra bucks for the canal-view room. Actually, were I to do it again, would probably stay somewhere else. Maybe Palazzo Stern Hotel or Hotel Bauer. Both looked lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent location - perfect city break”
Reviews.Author: Caledonian56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel from 9th to 13th March 2012 and loved it from start to finish. As in a previous review, we also had room 306 and it was great. Only small problem was that the mechanism for the sink plug was not working so it had to be moved manually. Had a small issue with a temporary lack of wifi connection but this was fixed more or less immediately on query. The location of this hotel, by a Gondola station on the Grand Canal, just along from the Rialto bridge was amazing and couldnt be faulted. The breakfast was varied with cereals, fresh fruit and fruit salad, yoghurt, cheeses, meats, cakes, rolls and croissants, hot food (sausages, bacon and scrambled eggs) coffee and various teas, and juice. Venice itself could not have been better at 18 degrees C throughout our stay, and returning home to Scotland with an unexpected sunburn! Walking distance to all the main sights such as San Marco, Rialto, and lagoon trips to the outer islands such as Burano (gorgeous island) and Murano. This hotel is ideal for a city break and again, the deal offered through Venere.com was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the state of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: June R
Reviews.Content: Bathroom COLD Panel on side of bath partially not fixed to bath Round hole in end of bath (could see water pipes) Plug had to be removed in order to use shower as the â€˜up and downâ€™ mechanism did not work. One set of lights over the mirror were not working Toilet flush sometimes did not work first time. Bedroom COLD. Thermostat set to 32, but seemed to make little difference Ceiling lights â€“ two bulbs in the light which worked on a rotation basis â€“ one would work and then the other would come on and after a few minutes the first bulb would go off. Dressing table had marks on it obviously made by drinks cup that was never cleaned. And finally... The hotel was told on booking that I am celiac and require gluten free food. Unfortunately no-one had the courtesy to inform me that the hotel could not cope with this. Thankfully I packed some breakfast cereal just in case. So I was charged for a breakfast that amounted to a pot of tea (I had my own milk with me) and a portion of scrambled egg each day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and well-located, excellent value in January”
Reviews.Author: trobaba
Reviews.Content: My double room was spacious and modern, not much of an antique or palace "feel" but quite comfortable by North American standards. Bathtub fixtures are something out of Star Wars, but I was able to get clean. The price -- under $100 U.S. dollars -- was definitely a bargain for Venice. Hotel values are outstanding in January in this usually-pricey town. The room had a view on the square; by craning my neck I could see the Grand Canal and the Rialto fish market opposite. There are nice canal views from the lobby/sitting area, and a roof terrace with great views. Hotel location is excellent, in real-people Canareggio rather than the tourists-only San Marco neighborhood. Breakfast was copious; I wish, however, that the coffee had come from the kitchen rather than from the machine. I have read some critiques on this site of the personnel, but everyone in my experience was efficient and courteous. I requested a late checkout (noon rather than 11 AM) but was refused; not really the sort of treatment you expect in a "palace." Nonetheless, a good place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great value”
Reviews.Author: magicmat
Reviews.Content: I was just staying for 2 days so wanted somewhere reasonably nice, central, and economical. The location is idea...about 2 minutes walk from the nearest water bus stop, just round the corner...and no steps! Its just off a fairly main drag of shops and bars etc, meaning you can easily find the hotel late at night, but not at all noisy. St Marks square is about 25-20 minute walk...ideal distance. The hotel itself was pretty clean and tidy, room was large enough...bit chintzy for me, but I guess much of Venice would be! All rooms have a spa bath, but sadly mine did not work. Apparentley the controls "had got wet" at some point, so was faulty. They didnt join my amusement at having this problem on a BATH! Room was pretty dark...but I guess thats a venice problem when all but one wall is very likely to face a small path, and then the neighbouring building! Overall, i recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: rrwatkins
Reviews.Content: Whenever my wife & I visit Venice, we rent an apartment for a couple of weeks in order to save money. However, we always book a hotel for one night before we move in to our place. One year while we were on a vaporetto going down the Grand Canal, we noticed the Foscari Palace across from the fish market. My wife said,"I bet that would be a great place to stay", so the next year I booked a room for a night. Because of a one day vaporetto strike the next year, we had to walk from the north end of the island to the hotel. Seeing how spent we looked as we walked in the door of the Foscari, the manager brought us two refreshing cool glasses of ACE juice. Right away, I knew this place would not disappoint. Our room was something out of a fairy-tale. We had second floor corner room that had two windows; one looking directly across from the fish market, the other overlooking a small canal. Our room had a large bed, beautiful drapes, a Venetian chandelier, as well as a fireplace; a place that even Desdemona & Othello would find comfortable. On the other hand, the bathroom was a modern as it could be; a large marble tub as well as a shower that had so many heads that you didn't have to turn around to get wet. After we settled in, we took a wondeful stroll down the Strada Nova which is just around the corner from the Foscari. That evening, we returned to the hotel & had drinks on the roof. What a view! The next morning, we came down to a breakfast that would make a cruise ship proud. This was the perfect ending to a magical one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “A really good Grand Canal hotel that has practically every thing.”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Grand canal and opposite to the Venice fish market which in itself is worth taking time to visit. The breakfast room is crammed with excellent foods - some of the best we have had.Beds are comfortable and the management shows it cares for guests comfort. We enjoyed the close proximity to the gondolas landing stage at this spot on the canal and found nearby restaurants the sort we went to EVERY night. The waterbus service here is great. and access to the LIDO is worth the trip out. Trips to the glass works at Munrano and the lace village of Burano are wonderful especially to see the lace museum which has some pieces over 400 years old. We shall be back time and time again using the Foscari hotel as our base as it is far enough away from St Marks square where the Campanie bell is a nuisance when it tolls thru the night.

Reviews.Title: “A Pricey Splurge on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: activeseniorsKelowna
Reviews.Content: We recently extended our trip budget to include a five night stay at the Foscari Palace near Ca d'Oro on the Grand Canal. We requested a Canal View ( deluxe superior) room and were not disappointed with our view from the top floor corner. At $606 CAD per night we knew we were in expensive Venice! Compared to other 3-4 Star hotels we were were not being over-charged in our opinion. I suspect the side view rooms would be less appealing. We had a superb high-ceilinged room which was clean, airy and with a huge comfortable bed. The bathroom was marbled, well-appointed with a high tech shower that took a while to figure out. Despite the price a few minor things did not work, although we did report them (the tub jacuzzi, a small bathroom light) Breakfast was in an elegant although somewhat crowded room with generous choices of wonderful cold foods. The hot foods were a bit tired, but overall breakfasts were very satisfying. We appreciated the non-smoking policies. The Foscari Palace is next to a traghetto stop from which, during the day, you can cross to the vegetable and fish markets. The Ca d'Oro vaporetto stop is adjacent and the hotel is on the Campo Santa Sophia which adjoins a wonderful walking thoroughfare extending from Santa Lucia train station to St. Mark's Square (Sestiere Cannaregio). This hotel combines convenience for location with comfort. It was pleasant to return to after a long day of tourist travel.There do not appear to be many surrounding good restaurants although the Grom Gelato chain was very close! There is a cozy sitting room and a roof top perch that is a bit rickety but with a good view. The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. We did not see porters but that service may have been available.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukdgriff
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with amazing history in superb location which was a little scary as we arrived at 12 midnight and having never been in Venice before it was a little over whelming. Great shower and huge bed. Great food and an amazing walkway straight out the back door onto the canal which was a super way to wake up. Highly recommend going up to the roof terrace for a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Giovanni V
Reviews.Content: Couple getaway from Florida. Arrived from this hotel from a cruise and fortunate enough that they had one room cleaned up and they were able to accommodate us as early at 12:30 pm. It is located one block away from Ca'd'oro water bus station. We luck out in getting room 107. It is much bigger than we expected with 3 huge windows overlooking the courtyard and the gondola docks. Staff was nice, no problem in communicating in English. The hotel is very clean. The lobby over looks the grand canal. And they have a roof deck but were not able to use because of the rain. Our first time in Venice and the staff are extremely helpful in giving us tips on how to navigate around the city and places of interest. We thought breakfast was excellent. Everything we can think of was there. The hotel is 15 minutes walk to San Marco Square. But there is lots of shops restaurant, bridges, churches, courtyards and great scenery along the way that you are not gonna get bored walking. McDonald is probably 30 yards away :) Restaurant are abundant and they were all good. Just fyi no vehicles, no cars, no motorcycles, no bicycles, no scooters allowed in Venice except for boats/water taxi. We had a wonderful time and we will stay in this hotel again and we will definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “love the view”
Reviews.Author: northportgary
Reviews.Content: the first night was a night mare no phone no hot water no A/C WHAT the #@%$3@$%* lots of money lots of trouble to get to never again I said to my self my wife was a lot nicer ???? They brought me a fan. but the next day Can you say upgrade. so it was not that bad

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it was”
Reviews.Author: samnad_bos
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Venice so don't have much to compare it to but we thought for what we paid, the room was small, the service just average and the rooms only reasonably well-maintained. The location though was great, right next to the canal, lots of food options around and an easy walk to all the main locations. We had a wonderful time in Venice but the hotel wasn't anything exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “What a let-down”
Reviews.Author: chr1s77
Reviews.Content: And it just didn't have to be. The location of this place was great. It was expensive, but hey, this is Venice, and did I mention the location was great? The building was beautiful. The room was beautiful. The designers had paid careful attention to detail, and everything was really beautiful. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast was fine. The service was alright (but really, just alright). But when I'm staying in a four star hotel, in the heart of Venice that I have paid out the nose for, I expect the place to get the little things right. The Foscari Palace failed on this account. First, the drinking cups were plastic-wrapped plastic cups. Can the guests not be trusted with glass? Second, the shampoo in the bathroom was in cheap throwaway pouches that were impossible to open. Impossible. Third, and most disgustingly, the hotel had clearly invested in fancy "spa" shower/tub combinations. This thing had more outputs for water than I could count. It was impossible to figure out how to operate. The jets in the tub didn't work. And everywhere in this thing where it was possible for mold to grow, it was growing. Under the seat, inside the jets, inside the water spigots. And there was a little compartment for some kind of massaging water sprayer... I opened it once and was overcome with how much mold and mildew was inside. It was just gross.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: alolewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a junior suite. Hotel centrally located within 100 yards of vaporetti stop. Room overlooked Grand Canal. Staff very helpful in giving recommendations, directions, etc and storing luggage the next day, Breakfast was vest we had in Italy, many selections. The only negative was the cost but then it was a Saturday night in Venice so expected it to be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience...,,,”
Reviews.Author: SeaPass
Reviews.Content: I made online reservation of this hotel under one condition- we would like to have a room with Canal view. I clearly stated it in my booking comments. On arrival we were given room WITH NO VIEW. We expressed our displease to the receptionist and because no upgrade was available my husband decided to look for another hotel nearby. After this the receptionist ( can't remember his name) who also took our passport, called his boss saying that he has got a problem... But he is keeping our passports and if we refuse to pay for at least one night he is going to call police !!!!! Obviously he didn't realize that I understand Italian... Further with very nice smile and saying how uncomfortable this situation for him is he informed us that he cannot give us our passports until we pay!!!!! It is direct request of his boss and there is nothing to discuss... It was about 9 p.m and high season... so we didn't have a lot of options but stay in this " excellent service" hotel.. If you don't want to have spoiled first impression of Venice and it's people ( because it was our first visit to Venice) FIND ANOTHER HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel for a romantic Venice break”
Reviews.Author: UKJoΦl
Reviews.Content: We were recommended the Foscari Palace by friends who visited Venice last year, and as it had such good Trip Advisor reviews too we knew it would be good. As it was our first visit to Venice, and we were celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary we treated ourselves to the Grand Foscari Suite and it was wonderful. The bedroom was huge, as was the bed (although it was two twins pushed together) and it has a stunning fireplace and decorated ceiling that really make it look special. It also has two small balconies overlooking the square and the traghetto stop. The added bonus was the lounge in the suite though, another huge room with windows all along it, overlooking the Grand Canal. Both rooms had flat screen TVs and the bedroom has a wired internet access point, and the bathroom had the most complicated shower I've ever seen! Breakfast was plentiful and tasty with a wide variety to choose from, and the rooftop terrace was a fantastic place for an anniversary drink as we watched life go by on the Grand Canal. The location is also excellent, very close to a vaperetto stop and the traghetto across to the markets, and an easy walk to the Rialto or St Marks Square or anywhere else we wanted to explore. The staff were welcoming and friendly, and put an anniversary treat in our room for us too! We loved our stay there, and would recommend it highly to other people - definitely go for a suite or a room with a Canal view if you can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Hiroishi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in Gonzaga suite in April. Positive side: - fantastic location. 2 min to fish market cross the canal, and 5 min to Realto by using traget. - reasonable locanta, restaurants and supermarket are nearby. - very spacy and comfortable room for 3 person. - facing Canal grande but reasonable price. Negative side: - drowsy reception staff having poor knowledge. - take much time to be helped since only one staff in reception desk. - poorly maintained facility - chair leg was broken, drawer knob was lost - no wifi but cable connection for internet. - uncleaned balcony. cigarette butt were remained. - no tea pot in the room. They should add kitchinet facility in the room when they do renovation since they do not have restaurant and famous market is in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “6 years later, even better after the renovations”
Reviews.Author: tim-dartmouth
Reviews.Content: great location, right on the canal, right next to a vaporetto stop (water shuttle) and a traghetto stop (canal crossing via retired gondolas). The place is fantastic, quiet, and has a great rooftop terrace to sit and take in Venice from. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to explore Venice from and very comfortable as well”
Reviews.Author: Louche1864
Reviews.Content: Venice was our first stop in Italy on this trip and what a great way to start with Foscari Palace. In setting our budget for this trip , this hotel was one of the more expensive so we were hoping to get value for money and we certainly did. When we turned up here I was quite nervous - the night before i had read a couple of negative reviews about the staff at the front desk and i was worried we were going to have a bad experience with rude and unhelpful hotel staff - I was wrong. I truly believe the negative reviews on this site might have triggered some action because we had no problems at all when we were at this place. The hotel staff are very kind and helpful and are happy to give suggestions on where to go and what to do. The hotel is actually very nice and quite classy with its beautiful little lobby. It was clean, tidy and well run and very easy to find - you are literally around the next corner from the ferry stop. The hotel is only a few levels so you can catch the lift or walk the stairs up and down to your room. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are large and comfortable. The bathrooms are great and very very roomy and overall these rooms are designed to help you relax and feel as comfortable as possible - you will not feel cramped or short of space in this hotel. The breakfast selection is fantastic, with a wide variety of food to choose from, it will suit anyone from the health conscious , to someone with a sweet tooth , to someone looking to fill up and start the day - lots of fresh fruit and juice as well beautiful cakes and pastries. The rooftop bar and terrace is a great place to relax and unwind whether it be to grab a tan, or just enjoy a nice drink in the afternoon. With Venice being the size it is , it is very easy to explore and this hotel is a great central location from which to do it - there are shops and restaurants everywhere and a Gondola stop right outside the door. It is a great base for anyone. I would recommend this hotel to both couples and families, it is tidy and well run.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed on the two week trip”
Reviews.Author: GreatTrip356
Reviews.Content: Lovely, spacious room in a hotel on the Grand Canal. The entire bathroom was green and pink marble. The roll-away bed (we were 3 in the room) was the most comfortable bed our daughter said she'd slept in on the two week trip through Italy. The common area is comfortable and you can go outside and sit on the dock on the Grand Canal where you can watch the boat traffic, the gondolieri, or answer emails. Breakfast is very good, although the room is a bit small and can get crowed easily. The lobby is available for 'over flow' capacity. Hotel staff were very helpful to us in booking restaurant reservations two nights in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Sarasota_Florida
Reviews.Content: This hotel handled our reservations, check-in and provided services in a very poeasant and professional manner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel. Right by a boat stop and easy walk to all of Venice. Lovely rooms. Free drink and canape reception on the Saturday evening that we arrived. Breakfast was included and was really good quality and excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mtrenax
Reviews.Content: Located one street from vaporetto Ca d'Oro. 10 minute walk to train station in one direction or Rialto Bridge in other direction. The hotel was clean and personnel friendly. Staff has long internet cord for free use in room. Breakfast was ample and very good. Room was small while bathroom was very large. no problem- we weren't there much. A/C was fine and room was quiet at night. The roof veranda is nice for pictures but we were out late at night so didn't have an opportunity to use. Summer in Venice is expensive so room was about $250 US/180 EUR but that's to be expected. I'd stay on return if the price were competitive with other quality hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great seting for anniversary”
Reviews.Author: codingboy
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with good location, very helpful staff. We were upgraded to a suite. I lost my adapter for my camera charger and the front desk lady tried to find one for me. She recommended places for us to dine and helped us reserve dinner for us. The suite was grand and view from our living room was breath taking. Totally venetian. I scored alot of cookie points with my wife for booking that place. ;-). Finally, they have good breakfast. Dont miss it. Also dont miss the rooftop terrace. Panaromic.!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: lily57
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. On the Grand Canal, it is a beautiful place to stay. Our room was spotless and spacious, and the air conditioning worked wonderfully...a major plus after a long day of touring Venice. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. It is located within walking distance to most places of interest as well as the train station. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location to explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: J80-benelux
Reviews.Content: Located near the Rialto bridge (just outside the tourist center), the Foscari Palace is well located to explore Venice. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room had a nice view over the grand canal and was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Location...minor gliches”
Reviews.Author: Lorac42
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 nights during a real heat wave and would definitely stay here again: Pros: -Spacious room and bath with great air conditioning -Convenient location near shops and restaurants, away from the crowds of St. Marco -Impressive breakfast to start the day Cons: -No free wi-fi as indicated on web / It's actually free wired (They said it was a typo on web). This was a nuisance since we had an ipad and needed internet access. You can go outside in the courtyard andsometimes access the wi-fi from Ca'Sagredo next door. -Though the front desk staff was for the most part friendly, there was one woman who should not be in the hospitality industry. When I'm paying $350.00 per night, I shouldn't be made to feel that my questions are a nuisance. As frequent travelers, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the rooms are modern and renovated. very clean, typical Italian room”
Reviews.Author: bilkoa
Reviews.Content: The rooms in Foscari Palace were spacious and very clean. Nice linen and pillows. Staff helpful, all spoke English. Only the shower was poor. It was like a Dr Who tube suspended over the bath with all sorts of dials and handles. Not a good experience, it was almost impossible to wash my hair (couldnt get any elbow room once i had inserted myself into the tube(shower). Toilet seat was broken. Bidet plug was broken so it could not be emptied. Location on San Sophia Square was great, gondola and water taxi rank outside on the Grand Canal. Lots of cafes and small shops. Definately a good area. Also I cant understand why the Doorman who helps with clients luggage, just stood back and watched us get our own luggage from the water taxi and lug it to the front door - then he helped (and expected a tip). Foscari - please employ a doorman who is strong enough to help with the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: SoonerOK
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Foscari Palace. The location was great and we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is very nice. Rooms were clean and newly upgraded. The bed was very comfortable (the best mattress we slept on while in Italy). The breakfast was wonderful and had numerous items to choose from including eggs and sausage along with the typical fruit, pastries and cereals. The balcony offered a great view. The staff was always helpful and friendly. The bathroom was roomy and very nice. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Memories”
Reviews.Author: Ralstonlan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Foscari Suite for three nights, June 26-28 to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The suite is spectacular. The staff was warm and welcoming. They had a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room. Everything was perfect, from start to finish. The rooftop terrace is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to accommodate your Venice fantasy...”
Reviews.Author: Maryam-nab
Reviews.Content: It was really important for me to choose the right hotel and place in Venice as I was planning a romantic get away with my partner and i think that foscari palace was certainly the right choice. The hotel is very comfortable and the location is unbeatable. It is located In the middle of the Venice with easy access to everything. The rooms were spacious and clean with nice breakfast. We also took benefit from the complementary ride to murano island where the famous glass factories are located, though I have to say that the factory that we were taken to was the most expensive factory and we ended up paying triple of the normal price for the stuff we bought which was really disappointing. When we discussed the matter with the reception of the hotel, they didn't really seem to be bothered with the matter!!! So i would highly suggest that you be Cautious with your murano trip. Other than this fact, the hotel is highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: Nick8899
Reviews.Content: The staff was very good, amazing breakfast , ideal location and very comfortable rooms. Couldn't ask for better. We had a great stay .

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: fabdea
Reviews.Content: This very comfortable hotel is close enough to all the city attractions and quite enough to rest and enjoy the beauty of the Gran Canal from our superb Suite (which was upgraded from a superior room). The Receptionist Divna showed true professionalism, friendliness and provided with great customer service. We had a memorable time and stay at the Foscari. With no hesitation we would come back to this establishment in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fosacari for great location, service and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: talRomania
Reviews.Content: Foscari palace located near the rialty bridge, and in front of the market (0.5 euro for gondola taxi ride to the other side of teh grand canal). it is worth staying as the service is great and the cleaning is ok. it worth the money even in carnaval time when it becomes quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “GO, Go, Go Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave8401
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, spotlessly clean, great service with all amenities and free biscuits at the bar at night. Great location 5 mins from Rialto and within walking distance (10 mins) of san marco. Receptionist was very helpful and breakfast was of a high standard. Definitely value for money would recommend any day of the week. Good views from the roof terrace and right by waterbus stop. Would also recommend the free trip to Murano glass factory. Will be going again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Great Location, Gorgeous Foscari Suite!”
Reviews.Author: VitaliyS
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at this hotel at the beginning of February for 3 nights. As this trip was dedicated to their 35th Wedding Anniversary weâ€™ve been searching a lot prior to making final decision. Being to Venice several times before and taking into account that it was my parentsâ€™ very first trip to this magnificent city I decided to find smth special and preferably situated on Grand Canal. We chose Foscari Palace for its fantastic location right on the Grand Canal close to Rialto bridge (less than 5 min walking distance) and within 10-15 min of walking to San Marco square in one direction but also the same distance to Piazzale Roma in another â€“ so the hotel location is perfect as you can reach all parts of Venice easily by foot. On the other hand if you are not keen on walking â€“ the vaporetto station Ca Dâ€™Oro is only one block (or 2 min walk) away from hotel and the Traghetto station (to cross the Grand Canal on gondola for only 0.5 EUR) is situated right in front of hotel entrance on Campo St. Sophia. With traghetto you will be able to reach famous Rialto Food and Fish market (which situated on the other bank of Grand Canal right in front of the hotel), only in 2-3 minutes. So taking into account such perfect location and also very good reviews of the property on Tripadvisor we finally booked their wonderful Junior Suite with Grand Canal view (Gonzaga suite) â€“ situated on the 2nd floor with high ceilings and 2 balconies facing Grand Canal. In the meantime I decided to make very special surprise for my parents and 1 week prior to the arrival without informing them I e-mailed the hotel explaining the situation and the specialty of trip (35th Wedding Anniversary) and asked hotel team for the possibility of free room upgrade to their one and only gorgeous Foscari Suite. To their credit hotel representative â€“ Mrs. Divna answered very fast and informed me that hotel would be more than happy to offer this free upgrade and bottle of Prosecco for my parents for such special occasion â€“ I would like once again to sincerely thank hotel team for such generous present and their fantastic attitude â€“ well done!!! So upon arrival my parents were escorted to their room and what was their amazement when they found that instead of Junior Suite (which is really very good) they will stay in Grand Foscari Suite â€“ this apartment is something special and worth separate mentioning â€“ situated on the 1st floor of the hotel, with high original beamed ceilings, marble floors, consists of huge (40m2) bedroom with fireplace, Murano glass chandelier and 2 balconies facing Campo St. Sophia and side view of Grand Canal plus gorgeous living room (almost the same size) with 6 big two-leaf windows facing directly Grand Canal (in fact if you look at the picture of hotel front â€“ 6 out of 7 windows on the first floor facing Grand Canal â€“ all belong to Foscari Suite) â€“ WOW what a view! The bathroom features bathtub with Jacuzzi and all amenities you would expect from 4 star luxury hotel, there are 2 big LCD screens in both rooms with good variety of programs, bathrobe and sleepers which were changed EVERY day conclude the overview of this fantastic apartment. The breakfast was very good â€“ with wide variety of high quality products to choose from. The hotel itself is immaculate clean and the service is top spot. The rooftop terrace on the last floor has unbeatable views on the Grand Canal as well as general Venice panorame. In the evening on the first day parents was greeted with bottle of Prosecco â€“ it was also unexpected and so even more pleasant touch for them. All hotel staff did their best to make their stay memorable and they really succeeded in this, as my parents said that they felt like at home away from home and that it was probably one of the most memorable stays in their lives. When the last day of their stay came they really didnâ€™t want to leave and thus waiting for return in this fantastic property in the heartbeat and would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody who would like to spend an unforgettable time in the heart of one of the most charming cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Late review- This hotel will knock your socks off”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: Sorry, I am writing a late review, I stayed Nov 3-5 2009 prior to a Mediterrean cruise. First of all Venice has to be one of the world's greatest cities. The Foscari only complements that cities greatness. It is ideally located on a major walk thourgh fare and right on the Grand Canal. Venice should be and in some cases can only be walked. The lobby is grand. The hotel desk clerk was brisk and almost cold when checking-in. I think it was the language gap as English was not her first language. Once we got to the room I was impressed, the bedroom was separate from the sitting area. The bed was comfortable and very clean. We had a room that had an inner court view which was a view of the wall of the next building. I could have upgraded to a room with a canal view, but decided to keep the savings as we were only in the room at night. The hotel overall including the stairwells are charming with all the history from the Duke's prior palace. They did not have a work-out room ,which I expected from a boutique property. Breakfast was an ample European buffet with meats, chesse, fruits and breads. Both days they were late in their set-up as we are early risers and that staff seemed irrated. The hotel is right next door to vaporetto stop and a ferry to the island across the Canal.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE...NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PKM-KeenTravel
Reviews.Content: I was excited to visit Venice as this was my FIRST time and SPECIFICALLY chose this hotel because of the reviews. Although there were a few that were questionable, I chose to go with the masses. What a mistake! Their customer service has A LOT TO BE DESIRED!!!!! I recently stayed in 6 hotels since September while touring Europe and made a decision to review all hotels upon my return to the USA. But at this moment, I am writing from my hotel room in GREAT DISGUST! It all started on Tuesday, the actual day a friend and I checked in. The hotel room did not have two washcloths even though two guests were on the itinerary. It took 1.5 hours for me to receive another washcloth. I called the reception desk after 11pm to request it via the phone. I began working on the computer when I realized an hour had passed. I called back in which the night auditor expressed to me that he did not speak English. No problem. I communicated to him my request in Italian after using Google translator. But, why didn't he just say this in the first place. Second, on Wednesday morning, I asked the receptionist, Divna who was not busy if she could show me on the map where a few tourists sites were that I researched myself. When I asked her where something was, she told me that she did not know. Not a problem. However, she was complacent with this answer even though she was sitting in front of the computer! So I said, "Can you Google it? It will only take a few seconds if that." Within seconds, my question was resolved upon my prompting. Thursday at 12pm, my door bell rang. I was just about to answer it; however, the cleaning lady began to enter in which she apologized. I requested that she come back in which she replied, "ok." 1 second later, the room phone rang. It was the same receptionist, Divna stating that the receptionist is leaving and she will not have anyone to clean the room. I requested that she gives me 15 mins. so that I could finish up and that the room will be all hers. She told me that it was not possible and if there was anything that we needed in terms of towels. I got dressed and approached the front desk at 12:14pm. I stated, "I would like to speak with you when you have a moment." Divna told me that it was fine. I could speak to her now. As I began to speak with her, she was writing and looking up every now and then as if my concern was not important to her. I stated, "I'm a bit confused because we were trying to leave the room and you are telling me that we can not receive cleaning service." Divna stated that the cleaning lady gets off at 12pm and that there was nothing she could do. I stated to Divna if the woman is off of work at 12pm, why would she just open our door to provide cleaning at 12pm. It doesn't make sense. She tells me that if she sends the woman up to my room to clean, she will not be paid for it. Then she begins to dismiss me and state I came down to argue with her? Excuse me????? I am simply trying to understand why my room can not get cleaned and furthermore who does not give a guest their undivided attention. Then other guests approached in the lobby and she began to get louder as I am quiet staring at her that I want to argue with her. I simply looked at her and stated that is not the case. Why would I argue when I only want to understand and that this is a GREAT misstatement. As I began to look at her as well as the other guests, she conceded and told a lady in Italian to go upstairs to clean my room. However, it was not without attitude and FRANK RUDENESS!!!!!! Thursday evening, it began to rain heavily. I enter the hotel at 10pm on the dot and was completely drenched. My socks, shoes, coat, etc. were all wet. I requested a cup of hot chocolate and was told that the bar closes at 10pm. I said, "It's 10pm right now. Can you please assist me?" Sarah told me that she would let her colleague know and call upstairs. Then she informs me that my friend called 10 minutes prior and ordered the same exact thing. We share a laugh. 10-15 minutes passes by in which I am told it is not feasible as the bar was closed. I know this already as we discussed it prior to me getting on the elevator at 10:03pm. Why even tell me that you are going to call upstairs if you had no intention of even fulfilling my request. She then told my friend that I could go outside. GREAT! Outside in the pouring rain after 10:30pm for hot chocolate when I am already soaking wet!!! Does that really make sense???? For hot chocolate???? She did not even care and explained that she did not have a key to the bar and/or kitchen to even fix me a cup of hot chocolate even though her and her colleagues congregate in the area to eat and drink themselves. Things that make you go, "Hmmmmm...." So I decided to get myself ready as we have an early check-out. I go into the bathroom and guess what? There are NOT 2 washcloths again! My friend goes down to the front desk to request one in which Sarah says, the cleaning lady did not leave you 2? No, she just came all the way downstairs to ask for an extra one for no reason. She then tells the night auditor in Italian and he comes back with a napkin. Are you serious? She tells him no and he comes back with a hand towel stating that is all they have. How can that be when the same thing happened on Tuesday night? There is not one washcloth in the entire hotel. I truly find that hard to believe. I am UTTERLY disgusted with my experience and because of the staff, it has made my stay in Venice bittersweet! I would NEVER EVER EVER stay in this hotel again or any property owned by the same management especially if this is how their staff attends to and/or treats its guests. BY FAR THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Roosterhair
Reviews.Content: While there are no shortage of hotels in Venice i've found this one to be quite comfortable in a great location and a great staff. The first time I stayed was in Jan 2008 and thought for the price it was in a great location and perfectly luxirious for myself and my girlfiend. Getting there is extremely easy, if your traveling with a lot of luggage you will probably want to take the water bus and get off at the Ca' d' Oro stop, which is no more than 200 meters from the hotel. But for the lighter travelers the walk from either the train stop or bus terminal is very doable. The Rialto bridge and St. Marks square are both within easy walking distance as is everything in Venice. The hotel is definitely above standard for Europe and Americans will find is perfectly adequate. Most recently this month I made a reservation to stay there again, but when I arrived I had made a reservation for the wrong date by mistake, the staff immediately used my reservation and transferred me to one of their sister hotels because they were booked, but totally saved my weekend despite my mistake. Nothing but good things to say about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but wouldnt pay full price”
Reviews.Author: Dinoalita
Reviews.Content: I want to LOVE this hotel due to so many great things about it but Ive stayed there two times and each time had some very big problems. The first time I stayed in room 306. It was a huge room with big bathroom and great view of the canal. Beautiful decor, perfect location. Good breakfast and we loved sitting on the roof top patio in the morning just relaxing and watching all the action below. But...... we had no hot water in our room so couldnt shower. After speaking to the front desk they said the hotel had run out of hot water although the hotel didnt seem that full and they should have enough for all guests to shower the next day. The second time (a week later) my sister stayed in room 306 and I was in 203. She again loved the room but we were surprised to find out AGAIN there was no hot water. The staff said they would send someone up to fix it but they never did. I think it just doesnt work in that room. This time I had hot water in my room and even filled up the tub to take a jet bath. (It is amazing this place has jet tubs in beautiful bathrooms). The problem was the tub was not cleaned properly. There was hair from the previous guests and the jets did not work. I decided to shower instead but the shower head was broken and only drizzed out water. I decided that wasnt a big deal because the room was so comfortable so just went to sleep rather than bathing. Had a great sleep but was awaken early the next morning by construction from the opposite wall. The neighbors were jack hammering the wall opposite from my head at 7:30 AM! I called the front desk and they said it wasnt their construction but the neighbors. I felt that if they knew the neighbors were doing construction they should not put guests in that room or work out a deal that construction started after check out. I live in Milan and take guests to Venice regularly. I may give this place a 3rd times a charm try only if I got a great deal on it again. On each occassion we booked a last minute deal for 100 euros a night. For Venice that is pretty economical. If I had to pay more I would probably look for another hotel and hope to have a smoother stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Truxel2000
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The rooms were beautiful, the view on the grand canal lovely, the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Barron5644
Reviews.Content: Foscari Palace is perfectly located on The Grand Canal, just a short walk from the Ca' D'Oro stop on the water taxi. A great boutique hotel. Our room was very comfortable, shower (no tub), very clean, with all amenities we needed. The staff was kind and helpful, referring us to a very nice restaurant. A breakfast buffet was plenty to get us off to a good start. There's a beautiful rooftop deck overlooking the Grand Canal. Gondola rides available right outside the front door. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidCourtney
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel close to all the attractions. Friendly staff and a good hearty breakfast each morning. The Sun Terrace on the rooftop was amazing with panoramic views across Venice. Very clean and hard to fault in any way

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PatnHel
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Foscari Palace. Our arrival coincided with the Regatta Sortica and we were advised by the concierge to make our way to the roof as soon as possible to watch it. This we did and had a fabulous afternoon being served with drinks and free canapÃ©s by the concierge. The rest of our stay mirrored this level of service. The hotel has been recently sympathetically refurbished to a high standard and is in a central location overlooking the Grand Canal. Our bedroom overlooked an alley and was a good size with a reasonable sized and well equipped bathroom. Unfortunately they had tried too hard with the bath which had gadgets galore. This just meant that as none worked particularly well nothing was very satisfactory. (Simple is best!!). On the ground and first floor were communal lounges that fronted the Grand canal. Breakfast was served in a small breakfast room and was continental with boiled eggs. Fine!! We Booked through a broker and were very happy with the price we had paid. 140 Euros per night for a double room for two with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltravels6
Reviews.Content: This is a nice older hotel in the middle of Venice. The rooms are decent sized and the bathroom is pretty large compared to a lot of other places I've heard about being on the small size. It wasn't cheap, but it was under 200 euros a night which for a 4 star hotel seems fair in Venice. We enjoyed our stay here for 3 days at the end of August, except for two things. The day before we left the maids had cleaned our room and for some reason decided to remove or throw away one of our large tupperware containers we have been using for our world trip. No idea why, but when we got back to our room it was missing, and the lid was still there and the front desk had no idea what to say. I think they threw it out while they were cleaning, and this was really frustrating since we could not buy the same one since we were in Italy and the replacement we got does not fit in our luggage. As we're traveling around the world we've been using it for taking food with us on planes and to use in the hotel room. The front desk did not really seem to care about this and we could not find the maids to ask them since we were leaving early the next morning. The other is not their fault, but it seems the piazza they are in is VERY noisy after 11pm, every night there would be loud music playing, people screaming and the sounds of drunk people. It was quiet up until then and we'd go to bed only to be woken up by really loud noises which would go on past midnight. I highly suggest you bring ear plugs if you come here because it seems everyone likes to party late in Venice and sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Arash-GTR
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location, rooms a bit small but generally speaking a very good hotel by Italian and International standards, breakfast was a bit bland but location made up for it. Price was a bit high but costs as 3x more as other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: hiebertg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two daughters for three nights and am so glad that we did. It is right on the grand canal, right near the water taxi stop, 5 minutes from Rialto Bridge and in a very quiet neighborhood. The room was HUGE and the bathroom wonderful....jetted tub, great shower! The breakfast included was nothing to write home about but sustained us enough until lunch. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Venice! Not to mention that it is 500 years old!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Oxfordsunseeker
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4-day trip to Venice and would thoroughly recommend the Foscari Palace. It is a great location, about 5 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge, but in a quiet area. All the staff were very friendly, relaxed and helpful. My favourite memory is sitting on the rooftop terrace, sipping a Bellini while watching the sun set and the boats go past on the Grand Canal. Fantastic! We had a lovely room, but opted for a superior double as seemed a safer bet (room was lovely, spaceous and had a fab bathroom). Our window overlooked the sidestreet, but we could just see the canal to the left, and the gondoliers waiting for business! We deliberated for ages about which hotel to go for, but went for the Foscari because it had a better price and what a good move that was. Venice is so unbelievably expensive it was a relief to know we hadn't overpaid for a hotel which we were hardly in.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, functional base for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: nfs001
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is based directly on the Canale Grande nearby the Rialto Bridge, right by the traghetto (gondola ferry) traversing the Canale Grande to the market on the other side. Our room was of very comfortable size and and offered all the usual features one expects in a 4 star hotel (but, somewhat surprisingly, no mini bar). The lobby and hallways are tastefully furnished and decorated, and there is a wonderful roof terrace where one can have a drink while watching the vaporettos and other boats go up and down the Canale Grande, and has a wonderful view over the roofs of Venice all the way to the tower on St. Marcus Square. There were few other amenities on offer in the hotel - no restaurant, the breakfast service was not particularly impressive, and some of the reception staff were not well informed about restaurants and other attractions in the immediate neighbourhood. I was also somewhat disappointed to find out out that the hotel was unable to provide umbrellas for its guests to help them cope with the occasional torrential rainfalls. However, these minor drawbacks are easily outweighed by all the positive aspects - the great location right in the heart of Venice that is perfect for exploring this charming city, the very decent rooms, and the charming setting on the Canale Grande.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GiantpandaKirchberg
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from an excellent three night stay at the Foscari Palace. We had a lovely, large room (superior double) and it was also very quiet. Excellent breakfast, great location. I have read some negative comments on this site regarding the reception staff at this hotel but I must say that we found them efficient and friendly. I would certainly stay at this hotel again, with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - great location, room and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Marie_FI
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel. Our room (superior double) was huge, breakfast was good and the roof terrace was really nice. Location was also excellent, really close to Rialto and easy to walk to all the main sights. A lots of stores and good restaurants very near. The only minus was the service as mentioned in the other reviews but it was not bothering us. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Rudders71
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, good amenities, the room was spacious, clean, warm and the the breakfast is a great set up for your day ahead. The staff were great. But most of all the location, for us it is perfect, exactly where we wanted to be having stayed in Venice many times. Great for the escape from the hustle a bustle and near to our favourite bars and restaurants. Will definately be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdzimme3
Reviews.Content: We spent the final 2 nights of our honeymoon in Venice at the Foscari Palace and we could not have been happier. The room was huge when compared to our hotels in London and Paris (both of which we were pleased with). The location was wonderful, right on the canal. If you stay here make sure to enjoy the roof top deck. Both nights we enjoyed the sunset and the view of the canal from the deck. Would love to stay here again if back in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, room and service”
Reviews.Author: GraceBRU
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I did a 3-night getaway to Venice. I am really glad we chose the Foscari Palace. It was a far cry from the hotel my husband and I stayed in the previous trip. The superior room here was excellent - clean and spacious with free cabled broadband and bright. Breakfast spread was good - my favourite being the grilled aubergine and zucchini! Service was excellent - the waiters and waitress and the receptionists were helpful. We enjoyed the view from the Terrace at the top of the hotel. The hotel is just a couple of minutes' walk to Rialto and the Jewish Ghetto in the other direction. As it's a couple of metres off the main thoroughfare, the room was quiet and we slept well. Shops and cafes and the supermarket were nearby if we needed anything in a hurry. The traghetto is right in front and we rode it to cross the Grand Canal for â‚¬0.50 per person to the Rialto Market. It is about 25 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma but you would have to manage the luggage up and down the steps. So travel light if possible. We walked everywhere and didn't take the water bus at all this time. Guided tours: The Secret Itineraries at the Doge's Palace and the Jewish Ghetto were excellent and made this trip so much meaningful than the previous one. 4 days/3 nights was good and relaxing but you could easily do Venice in 3 full days/2 nights. My husband and I are now planning a trip to Venice and we'll definitely be staying at the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: CharlestonJellie57
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay near the Train Station and I can see if you have a lot of luggage, that would make sense. However, the Foscari Palace was centrally located for us to "get lost" in Venice. We took the 50 cent (euro) gondola ride back and forth from Rialto market many times-that was conveniently located right outside the hotel. We did upgrade to a canal view room, but saw the regular room-it was fine. The breakfast every morning was good and they always had cookies set out at night. The front desk was very friendly and helpful (and spoke English!). (Be sure to check out "La Cantina" just a short walk away-the best Osteria!)

Reviews.Title: “If you really wanna feel...”
Reviews.Author: Valicore
Reviews.Content: like you're in a royal Venice, try this. It is absolutely beautiful, with its own private dock with a door you could walk out and fall in the Grand Canal. I'm a twenty something year old and I brought my parents (mid 60s) to Italy as a gift, this is one of the places we stayed and of all the hotels in Italy it was their favorite. They felt pampered and special! Just as a note, the closest "bus" stop is CÃ  d'Oro, and if you get a water taxi, it is a little past CÃ  d'Oro, just mention the hotel name.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was lovely..front desk staff very rude”
Reviews.Author: ocmdwarrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at he Foscari Palace at the end of our Med cruise. Our orginal hotel had a water main break and sent us there. The front desk staff were just horrible and made us feel very unwelcome. The hotel is wonderful but Tatiana treated us so poorly, I would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: PortsmouthJulie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having read the Tripadvisor recommendations and were glad we did. Great location, right next to the Vaporetto station and Gondola crossing and a few feet from shops, restaurants and osterias. Staff were friendly and helpful, the classic double room was spacious, had a luxurious feel and was well equipped with everything you'd expect from a 4" hotel. The buffet breakfast served in a small dining room was extensive and really set you up for the day - everything from smoked salmon, scrambled eggs to custard filled croissants! My other half went back for seconds and third helpings every day! If you go in warmer months there is a fantastic roof terrace and bar on top of the hotel which overlooks the Grand Canal. Perfect for chilling after a days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location in a wonderful, bling free zone”
Reviews.Author: Maija63
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace surpassed all our expectations. The hotel's website didn't really do much to sell the place, but we booked it on the basis of availability and reviews on Trip Adviser. We were not disappointed. Forget those hidous sofa chairs you see all over the place on the website - the Foscari Palace is so much more elegant than that. We arrived by water taxi from the airport (the cheapest place to park if you are driving), and came directly to the hotel. It was a wonderful arrival. The staff were welcoming, efficient and knowledgeable. Our room had high ceilings, was spotless, and was tastefully decorated. Not a crimpeline covered sofa chair or needless piece of bling to be seen. The mini bar was wonderfully stocked and not ridiculously priced. The highlight however was the view from our room, which was absolutely stunning - direct onto the Grand Canal. We paid slightly extra to secure the superior double room overlooking the Canal, and it was well worth it. It was stunning. The bathroom was equipped with a jacuzzi bath with multiple direction spray in the shower - much too complicated for we simpletons, but appreciated nevertheless. Room service came twice a day, and we were always stocked up with lots of clean towels. The breakfast was very good, with something for everyone. I liked the fact that the staff were present when we were there, as we could always ask them for things that we needed. (Unlike other hotels with five stars where we have had to go looking for them!) Much has been written in other reviews about the location of the Hotel, and they are all spot on. The Foscari Palace is in an excellent location, and it offers exceptional value for money and a level of service which belies its four star status. It is a gem. As a general tip for Venice, we used the 'Time Out' guide to Venice and Verona, and used it for recommendations for everything from sight seeing to restaurants. It was invaluable. Look out for the famous and highly rated 'Alla Vedoca' bacari (winebar/restaurant) located not five minutes from the Foscari Palace - you must book a table in advance for the evenings, and you will see why. THE best meatballs in Venice, and very tasty pasta. The atmosphere is fantastic. Deservedly famous, so 'Time Out' says, and indeed it is. The other main benefit is that you only need to walk five minutes to be back at the hotel! Go and enjoy......

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DawnJOhannesburg
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to a traghetto stop and very close to a vaporetto stop. Very friendly staff, and wonderful breakfast. Room was clean , modern and spacious with a super bathroom. Only complaint is that there is not 24hour kitchen (room service), and also no facilities in the room for coffee/tea making.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to imagine a better choice....”
Reviews.Author: pennsyguy
Reviews.Content: Where can I start? Large, spotless room (OK, I had a junior suite, but it was huge). Absolutely perfect location, with a traghetto stop right outside the front door, and a vaporetto stop mere steps away. An easy 15 minute walk to San Marco, with many great restaurants even closer. Right on the Grand Canal, directly across from the fish market. It's not the cheapest hotel, no doubt, but you surely get your money's worth. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with outstanding view on rooftop”
Reviews.Author: ca-beau
Reviews.Content: Just a short (I do mean short with 3 pieces of luggage at 23 kilos) walk from the water taxi stop Ca'd'oro which happens to be very centrally located to all the musuems and sights. A few stops from Rialto, and a few more from San Marco. The room was nice and clean. The rooftop view is outstanding for sunset. You can see everywhere around you and you get to socialize with others staying at the hotel. You can get a drink from the downstairs bar or go get sangria ahead of time (see below). Don't open the windows unless you want mosquitoes in your room. With all the water surrounding you in Venice, this really is no surprise. The breakfast had lots of options but the staff stands around and watches you while you choose your food and you eat. Very strange.........the toast and pancakes were not warm and the yogurt not cold. Other than that all was good and I would stay here again. The gondolas (80 euro for an hour with more charged for music and singing,etc)are right outside the door but we opted for the water taxi instead. The glass jewelry made by ZAGO and MOLIN is over 3 bridges to the left of the hotel and carries the best designs that we seen of Murano Glass jewelry. We also went to see the opera "La Traviata" at Gran Teatro La Fenice ( a must in Venice). Also, don't miss the largest painting in the world at Palazzo Ducale .."Paraisio". For the best Sangria go over the first 2 bridges left of the hotel. On the right side you will find a stand that has fresh yogurt and fruit that also makes great fruit cocktails and AWESOME Sangria (10 euro for large). We went there every evening for that sangria! When leaving, definitely take the bus to the airport (2.50 euro ACTV)instead of the boat (100 euro or $150 american). I will try to add photos later.........

Reviews.Title: “High standards throughout”
Reviews.Author: sussexblogger
Reviews.Content: from the moment we arrived the young staff at the Foscari Palace wowed us with their professionalism and helpful attitude. The building is fantastic, and the employees match its awesome image in their attebtion to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service to match!”
Reviews.Author: billiepiper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a wonderful week at the Palace. All of the positive reviews about this hotel are accurate. The breakfast really is excellent. The bacon was just right every morning - I've never tasted better outside the UK. No other meals are served during the day but in the late afternoon complementary aperitifs and biscuits were available. One evening there was a Cocktail Party with music from a young harpist and excellent refreshments - no charge. The whole hotel was spotless and all the staff always did their best to make our stay memorable. A good example of this hotel's attention to detail took place on a sunny afternoon on the roof terrace. We had moved from the upper terrace (amazing views along the Grand Canal) to the cooler lower terrace after other guests left the area. The waiter was there in seconds to clear and clean the table and replace the table cloth he also apologised for the delay! Every evening the window shutters were closed, towels changed, for the second time that day, the bed would be turned down and fresh covers placed over the rugs at each side of the bed. This really is how all hotels should run! The location was excellent allowing easy access to the Traghetto over to the Rialto market and the Ca' d' Oro Waterbus stop was only 2 mins away. Do pay the extra for a superior room it is nearly twice the size of a standard room and it only cost us about 10% more. We have stayed in other hotels in Venice but when in a few year's time we return to this wonderful city it will be to the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in perfect location for a special stay”
Reviews.Author: JayneWiltshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and my mum and partner for one night as we wanted a special treat after our Med. cruise. This hotel really did hit the spot for us as we were sad to leave our cruise ship! Our rooms were on the first floor (there are two lifts) and I had chosen one with canal view for my mum which was just fantastic, it had two windows overlooking the market opposite and up the canal. The rooms are beautifully furnished and very large compared to our previous stay near the Rialto bridge. Our room was also very spacious with two windows with little balconys enough to stand on and view from. We took a water taxi to the hotel and arrived at the door greeted by bell man who was so efficient and welcoming as were the reception staff who spoke good english too. The reception area is lovely, there is a very nice lounge with comfortable sofas where we were also invited to have 'nibbles and a drink' in the early eveing, a very nice touch. There is also a separate smaller bar. The staff chatted with us in the evening in the lounge and were very informative of the hotels history, it was cool and looked out over the canal. However, on the top of the hotel is also a wonderful roof terrace, we loved it! Foscari Palace is expensive, but most of the hotels in Venice are, but you really do get what you pay for at the Foscari, it is definately a luxury hotel. You can take the gondola crossing right outside the hotel (50cents pp) over to the market which is amazing for fish and veg and makes you wish you were self catering! We ate at the 'a la Vecia Cavana' resturant, a card given to us in the hotel, however I would not recommend this resturant, it was very expensive and we did not find the staff at all friendly. For our lunch the next day we went back to the first riverside resturant (but they are all good) by the Rialto bridge (we had eaten here often on our previous visit) and had the most amazing lunch with excellent wine and really nice waiters, all you need to do is keep smiling, try a few words in Italian and they will serve you very well, all afternoon, and what a view! The sweets were possibly the best I have had, definately the best tiramisu/chocolate cake and wild strawberry fruit cup to 'die' for and calamari excellent. If you can afford that bit extra to stay at the Foscari Palace you will not be dissapointed, I cannot wait to go back and would definately stay here again (husbands wallet permitting!).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Gorgeous View in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Harlaxton0530
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in early July, 2009 for our honeymoon. We were pleasantly surprised when on the first night of our stay the hotel had a cocktail party for all the guests, complete with appetizers, mimosas, and a harpist. We had a gorgeous view of the Grand Canale from our Terrace of our hotel room, and the room itself was very spacious, clean, modern, and kept cool with air conditioning. Being centrally located, the hotel was a 2 minute walk from the Ca ' D Oro water taxi station (very convenient) and a 15 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. Highly recommend this hotel for honeymooners like us, or somebody looking for a nice place to stay with great views of the Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Foscari”
Reviews.Author: Val J
Reviews.Content: My (nearly 80 year old) mother and I stayed here for 5 nights and were overjoyed with our choice. Our room, with two balconies over-looking the quiet street and grand canal was spotless, perfertly air-conditioned, with fresh fruits, water, mini-bar, fluffy towels/robes and night-time chocolates. As well at the morning clearn, the room was re-visited and tidied each evening. The roof terrace was a perfect early evening retreat where you could sit and watch the comings and goings along the Grande Canal or rooftops and nearby streets. The staff were professional, personable and very helpful. They were happy to answer any of our questions or have a chat about what we had been doing. The breakfast was a wonderful array of many things.. hot and cold.. and plenty to choose from. We were treated to a Cocktail party one night, with complementry nibbles and bucks fizz.. and a very talented Harpist. (which she then loaded on a trolley to wheel back through the narrow streets to her home) All main locations are near to the hotel and the Valperetto stop a couple of mins walk away. There are plenty of eateries and little shops just around from the door. Trip advisor helped me find this gem.. and my mum and I were in no way disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Duckanddickie
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful stay celebrating a family member 60th birthday. The reception staff were extremely helpful. The rooms were good size and view of the courtyard. The bar was not open past 8pm during our stay which was a bit of a shame when after dinner we would have liked to have chatted over a drink. This was probably because it was not peak season. March was a great time to go, we had t-shirt weather and could get into all of the sites without any queuing. Bring your walking shoes! We did 9 miles the first day without realising! We would definately suggest trying restaurants off the main walk through. Murano Island is a must! The sculptures are amazing. Fantastic Holiday and would recommend the hotel to my closest friends.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in La Serenissima”
Reviews.Author: Willjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace in June and found none of the faults that some of the previous Reviewers found. The staff were very helpful, the room we had was perfect and included a small enclosed terrace which was great to sit out in during the evening before we headed out to dinner - this is room 301 if you can get it. As noted by others the location is perfect, very close to a number of restaurants and shops and away from the busier areas. We caught the Alilaguna blue line boat from the airport to the Fondamente Nouve stop and it's not far from there to the hotel. We also got the 72hour water bus ticket and that was well used. The restaurant Casa Mia mentioned by others is good and I would certainly recommend it - it was closed Monday to Wednesday when we were there. A very enjoyable stay in this hotel and Venice was magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Service, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: iloveshmoolie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, June 10-13. The location was perfect, on the Grand Canal, right next to the vaporetto stop and the traghetto. The Rialto Market was directly across the street and can be reached by traghetto in a minute. The hotel was beautiful and clean. The room was adequate size with a nice bathroom and bed. The shower is a little complicated to work, but also has a tub and worked fine. The service was excellent, everyone went out of their way to help us and answer all our questions. The breakfast was nice and the rooftop terrace was amazing! Overall it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SLS006
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Foscari Palace. The hotel is very nicely decorated and clean. The fruit basket provided upon arrival was wonderful. We splurged on the canal-front suite on the second floor and are very glad we did. It is a huge, amazing room with unbeatable views of the canal, gondolas, and the vaporettos going back and forth all day. Our friends stayed in the other canal-view room on the second floor. It is much smaller but still nice. We enjoyed the rooftop terrace, although we were scolded for taking our own food (they don't serve food, just drinks). It was not like there were people waiting for a table (even though there are only 4) and I don't understand why the hotel wouldn't be happy to have their guests enjoy a picnic on the terrace (or at the very least note the prohibition). My only other complaint is that the breakfast room is inadequate. The food is good but it is very cramped and one (out of 2) mornings we had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. The staff is helpful but quite formal. It is easy enough to walk to St. Mark's Square and other attractions, once you get your bearings. Overall, we were pleased with our selection of the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and breakfast; beds are a bit hard though”
Reviews.Author: barne123
Reviews.Content: This is just the kind of hotel we were hoping to find in Venice - away from the big crowds, but still beautiful, updated, and very walkable to all the big sights. Right on the Grand Canal - with gondoliers outside, and a water bus stop just around the next building. We had a lovely (superior double) room with a balcony and a partial view of the canal. we loved that balcony. The air conditioning worked sufficiently. The breakfast was delicious. our only complaints are that the beds were (typically) very firm...and that when we booked online, the picture showed 2 beds in the room...but there was only a king bed when we arrived. Make sure you call and request 2 beds if you want them. Otherwise a wonderful stay. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: AndyP1961
Reviews.Content: Got a real good price as was off season and we were very impressed, great location, right on the Grand Canal, very stylish and great staff. Good breakfast too. If it's in your budget then go!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated hotel - but very poor service.”
Reviews.Author: LWTWisconsin
Reviews.Content: A nice looking hotel in a good location, but looks are not everything. Room was clean and breakfast was fine. After that we don't have much good to say. Bed was very hard. The air conditioning did not work the first night of our stay. There was a new clerk (first day on the job) at the front desk on our second day who had obviously received no training and knew very little about the hotel. We left a note at the front desk for our friend also staying in the hotel who never received the message. Upon check out the front desk clerk did not even ask us how our stay was or say thank you or good bye.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent postion, room with no view, but hey, who stays in their room when in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: antiquatedanne
Reviews.Content: Trip started off badly, googled Foscari Palace and walked to it from the airport bus only to find we arrived at the University - so a bit of a walk from there to the hotel. The hotel was lovely, although the room had no view, only the opposite wall across the narrow alleyway, it was very quiet (we have previously stayed in a hotel with the room overlooking the Grand Canal and it was very noisy), it was a good size, beautifully clean with a super bathroom (once we worked out how to operate the rather complicated shower system). The only minor complaint is that this shower unit is along the side of the bath rather than the end, which meant there wasn't very much room! We found the reception staff lovely, the breakfast staff were professional which I suppose some could find unfriendly, but it suited us as we didn't really want to start a conversation with them! Breakfast was fantastic, something for everyone. We were there for 5 nights and enjoyed it immensely. As a previous contributor said, I too had trouble with the hotel internet connection, although was able to link into someone's wireless router, and so didn't pursue it with the hotel. I needed electric conversion plugs and they kindly lent me one. The location is wonderfully central, Strada Nuovo, the main street from the station to St Marks runs behind the hotel and is full of shops and restaurants, the waterbus stop a Ca D'Oro is just one alley along (Ca D'Oro itself is worth a visit), so all the sights are within easy reach. To show what a dipstick I am, I left some clothes behind in the wardrobe! I asked them if they had been found, they had and they sent them to me. So full marks! Thank you Foscari, I hope I will be back in the not too distant future - at least I will know where to walk to!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lostinatlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during our honeymoon and the hotel was absolutely wonderful. The manager even upgraded our room free of charge. We had a large room looking out on the Grand Canal. I would highly recommend w/o reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: dodmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. Our second visit to Venice and the Foscari made it a very special trip. We stayed in a Deluxe room looking out onto the Campo. If you lent out of the window (just a little) you could see the Grand Canal in all its glory. Room very clean, quiet and well equipped. All the staff were fine and there was a super breakfast.
