To top it all, it has the most wonderful rooftop terrace with phenominal views. Drinks are also amazingly reasonable for a hotel of this quality. Great location - directly opposite the Railto market and with a Traghetto stop at the door, which, at 50 cents a trip, was better than a gondola. Great local restaurant, the trattoria Casa Mia and a fantastic Bacaro/Chichetti bar about 500 yards from the Rialto market, Ostaria Daizemei. The owner is great fun and the bar is adorned with photos of twins (I guess he is one himself). Wine is super and chichetti (tapas) is brilliant. Foscari Palce deserves its high rating and we would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A absolutely beautiful place to stay on the Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelingFamily
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to book a deluxe room at the Hotel Foscari Palace on the Grand Canal, just north of Rialto,( very near the Ca dâ€™Oro vaporetto stop). It truly is one of the most beautifully romantic buildings on the canal and is just as lovely within -- it would be hard to find a more perfect location! It's so near to everything! The Rialto market is literally right across the Canal -- just a quick traghetti ride away (for less than half a euro!) We splurged on a watertaxi from Marco Polo airport (approx 85 euros) and were totally thrilled by the trip â€“ what a way to enter the city! We were dropped off directly in front of the hotel at Campo San Sofia and felt like royalty! Our room was beautiful and very comfortable -- and even had a lovely â€œpartial viewâ€�, but every guest has access to the fabulous rooftop deck where you can enjoy the sun and catch a beautiful panoramic view of the rooftops of the city! The staff were very professional, helpful and speak great English. Breakfast was terrific! Very extensive, especially by Italian standards, as it includes scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, as well as fresh fruit and wonderful croissants! Even baked beans! (which made my English husband very happy.) Honestly, I'm not sure why other reviewers had any issues. Even the showers, which some have mentioned as problematic, turned out to be quite manageable (as long as you turned the left handle first to eliminate the extra shower heads.) Another issue mentioned is the lack of wifi -- but there is an inexpensive cyber cafe minutes away enroute to Rialto and there is actually free wifi at the McDonalds a block away. We would absolutely recommend this hotel â€“ we thoroughly loved our stay! It is one of the real gems of Venice (at probably half the price of a 4-star hotel in San Marco.)

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointed with Foscari”
Reviews.Author: MarnieM
Reviews.Content: Our room was small and our window opened out onto an alley that ran to the Canal (which we could not see from our room). The internet did not work, staff were a bit aloof--almost suspicious, not too fluent in English. They gave us a very good recommendation for restaurant though--Algiubagio, along the Fondamenta Nuove, near the Jesuit church. That restaurant had the most delicious food we've had in this Italian trip. Breakfast was very good, the Filipino staff were friendly but almost shy, therefore, did not initiate any help, like offer more coffee, etc. The room had all the amenities, which was a plus--bits of chocolate, toothbrush, nice soaps, etc. The plush robes helped as it was very cold during our stay there. Venice is lovely no matter what, so it's a good thing the hotel did not matter too much.

Reviews.Title: “Fugazzi Palace rip off”
Reviews.Author: danasbox
Reviews.Content: Great location, view of the grande canal and breakfast, it ends there. After checking in I was really disappointed to get a deluxe grande canal view room and find two twin beds. To add insult to injury the beds were made separately and pushed together. So much for my romantic Valentines surprise in Venice. There were no other rooms to offer and they did not seem to care. They did not offer make them into one bed. That was when I lost my good attitude. I had reserved a deluxe grande cannel view double room and it was expensive. Check out is at 11am and the woman would not give us even 30 min. I'm sure it takes four hours to turn that room around. As the staff was self absorbed. I was told that if I was late they would take my bags out of the room. They also schooled me and told me I could not take a coffee to my room. No coffee in the room? Is this a boarding school or a hotel? The shower was a disaster as well. So many things going on there and none working well... Leave those showers to Tokyo. I thought by the reviews that this was going to be a nice place. It was clean and well located. But after staying one day I see that it needs a good manager that knows how to service it's customers and will get some new staff that isn't so rude to the hard working cash spending guests. Take the Palace away and all you have left is Fugazzi... If the manager wants to send me a note of reply, no thanks, I will be happy to just have a refund.

Reviews.Title: “The Foscari Palace is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: mdlighthill
Reviews.Content: My family of five (parents plus three teens) stayed here over New Years. We had two adjoining rooms, an outrageously ornate and fabulous double room overlooking the Grand Canal, and a large double with a roll away added. The ceilings in these rooms must have been 12 feet tall. The decor really added to our overall venetian experience. The staff is very helpful with restaurant reservations and directions. The breakfast was delicious and varied; definately worth getting up for. The location is conveniently close to all the major site - just a brief walk away. It's a wonderful small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jc2k2000l
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back from a 3 night stay at the Foscari Palace and it was excellent. We were only supposed to be there for two nights, but due to London shutting down for a day because of the snow, had to extend our stay by an extra night. The location is perfect, really easy to find from the bus station, just walk over the new bridge and keep going the same direction until you see the hotel. It's located to the east of the city, not far from the Rialto and right next to the Ca D'oro museum and Vaporetto stop, so you can get to most places really quickly and once you've got your bearings getting around the city is easy. The staff were lovely, really helpful. Our room was right at the top so we have a good view and a little balcony. It was a large room for Venice and had everything you need - shower takes a bit of working out though as it is very complicated and a little cramped. This is the second time we have been to Venice and can highly recommend the hotel. There is a lovely restaurant just round the corner on the Strada Nova that is our favourite for great value and food. If you want a more exclusive but wonderful meal try the Olivio Nero (Black Olive) very pricey but utterly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A+ !”
Reviews.Author: d16rr702
Reviews.Content: Excellent in too many ways to explain. Water taxi from the airport to the Hotel canal entrance is the only way to go! Stayed room 201, excellent canal view with little balcony that works ok for smoking; Excellent Euro and Filipino staff ! ! ! This hotel needs a Star Trek "transporter" so I can come here once a year for the rest of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: camcanknit
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Foscari Palace. Great location and wonderful hotel. I booked our stay because of recommendations on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. I'm hard to please so take it from me...you'll love it! Foscari Palace is located right on the Grand Canal. Has a nice breakfast every morning and the bathroom was great. The room was a little on the small side but that is not abnormal for Europe and the bed was comfortable. We also enjoyed the flat screen TV.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Venice”
Reviews.Author: Alan36Scotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Junior Suite Room 209 for our honeymoon weekend 8 November 2008. We could only book this particular room through the hotel website as the hotel does not allow this specific room to be booked through all internet travel sites. Points to pass on: 1. Location, Location, Location - after walking most of Venice the location of this Hotel could not be better for what we wanted. The hotel is a one minute walk from a Water Taxi stop and 50 yards from one of the nicest main streets - but quiet enough. 2. Room - right on the Grand Canal with three windows - two of which have small balconies - able to experience all the sights and sounds of Vernice at work, rest and play. 3. Breakfast was excellent. Staff very helpful and friendly. 4. Hotel was spotless and efficient in all the ways that we could have imagined and wanted. 5. General - with Venice having a high price tag anyway and the pound in the basement at the moment - reasonable prices can still be found of the main tourist routes. 6. One special location - we took a water taxi to Murano [small Venice] and stopped off at San Michele Cemetry - you are probably thinking strange visit for a honeymoon - but unless you see it I cannot begin to explain why it was so special!!! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, upscale service”
Reviews.Author: Isabel56
Reviews.Content: We had booked another hotel for our stay, but the bathrooms were so small you'd hardly fit, so we walked over to check out this hotel on the recommendation of a neighbor who had stayed there same time last year, and loved it. We immediately booked it for the one night we would be staying after the cruise. The hotel was beautiful, the rooms spacious, very clean, with a flat screen tv. The bathrooms were huge even by American standards, with marble floor to ceiling, and jetted tub and bidet. All the extra goodiies, such as toothpast, toothbrush, shaving kit, etc., included. At nights, not only was the bed turned down, but a small pieece of cloth (a sort of small, thin carpet) was placed next toe bed, so that your bare feet wouldn't touch the floor. In addition there were robes and slippers. The eating room, where we had breakfast had white tablecloths, white cloth napkins, real silverware, beautidul monogrammed plates, bowls, cups and glasses. The breakfast was very diverse, with beautiful serving pieces, and included all types of pastries, cold cereals, milk, juices, eggs, bacon, tarts, sausages, oatmeal, teas and coffee. Overall, this hotel is a delight in the perfect location nearthe Grand canal, and within waking distace to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: stesuec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Foscari Palace for 2 nights as a birthday treat for her. The hotel is perfectly located just yards away from the water bus stop and a short stroll from the Rialto bridge. We had a superior room on the 3rd floor with side views of the Grand Canal. The room was wonderful with a large modern bathroom and plenty of wardrobe space ( if you need it). We found all the staff at the hotel to be attentive and friendly. The only drawback is the size of the tables in the dining room. The way they are laid, you can seat 3 people at the most, which wasn't a problem for us but it was for others staying at the hotel with friends. All in all, this is a first class hotel and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: roseoakhil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace for 3 nights at the very beginning of october. Its a very beautiful hotel that has to be said is in a really great location for exploring venice, close to all the sights yet not right in the thick of it. The water bus stop is 2 mins walk away and the tronchetto (?spelling) crossing stops right outside the hotel door to so you dont need to walk down to Riatlo to cross the river. The Foscari Palace deserves to be well rated on trip advisor as it does exactly what it needs to provide a good standard of accommodation in the right place, its an excellent 4 star hotel but it didn't blow me away for the price (but then venice is expensive on the whole, the euro rate doesnt help) so i wont use words like exceptional or amazing to describe it. The staff overall were good, one man in particular who served us drinks was very friendly but i found it hit and miss with some of the staff on the reception rota, they could be a little sullen and getting any good quality information in relation to your questions proved a little difficult, language being quite a barrier with some. From start to finish however we never had any problems with the hotel. Check in was very quick and hassle free despite not checking in till 10 at night. Our room 304 was very good and better then i thought having only booked a superior double. Rooms have ample space, large wardrobes with real coat hangers (unlike most places now), defiantly one of the better equipped hotels i have stayed at, mini bar, flat screen tv etc. We also had a little balcony with side grand canal view which even though i knew we would have a partial view never thought we would have a balcony. The bathroom was very well equipped i have never seen so much personalized toiletries (its didnt stop there everything had a foscari palace stamp on it, stay here and you will see what i mean) its certainly funny, there is even a built in radio (1 station) in the bathroom. The bed was comfy however we only had 1 pillow on each side of the bed and 1 spare which i found uncomfortable as we both sleep with 2 pillows each. Breakfast spread was very varied plenty of continental choice, perhaps one of the best breakfast spreads i have seen in any hotel in europe. There was a selection of hot food in buffet style heated servers but im not keen on eating from them id rather it was cooked fresh, by partner partook in some hot food which he found to be fine but it all just looked rubbery to me. An interesting note which i wasn't expecting is there are alot and i mean alot of bell towers in venice of which 3 are in close enough proximity to the hotel to wake you up in the morning as they rung, i suppose it woke me up the 1st day as i wasn't expecting it but i soon got used to them. There are some lovely sitting areas downstairs in reception and a small bar, the best part as im sure anyone reading this has seen enough pictures of and one of the main reasons we booked this hotel is the roof terrace, the view is stunning and it makes for such a relaxing place to sit. We ordered our drinks downstairs at the bar and he delivered them up to us (which i felt very guilty about), by the looks of it there is a small bar upstairs which i think they must open when it is busy in the height of summer im not sure. A views notes about venice,restaurants,experiences. Venice was stunning, i have never been before so didnt really know what to expect, its something out of a picture book. We got to the hotel very easily number 5 bus from the airport (included in the vaperetto pass, defiantly buy one of these for the duration of your stay) then from piazzo roma took the water bus number 1 to ca d'oro then its a walk down the alley at the water bus stop turn right then 1st right and theres the hotel easy!!! The water bus system is so easy to use and it gets you everywhere. We did all the main sights st mark square (including the most ridiculous priced cafes in the square you have ever some across but it has to be done you live once!), Gondola trip, Harrys Bar, Murano island, Grand canal boat tour, Walking tour and trip out of venice to the hill towns both with Aventure Bellissime (great tour company to use, really happy with there service). Take a trip across to the market opposite the hotel its such an experience seeing all the fresh fish and vegetables. Restaurant wise despite being in venice for 3 nights we truly only had 2 as we arrived late the 1st night, both nights we ate close to the hotel Casa Mia - great food, very simple restaurant, lots of locals and very cheap. Its just behind the hotel but i cant give instructions as to where, as we walked round in circles to find it despite how close it was. Al Fontego del Pescaori - probably the best fish restaurant i have ever been to, a little pricey but what a place, if you turn left onto the main street behind the hotel then take the right down the alleyway before the next bridge you arrive at it about 25 meters later on the left handside, its got metal gates at the entrance and only a small wooden sign with the name on it, booking is advisable. Overall i loved venice and 3 nights was not enough by a long shot. I would certainly stay at the Foscari Palace again should i go back.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nic58
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Forscari Palace and I can't praise it highly enough! Location, Room, Breakfast- all just perfect.Although this is an expensive hotel we were surprised at how reasonable the bar and mini-bar prices were! Would love to go back some day!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, But First Class!!”
Reviews.Author: Awarnach
Reviews.Content: Booked this site after reading the great reviews and we aswell were left extremely pleased with our stay at Foscari palace. Although we only stayed for 1 night in Venice, we didn't really geta chance to enjoy the hotel facilities fully, however the room was fantastic, very spacious, clean and tidy with modern facilities. we have never seen a shower/bath with so many different options and modern settings (jets, hoses and bubbles from all angles!). This hotel cost us 259 Euro for 1 night, a little expensive, but after staying here.. well worth it. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk to the Rialto bridge and 15-20min walk to St Marks Square, which are easy to find from the hotel. Best of all the Water Taxi drops you off right outside the front door, right on the grand canal!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: gordonandivy
Reviews.Content: We stayed August 2008 for 5 nights. After reading reviews on trip advisor,I booked the hotel as a special treat for my husbands birthday. The hotel was absolutely wonderful, our room was huge, well furnished and spotless, they had kindly upgraded us. We arrived by private water taxi right up to the hotels front door it was our first time in venice and the experience was amazing. The hotels location was perfect, it was only a short walk to St Marks Square. We had an amazing Holiday and my husband had a birthday he will always remember. Thank you to all the staff at FOSCARI PALACE.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: Woodbine13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and cannot think of a more delightful location to be in Venice. The accomodation was excellent and the whole bulding was well presented. It seemed to encapsulate the feeling of a grander age yet offered the comfort and convenience of a modern hotel. We particularly enjoyed the hotel's roof terrace which overlooks the Grand Canal. Early in the morning you can get a birds eye view of the canal being used by the Venitians to service the hotels and other commercial interests and it is an incredible hive of activity. Later in the day the you can watch the canal give itself over to the visitors when the gondolas, water taxis and water buses are the main canal users. Many of the famous Venitian sights are within comfortable walking distance of the Foscari Palace and there is a Traghetto (a gondola converted to carry passengers cheaply across the canal), situated right outside the hotel's main entrance so you can visit other places of interest without having to use one of the Grand Canal bridges, the Rialto being the nearest. This hotel was definitely part of the Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Folrida_bound
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights to celebrate my wife's birthday. Both of us had a wonderful time at the Foscari Palace and in Venice. The staff could not do enough for us and were at all times curteous and attentive without being too intrusive. The breakfasts were very good with a good selection of cooked food (for us British) , but also a good selection of fresh fruit, cereals and cold meats for our more continental cousins. The hotel was within easy walking of some excellent restaurants. Out of the Hotel to the end of the street and right, takes you to the Strada Nova where you will find Trattoria Da Gianni - it looks just like you would expect an Italian restaurant to look and the food is very good and reasonably priced. However, our favourite place was south on the Strada Nova, turn left at the end and first left into a narrow alley called 'C d Oca'. There you will find Trattoria Casa Mia, which looks a little basic but is in fact used by local Venecians, which simply adds to the charm and character of the restaurant. The food is absolutely fabulous, as is the local wine and to top it off, it is very reasonably priced. We had tried other restaurants closer to the more touristy parts of Venice but the rule seemed to be that the closer you got to Piazza San Marco, the worse the food got and the the higher the prices got. Overall, the Foscari Palace is perfectly placed for transport around Venice; for walking to the main tourist sites; for good local restaurants; and for attentive and welcoming staff, with a high standard of comfort and convenience within the hotel. We had a wonderful time and will definately return to the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Les57
Reviews.Content: A great location with unbelievable views. We had a Jr Suite with 2 balconies overlooking the Grand Canal. We did not want to leave the room. We found that we got the lowest price by booking direct via email with the hotel. Every thing was just a short walk including San Marco Sq, The ghetto and of course the Reallto bridge. Al I can say is perfect, perfect perfect !!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: emberito
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully appointed hotel in an excellent location right on the Grand Canal in Venice. Be warned if you booked and are arriving on Vaparetto, which is real easy and convenient: There was no information on the hotel website about what Vaparetto stop to get off at. We got off at the Rialto with baggage and ended up walking a real long way when we would have only been minutes away . Get off at C'Da Oro stop. It is VERY close. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. THey all spoke excellent English and were accommodating. The room was large (European standards) and there was a fruit basket and water bottles waiting for us when we arrived. The bed was exquisite, with high thread count linens, soft pillows and down comforters. Our room didn't have much of a view but given the views from the roof top and the views from the lobby, we were satisfied. We weren't willing to spend THAT much more to upgrade to a suite over looking the grand canal. The only thing we were disappointed with in our room was the fact that the bathroom was so small and the shower was uncomfortable. While they clearly spent a lot of money to remodel the hotel, including the bathrooms, the way the shower head was positioned was problematic because the water got everywhere and there was little room to move around. Breakfast is good but not great. I was expecting more from a hotel of this caliber. However, it wouldn't dissuade me from staying at the hotel. The location is great: It is a relatively short walk to S. Marks, to many restaurants, and shopping. As mentioned before, the hotel is extremely close to the Vapareto stop. Furthermore, it is right on the grand canal. I would certainly stay there again if I were returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Venice at is best”
Reviews.Author: MEAFaro
Reviews.Content: I have been in Venice 20 years ago and i stayed in Mestre. I decide then that my next visite would be in one hotel with the spirit off Venice. And this is the one. In a Venitian Palace, a huge room beautiful decorated, a huge bathroom with all conforts. And off couse "the view" from our window directly to the Grand Canal and the Rialto bridge. Room 201 is a excelent value for money in Venice - 3 persons 300 euros per room per nigth with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Canal luxury”
Reviews.Author: Incoming11
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotels on the Grand Canal and a very nice stay indeed. Luxury fittings and a balcony with sideways views of the Grand Canal. Decent enough value in a city where even value itself carries a premium It is mercifully just off the main walking thoroughfare between the station and St Marks Square so you can escape the throngs of tourists. Nearby are some lesser explored areas of Venice also which offer some peace and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Foscari Palace......a jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Venicelover64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace shortly after it opened. The hotel is absolutely beautiful! The staff was so friendly and accommodating. The room was lovely and comfortable. The breakfast is served in a very elaborate, and elegant fashion. There was more than enough choice. The location is good because as a tourist we were able to see more of the local people walking and then stopping to chat. There were many restaurants to choose from. We stayed again about a year later and were equally impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: notacollegestudent
Reviews.Content: I am so happy that I found this hotel for our stay in Venice. My husband and I have been to Venice many times with our visitors to Italy (we live here) but have always stayed in various hotels and never liking where we've stayed. This has changed and I can definitely say that we will come back here. The rooms were great, the price was right, the staff was friendly and the location was.....what can I say....right on Canal Grande!!!! What views. We stayed in the classic double room and it was perfect. The beds were really comfortable and the air conditioning was perfect after a hot day in Venice. I had read that people had problems with the high tech shower....it's not high tech and easy to use. For those who might read this, just turn the tap on the left side of the shower all the way to the right and the different sprays will come on.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: soshbfly
Reviews.Content: As many other reviews start, I booked this hotel based on the reviews read here. I was a bit skeptical that the place would be as nice as described, but I can say that was! I'm an American living in the UK and I travel ALL the time through Europe for work, so I'm knowledgeable about the standard of rooms and was so surprised that this was only a 3-star (must be for the lack of a real restaurant and spa stuff.) The location is more than Ideal. I've stayed in Venice before and stayed in the same general area - about a 7 minute walk to the Rialto, 15 minutes to St. Mark's and 2 minutes to the Vaparetto stop (and that was with my Mom who's not the most fit.) This was a gift for my Mom and her first trip to Italy so I splurged on the Junior Suite on the 3rd floor and I'm so glad i did. It was very comfortable - two TVs, a sitting area, and a very generous patio area. It was easy to walk up to the "bar" which offered a very picturesque view of the Grand Canal. Our room had NO view unless you lean out into the mini-canal bordering the room and you can glimpse the grand canal. There were plenty of plugs, an easy spot to get ready, good lighting, great shower, and PLENTY of toiletries. Breakfast was yummy (and even though there were no coffee-making facilities - my PET PEEVE - you could ring down and they would be bring coffee up at no charge.) The front desk was generally helpful, but not always the most polite :) There was only one man that seemed to brush me off a bit, but I did ask a LOT of questions. There was one staff member who was very helpful (curly hair and blue eyes... his name escapes me.) Every restaurant they recommended (from across the spectrum... casual to VERY nice) was absolutely spot on. All-in-all, I would recommend it and would definitely stay again (and even in the same room!)

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of Venice”
Reviews.Author: sussexguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Gonzaga Suite, Room 209 for 2 nights Great sized room with 2 small balconies overlooking the Grand Canal Could have spent the whole day gazing at the wonderful scene below. It was interesting how the crowds on vaporetto No. 1 kept waving at us and taking pictures as if we were celebrities. Lovely modern room - huge bed plus huge marble bath room. Hotel does not have own restaurant but who cares with so much choice outside. However, the breakfast room is very small and the choice was a bit restricted. The saturday evening free champagne reception with harpist made up for it - but get there early to bag a seat. Ridiculously expensive but worth every penny. Overdid it with a farcically expensive water taxi at Euro 95 from the airport, but soon got the hang of dirt cheap vaporetto 1 service every 10 mins from Ca D'Oro stage one block from Foscari Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: travelmomABC
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first trip to Venice and my first time booking a hotel based primarily on TripAdvisor reviews, so I was quite apprehensive of what to expect of the Foscari Palace. I really need not have worried at all. The place fulfilled all my expectations and more. We requested 2 rooms for our family of 6, and were given 2 spacious rooms (Superior Doubles) across from each other. Both rooms had windows facing the street alongside the hotel, but we could still see the canal from our windows. I must also add that views are really not an issue at this hotel, since it is located right on the canal. Step outside the lobby and it's right there. Staying at a place directly on the canal is definitely a big plus. We did not have to drag our suitcases up and down those (in)famous Venice bridges, as we saw many many other people had to do. Having prepared myself for small cramped rooms in a place like Venice, the size of these rooms were truly a pleasant surprise. Both of them comfortably accommodated an extra rollaway bed. Bathrooms were also large and well furnished. I loved the overall cozy feel of the hotel, probably because of its relatively small size. It felt like staying at a nice (and wealthy) friend's home. During our 2-nights stay there, we saw the same 4-5 staff members, and all were kind and helpful. The hotel itself is quite a walk from Piazza San Marco, but like many people have pointed out, this is not necessarily a bad thing since we were not always surrounded by crowds of tourists. There are plenty of restaurants and shops around the hotel. Right outside the hotel is a small courtyard (Campo Santa Sofia), and it was the perfect space for our 1.5-year-old daughter to run around and chase the pigeons. Overall we truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: stevorino
Reviews.Content: Was somewhat hesitant to book at Foscari Palace because the reviews on Tripadvisor had been pretty mixed. However, I decided to take the plunge because I had stayed at another hotel run by the same owner in Rome (La Residenza) and was pleased with that experience. I also met another guest at the hotel who was surprised at how nice the hotel was relative to the Tripadvisor reviews. After a major mess-up by the horribly run state airline Alitalia, I arrived at Foscari 8 hours late and pretty exhausted. Room was impeccable and refreshingly well air conditioned (it was June and fairly hot outside). My younger brother (who had not traveled internationally before) had checked in a bit earlier and the staff was very helpful in getting him settled and recommending nearby restaurants for him. Location of the hotel is right on the Grande Canal and is very close to a vaporetto stop. Many restaurants, gelaterias, shops nearby. Quick walk to all parts of the city. Hotel itself was kept very clean and relatively modern. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: Although our main trip was based on the Lido, we spent our first night in Venice at the Foscari Palace and it was wonderful We had a top floor suite, 301, that was huge and well decorated, with its own private roof terrace for relaxing in the evening The staff were really friendly and the breakfast buffet lovely with a good range of fresh juices, pastries and hot food. The Foscari is itself a historic building on the Grand Canal just north of Rialto, but in easy walking distance of everything, and has its own water taxi pier for a seamless transfer from the airport And despite dire weather forecasts, we had hot sun every day - a fabulous break in this enchanting unique city

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tomritac
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from reviews written on Trip Advisor and Hotels.com., most of them very positive. The Foscari Palace did not disappoint. In fact, it exceeded our expectations! We visited from March 14 through 17. We booked a standard room and were upgraded to a balcony room--the balconies faced the square outside the hotel but still afforded a view of the Grand Canal. We arrived from New York at 10 a.m. and our room was ready!!! The breakfast was excellent, the service wonderful. And the front desk staff were always ready and willing to help. On Saturday evening a harpist played for a champagne reception, just a nice time to relax and visit with other guests. The hotel is located in the Carnareggio section of Venice, near good quiet restaurants, away from the crowds at the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco, but easily accessible to everything. A traghetto is located right outside the hotel and a vaparetto stop is one block away. But since we are walkers, we traversed mostly by foot. Venice is such a beautiful city that walking is the best way to see it. Around every alley, corner, canal, there is a "picture'" waiting to be taken. While it was cool (low 50's), we were glad we visited at this time of year. The crowds were moderate and we never had to wait very long for museum entrances or a vaparetto. The hotel prices lower too, something to consider since everything else, especially dining, is quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable visit!”
Reviews.Author: charm8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace for three days in early May. This was our second visit to Venice, but our first at the Foscari Palace. Our stay could not have been nicer. The view from our room (room 101) was unforgettable, as was the room itself - opulent and clean! We were pleasantly surprised by the breakfast - a full buffet with fresh fruit, pastries, cold cuts and hot dishes. The location of the hotel is very convenient. If we are ever lucky enough to visit Venice again, we would certainly stay here. It was worth the splurge and a great way to start our trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful Experience”
Reviews.Author: RonEigel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a retirement trip to Italy and France. Of all the hotels we stayed in, the Foscari Palace could not be matched. We had the room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. The Palace is centrally located and very easy to get to. It is an easy walk to anywhere on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: OCCouple2004
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel in Venice- this is it. We arrived to the hotel via water taxi, right up to the hotels front. Which as we saw is not the luxury that all travelers have staying at other hotels that are not on the canal, some of the hotels can be quite a walk - especially with luggage-from where you can be dropped off. Our room was very comfortable, bathrooms were very clean and the front desk was very helpful. The included breakfast is wonderful; eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals, and pastries ( what i would give to have a nutella crossant! Delicious-) The location is key for all tourist attractions, dining, or just to sit on the roof top and enjoy the sounds of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: RalphOinTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in late April, 2008. At about $500 USD per night, it was the splurge of our 2 weeks in Italy. Taking the train into Venice, we only had about 1.5 days to work with, so the last thing I wanted to do was spend a lot of time figuring out the water bus system, then trying to navigate to an "interior" hotel or B&B with luggage. I pre-planned that we would take a (expensive) water taxi straight to the hotel's dock on the Grand Canal. It was worth it to us for our first (and short) visit to Venice. We found great service from the hotel staff, both before and after our trip. The room, a deluxe double room looking over the Grand Canal (another splurge) was absolutely beautiful and very big. The breakfast buffet was the best we had among the 5 places we stayed in Italy. While the location isn't in the most popular San Marco sestiere, it was a pretty short and pleasant walk to San Marco Square and even over to the Accademia and Peggy Guggenheim museum. While you can probably find equal quality hotels closer to those areas, they're likely a lot more expensive. For us, this tradeoff was perfect. Wandering the streets of Venice is one of the more enjoyable activities anyway. If we were to stay longer in Venice then I'd have to consider a smaller hotel or B&B (at least based on today's exchange rate). But if you have only a short time in Venice, I'd recommend this route. And of all the places to splurge, I think this is a good one. The hotel quoted us 60 Euro for a water taxi between there and the train station. That's what they arranged for us on the way out of town (back to the train station). But when we arrived at the train station and just walked out to a water taxi stand, the guy "only" asked for 40 Euro. So heads up... you can do better than what Foscari Palace tells you in this regard.

Reviews.Title: “Much to like, but consider upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Voyager45
Reviews.Content: There are excellent reasons to stay at the Foscari Palace, but if you value elbow room, you may want to spring for the costlier rooms. A great advantage is the location, a short walk from the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's but a bit removed from the worst of the tourist mob scene. As a result, you get a real reisidential neighborhood feel with lots of ordinary Venetians living their daily lives. The Ca d'Oro vaparetto stop is just a block or so away. . Also, the roof terrace has a spectacular view of the Grand Canal and is an utterly delightful place to read a book or have a drink while watching the endless activity on the canal. Based on photos and stolen glimpses, the more expensive rooms looked very comfy. But the standard room we booked -- the hotel's euphemism is "classic" -- was probably the most cramped room we had ever had in a four-star hotel. The only seating that would fit was a single straight-backed chair. At about 240 euros a night, the room didn't strike us as a great value, even considering that Venice is costly. The classic rooms tend to overlook a street that is literally about seven feet wide, so the view is a likely to be a blank wall. However, our room was quiet, and on the second floor at least, there was enough light. The bed was quite large. The mattress was considerably firmer than average, which could be a problem if you like a plush feel. The bathroom was fine, though the shower arrangement was a bit cramped. The breakfast, included in the price, was satisfactory and we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a table. The staff was generally pleasant, though a couple of people seemed quite eager to do the minimum possible. One receptionist was so unhelpful he bordered on being rude, When we departed, the receptionist simply accepted the key and said nothing. Another receptionist however was notably pleasant. A minor bathroom repair was partly completed in one day, but took three days to be completely completed. The safe never did become functional. If you stay here, there are excellent restaurants very near at hand. We had a delicious dinner in a refined atmosphere at A La Vecia Cavana. The Trattoria Da Bepi is a more modest establishment, but served very tasty food and was delightfully friendly. If you go to Burano, the Trattoria da Romano at the end of the restaurant row offers excellent food and has a lot of character. None of these places was cheap, but they all offered fair value. Overall, this hotel could be a good choice, but you may want to avoid the "classics."

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lolis226
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Foscari Palace in our first trip to Venice and we absolutely loved it. The location is perfect, really close to the Ca' de Oro station. Many little shops and restaurants are around the area. The room that we got was a little small to US standards, but super clean and well equipped. The staff was really friendly, they even have on the evenings wine and cheese in the lobby. The included breakfast is also very good. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: titian71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Foscari Palace for 3 nights in April 2008. Took the water taxi from the airport directly to front door of hotel. The hotel is beautiful and located right on the Grand Canal. We booked the suite it was well worth the money. The room was huge, largest I've stayed in in Europe. Soaring ceilings, marble floors, huge bathroom, flatscreen tv, the room was really beyond what I was expecting. It also had two small balconies which overlook the Grand Canal. There is nothing more amazing than standing on the balcony at night looking out over the Grand Canal......like something from a movie Breakfast is included at has a large amount of food and fresh fruit. Would definitely stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: CECE40
Reviews.Content: Absolutely best hotel we have stayed at in Italy!!!! Reserved a triple room and were given the room actually pictured on the website!! Huge room, 2 balconys amazing decor , beautiful bathroom, Fresh flowers and fruit waiting on arrival. This is truly a palace. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly and location could not be beat....Breakfast was great each morning and evenings spent on the roof with a bottle of wine watching sunset on Grand Canal were unbelievable, Cant believe how reasonable the price is... Almost makes you want to keep this place a secret... We Will definetly be returning next year....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonSteve26
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice to celebrate my partners birthday, we were greeted with sparkling wine and some very tasty bite size snacks. We had seen some reviews saying that the airconditioning was not turn on until summer, this turned out not to be the case. The staff were very helpful, although we had a bad experience with one of the resturants recommended who appeared to be not very welcoming to UK Afro Carribean customers. However we fed this back to the hotel and they seemed genuinely dissapointed on our behalf. A word to the wise, before you go on the gondalar (next to the hotel) ensure you discuss the duration of the ride as we were told by a delagate that it would be a standard 40 minutes, however it actually turned out to be nearer 20. I have been to Rome and the people are far more welcoming than the Venicians. But everyone wants to go the Venice at least once!! If you do decide to go, we recommend this Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Frontal Grand Canal Suite”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: Had chose this hotel based on the many positive reviews on Tripadvisor.com. Frankly, I must say this, that my mum and I were more than pleased. Other than the two or three hotels closer to the train station with Grand Canal views (slightly cheaper rooms but with less than shinny reviews), this hotel at the Ca d'Oro stop represents real value for your money. It is certainly not cheap, but the hotel represents good value. Something similiar to our Gonzaga Junior Suite (Room 209) say at the Hotel Gritti Palace and Hotel Bauer Il Palazzo costs about 1,000-1,200 euros! And guess what, we only paid 429 euros, and this is the peak Easter weekend rate! Though the actual room had appeared smaller than the website pictures, we were more than pleased - two frontal Grand Canal balconies, easy to find location, lilies in room, marble everywhere, huge and bright bathroom with showers and tub, Saturday Night free cocktail and harp performance (remember to tip the lady as we did!). Practically everything in the room appears and smells new, and very functional, too. Surprisingly, the common areas are a stunner too, with wrought iron gates, plush carpets, Murano glass lamps and a rather huge lobby waiting area. Of course, do not forget to visit its roof top Altana terrace, for some cocktail and great aerial views of Venice. As for breakfasts, there was a good variety of hot and cold foods, including something rarely seen at Italian hotels - my beloved stir fried Mushrooms! So yummy I must say ... Our glitches were minor and it did not affect our otherwise wonderful stay - 1. there were no slippers in the suite and the marbled floors could be quite cold during the winter months 2. the 2pm check in and 11am check out times were strictly enforced, with no room for negotiations... 3. that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room 4. being a Frontal Grand Canal view room comes with a small price - noise of the gondolas knocking against each other or against the wooden poles. To put it in a nutshell, we really enjoyed our stay there. In addition to the Hotel Londra Palace, this is yet another Venetian hotel we wouldn't mind returning to. The Hotel Ca Sagredo, which we visited in Dec 2007 (just across the Hotel Foscari Palace) was good as well with its Grand Palatial feel to it but the Foscari Palace was a cosier boutique styled hotel and seems to be better maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoGeorge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace for three days and nights in early March, 08 and loved it. The hotel is right on the Grand Canal in the Cannareggio district, a short walk to the Rialto Bridge and shopping, restaurants, etc. Of the five hotels in Italy that we visited on this trip, this was our favorite. Their breakfast was very good, even by American standards...eggs, bacon and anything else you wanted were freshly made and delicious. Our room didn't face the canal, but we could still see the water from our window. It was beautifully furnished, clean and roomy. The king bed was very comfortable. The lobby and public rooms were first class. Some of the desk staff were a little self-absorbed, but that didn't bother us. They spoke passable English and sent up an electrical current converter right away when ours didn't work. Spacious bath with plenty of storage and closet space. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Only OK!”
Reviews.Author: MuchTravelledBolton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the hotel on the strength if great reviews and I have to say I was disappointed. I booked directly with the hotel and paid just over 500 euro for two nights. I contacted the hotel to ask for champagne to be put in our room for our arrival, I told them the exact time we would be arriving and they told me they would do that 'with pleasure'.Despite it costing me a further 50 euro (sparkling Italian wine), it arrived 10 minutes after us with no apology. We were originally in superior double over the front door of the hotel. It was spacious and pleasantly furnished, however the television did not work. The receptionist (very hostile) sent a guy to look at it. When he coud not fix it we were 'upgraded'. We were given a junior suite room 301. Thank goodness I did not pay extra for it. It had a small sitting area and a bedroom that was much smaller than our first room. Patio doors led to a small terrace with a table and four chairs but as the temparature was at 2 degrees we did not have much use for it. The view from the room was the wall of a building about 3 metres away. Breakfast was ok - quite basic and no toast, The room was far too small and you could overhear other conversations. The bar area also lacked atmosphere. On leaving the hotel another rude receptionist (both were male) told us our total without showing us the breakdown of the bill. Once we had paid, he turned toi his computer and began typing without so much as a thank you and goodbye, really quite bad customer service we felt. Perhaps I expected too much! The hotel is in a great area and is clean and nicely finished.

Reviews.Title: “Go there!”
Reviews.Author: imaa
Reviews.Content: Just go there! My husband and I loved it. We stayed 3 nights, and were quite sad to leave the very friendly staff and a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PECKY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day trip to magical Venice. The Foscari Palace is a beautiful hotel. Our room 303 was lovely, new furniture, tastefully decorated spotlessly clean. Maid service twice a day. Breakfast superb. Couldn,t fault it at all. perfect. Would certainly stay here again! I got directions and info for this hotel and vaperetto service from other trippers on this site and would like to thank them all for there help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melkozek
Reviews.Content: Most of what has been said already applies to our stay at the Foscari Palace. Our room was very nice, the front desk people were very helpful and professional, the location is good for getting around the city, and there were nice restaurants nearby. If I return to Venice I would stay there again. Because of an early flight out of Venice (6:50 am) we had to hire a water taxi (110 euro, ouch!) but it pulled up to the platform on the Focari's Grand Canal entrance and we were at the airport in about 25 minutes. Avoid this option if you can. The cost was about $160 just to get to the airport. Take a later flight if possible, since the vaporetto and the airport bus (I think) don't run at 5 am.

Reviews.Title: “Venice - One more box ticked (or checked if you are from the U.S)”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_SurreyUK
Reviews.Content: Venice - Its got to be on everyones "Top ten cities to visit before you die" list. It was definitely on ours - and now its been ticked off. We discovered the Foscari Palace hotel via Trip Advisor. We read all the reviews and then ignored the one or two poor ones as being atypical. We booked via the Giannetti Hotels Group website and then corresponded directly with the hotel via email. This was all straight forward and we only had to pay one nights deposit up front. Arrived after dark on a cold winters afternoon so took a water taxi direct from the airport to the hotel (Euro 90). If we went back we would probably use the water bus (Euro 14 each) as the Ca D'or bus stop is only about 1 minute walk from the hotel and in retrospect is quite easy to find. The Foscari Palace hotel was beautiful. Staff were very helpful, even though our Italian is virtually non existant. We had booked a canal view and were given Room 201 - a corner room with two windows and a minuscule balcony. The canal view added significantly to the cost of the room but what is the point of going to Venice and not having one? It was all as expected - stunning! The bed was simply huge (being two 4ft singles put together as is typical). The minibar was suprisingly normally priced - comparable to most London hotels anyway. The Bathroom was clean and bright. The shower was overly complex but fun (Still cannot work out what one of the attachments was for). Breakfast was excellent especially considering that it is included in the price. Location of the hotel was ideal - Nothing was too far to walk to (and I am not known for being a keen walker). I would particulaly recomend the nearby restaurant - "Hosteria Al Vecio Bragosso" - about 1 minute from the hotel. Food here was the best we had over 4 days of consistantly good food, although it was not the cheapest. It was Very Cold whilst we were there - Take a warm coat if you are not going in Summer. I think that 3 days was long enough to see all that we wanted to see and the overall cost of being in Venice makes it unlikely that we will return. However, as I said at the begining, it had to be done. Overall, I would heartiy recommend Venice, and in particular the Foscari Palace. We had a great time (if a bit cold). Ciao !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jamiesam06
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right on the Grand Canal (not all rooms have a view of the canal though). Vaporetto stop is right around the corner although we walked to the hotel from the train station in about 15 minutes. There were only a couple of bridges and it was very easy to find. If you take the vaporetto, there are no bridges to cross. Our room was above the entrance, looking out onto a square, but was very quiet. The Saturday reception was very nice with a harpist, drinks and some snacks. recommendations for dinner were very good. The view from the rooftop deck is great. A bowl of fruit on arrival, turndown service at night, and a little box with water and snacks the night before you checkout are fantastic touches. Minibar prices are very reasonably compared to U.S. hotels. If we are ever back in Venice, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: Small and quaint, but great location (right next to Ca d'Oro). Large bathroom/shower. Housekeeping keeps the rooms in tip-top shape. Wonderful breakfast buffet with great selection.

Reviews.Title: “Two Nights for Carnevale”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsKat_m
Reviews.Content: The Foscari is well located and fitted out beautifully. We stayed two nights (2-4 Feb 2008). The breakfast was pretty good and included in the price. We paid EUR598.40 for a triple room for the two nights so it was pretty extravagant and a bit out of our usual price range. On our arrival they told us there would be a little "party" in reception from 6.30pm. This turned out to be a lovely recital by a beautiful lady playing the harp. There was also some complimentary drinks and finger food on offer. It was good fun watching our fellow guests, kitted out in costume for Carnevale, appear for a drink then disappear into the night. This was my fourth visit to Venice and I must say to come during Carnevale is marvelous fun and definitely worthwhile. I picked the Foscari Palace as I wanted to be sure that we had a great time and that my 7yo daughterâ€™s first trip to Venice would be a memorable one and Trip Advisor had heaps of great reviews on the Foscari Palace. Carnevale was something I had always wanted to experience but coming from Australia I never thought I would have the opportunity to actually be there for it (as what Australian in their right mind would come to Europe for winter!!) however finding ourselves now living just up the road (in Brussels) and having recently become hooked on skiing we just happened to be in Austria in the week of Carnevale and Venice seemed so close Austria (it was about a four hour drive from Filzmoos where we had been skiing). We parked at the Tronchetto Parking Garage which at EUR20 a night is a fair bit cheaper than Amsterdam and Paris so seemed like good value to us. The only downside from the whole experience was the little wooden garden shed like structure at the end of Campo S. Sofia which sold cheap alcohol which seemed to include a lot of red bull and from out of this little wooden shed they blasted out very loud music until all hours on the Saturday night. Having only recently retired from the nightclub scene I had never considered myself to be an old fogey but when you are so tired that your body aches, you are located a good 50 meters away in what was for us a very expensive hotel and in a divinely comfortable bed but just can't sleep thanks to loud music well quite frankly I am now an old fogey and the music was just way too loud. On the Sunday morning we asked the reception staff if it was likely to happen again on the Sunday night and when they said it would we asked if there was anything that could be done (i.e. could they ask that the music be turned down/call the police/pull the plug on the stereo) as we actually found it difficult to sleep on the Saturday night as the music was so loud but they said there was nothing that could be done... the saving grace was that the little wooden shed didn't stay open quite so late on the Sunday night. In all it seemed unnecessary to have the music so loud in an outdoor setting and out of character for a place like Venice. There were a few other such tents and sheds blasting out the loud music and selling the cheap alcohol spotted around town but surely that only takes business away from the regular bars around Venice?

Reviews.Title: “Tip for a Good-Sized Double Room”
Reviews.Author: us-uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a double (Room 103), while my other friends stayed in Rooms 104 & 102. All are classed as the same type of double, for the same price. Rooms 103 & 104 were considerably larger than 102, however. 102 is cramped for a couple to stay in (but fine for 1 person). Room 103 is also better than 104 because it has a bathtub w/jacuzzi-type jet thingies in it, as well as a shower w/various body jets on the wall, & a nice, new-looking Plexiglas shower screen; whereas 104 only has a plain shower stall (no tub) w/a flimsy plastic shower curtain. 102 also only has a plain shower stall. Other than these points, I agree with the positive comments numerous others have posted.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Foscari Palace - excellent”
Reviews.Author: FiFio
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the weekend. Caught the water taxi straight up to the hotel entrance. Service was excellent, took our bags up to our room. Breakfast excellent - buffet style. Saturday evening they had champagne and canapes in the foyer with a lady in traditional dress playing the harp. I would reccommend this hotel and would stay there again. They give you the experience you're after in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: imwmn913
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace the first week of November 2007. We had reserved a two room suite with large patio. (I believe we were in room 301 ?). We chose the hotel for (1) private water taxi landing (2) location (3) previous reviews from TA. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The included breakfast was more than adequate and good. The hotel is at most a 15 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge and ST. Marks Square. There are several good restaurants right around the corner from the hotel that we ate at - prices were reasonable. We had a large patio - large enough for a table to seat 4 and a few potted plants. (Great for a glass of wine or morning coffee) The room decor was fresh and clean. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: eei01
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for 2 nights and had booked a room with the Grand Canal View, Suite 201, which was absolutely gorgeous! The weather was quite cold there but we still had the patio door open and enjoyed the view morning, afternoon and in the evening. In the early morning, you can watch the people load the grocery goods to the market right across from the canal. In the afternoon, you can enjoy the nice sunlight and watch the boats go by and the evening, the night view is just absolutely amazing. This hotel is close to everything, St Mark's Square, Rialto Bridge, lots of shopping and good restaurants close by. It's close to the train station and easy access to the water bus and gondolas. The buffet breakfast is excellent! Serving both hot and cold items, scramble eggs, hard boiled eggs, bacon, fresh mushrooms, sausages, fruits, bread, cakes, cold cuts, cheese, cereal, milk and juice. The service was excellent and very professional. Not to mention, the first night we arrived they had a cocktail dinner with drinks and a harper player. Nothing to complain about, the price is a bit pricier but the view and just being in Venice makes it all worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Kenny
Reviews.Content: Disappointing indeed! After such good reviews on here (and paying some Â£180+/night), we expected wonderful things. The building is a wonderful old palace right on the canal, 5 mins walk from the Rialto bridge. It is such a shame to step inside and see absolutely no charm at all. I have seen a 'Travel Lodge' with a better interior. Furniture looks as if it's comes from a discount warehouse, soft furnishings are 'chintzy' (certainly not Venecian style). The whole look of the place is very 80's, tired, uninspired and completely lacking in atmosphere. We went to celebrate my 40th birthday. We booked directly with the hotel and asked, if possible, to have a room with a decent view, by no means expecting a canal-front room. Unfortunatley, we had a room at the back of the hotel with 3 large windows which opened out onto a concrete wall about 2 metres away. Hence, not only was there no light, but the room was dark and forboding, despite the glorious sunny weather. On enquiring, we were led to believe that in fact only 2 rooms had a view! The room was packed with too much furniture, giving no space to swing a cat! And.....to pay for tea and coffee was a rip-off! The bathroom was like a marble cell with an awful shower and a 'jacuzzi' bath with no bubbles. The view from the hotel roof is stunning. Breakfast was fine, a variety of hot and cold food, served in a small dining area (expect to queue) not unlike a motorway cafe! Staff were ok, though wouldn't put themselves out to help too much. For a 4* hotel, it was disappointing to find there was no internet available, unless you took your own laptop. Hence, confirming flights, etc. was impossible. If we'd paid half what we did, then I would be less critical, but we really did not get good value for money on any account. We will not go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: emutz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Foscari palace for one night in October after completing a cruise. We arrived earlier than expected (as our boat arrived at 6 am). The staff allowed us to get into our room as it had just been cleaned. We booked the canal view smaller suite, but the hotel upgraded us to the grand suite for no reason. Very nice of them. Room was so large that we harly used any of it. Beds were average, but the bathrooms were big and clean. Staff was helpful in getting us oriented. Breakfast was offered, but it was expensive. There are several bakeries nearby. The hotel is in a good location with easty access both accross the grand canal and to the Vaporetto stand a block away. Walking to St Marcs was easy and enjoyable. We needed to catch the water taxi to the airport the next moring, which was an easy 10-15 min walk through the city with our bags to the north side, where you can get the taxi to the airport. Would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A VENITIAN GEM!”
Reviews.Author: H_Walshe
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day trip to Venice and, thanks to the previous reviewers of this hotel, we just had to book it. Thanks guys - it really is all you said and more! Brekkies were great, the complimentry cocktail session on saturday night was very warming and welcome after a long day spent shopping and sightseeing. A very talented harpist and gorgeous champagne cocktails and savouries to munch -excellent!. Great room with fab bathroom. The rooftop balcony was beautiful and saw some very eventful winedrinking sessions at sundown! (ignore the 'balcony closed' sign!) The local area is very cool, and nice to return to after the day tripper madness of St Marks Square - which is stunning but gets very busy. Some very good non-touristy restaurants nearby - ask Divna at reception for recomendations. Good supermarket round the corner with the most amazing nosh - meats, olives, huge chunks of parmesan reggiano for buttons and blue cheeses that aren't for the fainthearted! The Foscari Palace is a super hotel to stay in, and really helped make a great visit to a great city even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: nikki2la
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing find which we booked based on reviews read on TripAdvisor and Expedia's websites. We were not disapointed. The hotel was very clean, the staff very helpful and friendly, and the complimentary breakfast was a real bonus in this city where often times food is dissapointing and overpriced. The only complaint we had was the comfort of the beds, which we found to be a bit hard and the pillows, which were quite flat and hard as well. We would still recommend this hotel without reservation due to its other wonderful amenities and the location, 5 minute walk to Rialto bridge and 10-15 minute stroll to Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, don't hesitate!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingfran
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace is everything you could wish for, plus a bit more. It is a thoughtfully appointed, beautiful hotel with a comprehensive breakfast. The staff , whilst not being very warm as others have commented on!, were unobstrusive and polite. No concerns there. The roof garden is a must, even on a winter's night as the views are lovely. The Saturday night welcome reception was a thoughtful touch, and a welcome introduction to this graceful city. The hotel location is ideal, especially as the waterbus is so close. No more than a 5 minute stroll will get you to the Rialto Bridge. There are shops, cafes, restaurants close by, as are ATMs. Venice in winter is lovely, much quieter. Extremely pleased with our hotel choice and its location and would not hesitate for a moment to stay there again if our paths ever lead us back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rquindry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of May and loved it. We had a beautiful junior suite with a tiny balcony with a view of the Grand Canal and a very nice marble bathroom. The staff is very accommodating. Divna was wonderful - she spoke english and answered my questions prior to arrival by e-mail. Location is excellent - a short walk from the Rialto bridge. The breakfast buffet was very good. If you like a boutique hotel it's an excellent choice. I'm a photographer and like very picturesque places and this was an excellent choice for us. Be sure to go up on the deck on the roof and check out the views.

Reviews.Title: “Have a really beautiful view of the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: Good1668
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace on Oct 23-25, 2007. The hotel is in a great location. It is near waterbus and traghetto stops and is in an easy walking distance to Rialto Bridge and St. Mark square. We also had a pleasant 15 mins walk from the hotel to F.te Nuove to take the LN to Burano (a very lovely island). At Foscari, we got room No. 201 which have a very small balcony overlooking the grand canal. We really love the view from our room. The hotel also had a rooftop which also provides a great view. Don't miss it if you stay there. Compared to other hotels in this price range, we think we had made a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hoosnelson
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The location is great as it is on a main vaporetto stop and within walking distance to St Marks Square. The breakfast was huge with lots of food to choose from. They stored our luggage for the entire day after we checked out which was great.

Reviews.Title: “faultless hotel”
Reviews.Author: coffeepot11
Reviews.Content: Just loved everything about Foscari Palace - brilliant location, beautiful room - large and spotlessly clean, excellent breakfast - well presented and good choices, helpful staff and a fabulous roof top terrace with wonderful views. Hotel even had a drinks reception on the saturday evening for guest with a harpist and bellinis/nibbles - truly lovely. One thing to be aware of, hotel only has two canal view rooms. I had booked through expedia and requested a view in 'special request' section. About a week before travel, i checked with hotel if they had received this request and was told that, as they only have 2 rooms with a view, they only sell them direct themselves. In the end it didn't matter - we had a view over Campo s. sofia and a side view of canal but to be honest we weren't really in our room much anyway but it is something to bear in mind if it's important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: M-from-Leeds
Reviews.Content: We booked for our 20th Anniversary, largely on the strength of what people on this site had said. We asked for a good room at a time when they were very full and we got a deluxe superior room without a canal view, but with two windows opening onto the square. That was slightly disappointing, but the room itself was large, clean and comfortable. The staff are variable. The receptionists are a bit up themselves, but asked for a recommendation for dinner they duly sent us somewhere where we had a wonderful meal. The chambermaid was lovely and nothing was too much trouble for her. The breakfast is excellent, but the hotel tries to up its (otherwise reasonable) charges with extras. So you pay for the tea and coffee in your room and you can't even take an apple out of breakfast. Not cool. However, if you go out of the hotel, walk the 20 yards to the Strada Nuovo and look diagonally left you will see a bakery. Their stuff is delicious (try the S shaped biscuits) and the fruit jellies (no gelatine and no artificial flavours) will make you wonder why you ever bought a packet of fruit pastilles. As other reviewers point out it is also brilliantly placed. We wanted to be near the synagogue in the ghetto and to be 8 minutes from there and 8 minutes from the Rialto was pretty good going. We will go back because the price is good and the position is good and the place is comfortable and clean. Next time a canal room and a receptionsit who looks pleased to see you...

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: riversidescotland
Reviews.Content: In every respect, this hotel met (and exceeded) our expectations. The location was excellent with every facility near at hand including great restaurants and interesting shops (not just the tourist traps!) The vaparetto (canal boat) stop was very close and the traghetto (the 50 cent gondola which takes you across the canal) was at the front door of the hotel - this takes you to the amazingly colourful fish (and vegetable) market directly opposite. The hotel was extremely comfortable and clean. The room and en-suite were spacious. Staff were very courteous and friendly. The (free) Saturday evening cocktail party with live harp music(!) was a very nice touch. Breakfasts were excellent with a wide choice on the menu.I should also mention the roof terrace which provided a relaxing spot to enjoy a nightcap with astonishing views over Venice. I would have no hesitation in staying here again - and hope to do so!

Reviews.Title: “4 Star in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dturbow
Reviews.Content: A wonderful 4 star hotel right on the Grand Canal of Venice. Very centrally located. We had a fabulous view on the Canal. While not the largest room, it was very plush. The staff was very helpful and courteous. One of the highlights is the rooftop bar/sitting area. Amazing views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: wwsuzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon. The staff was wonderful - calling the airlines for our lost luggage; recommending restaurants as well as shops to replace our clothes - they were friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel was beautiful and well located - out of the madness of St. Mark's Square, but close enough for a walk as well as right next to the water taxi and vaporetto stops. Much better atmosphere than a generic hotel - we really felt like we were staying somewhere "authentic". Breakfast was generous and delicous. Our room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was a little small, but in excellent condition and kept immaculate. We would go back in a heartbeat and can't say enough positive things about Foscari Palace. (and the view from the roof was amazing! great photo opp)

Reviews.Title: “Love the Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: Vivi28
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and they gave us an upgrade to a bigger room with a nicer view. The location is fantastic (very near some great restaurants and places but not so close to St. Mark's that you're swamped with the rest of the tourists). The rooftop seating is lovely for sitting as well as taking pictures. There's a vaparetto stop right around the corner and a gondola and traghetto locations directly outside the front door of the hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and comfortable. Bathroom was updated and well-appointed. Only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the crazy shower. It's too fancy to be useful and the water never came out correctly. Plus, you need a Ph.D to figure it out and the step from the tub onto the floor can just about kill a short person like myself. Ha!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nurse-cabby
Reviews.Content: hotel appeared newly decorated, very clean and nice rooms. roof top terrace gives i nice view over the grand canal and a nice place to sit away from the hussle and bussle for an hour. there was a jacuzzi bath and shower with loads of jets of water which was great after spending ten minutes trying to work it out but then it completely flooded the bathroom floor so you then had to clear all the water up. more agro than it was worth. didnt use the mini fridge or tea/coffee facilities. 1.50 euros for a teabag (shocking). we did have a complimentry bowl of fruit though. vaporetto stop is less than a minute away and gonolas are right outside hotel entrance. we paid 70 euros for a 30 minute ride. you must haggle. we did this around 2pm which appeared to be a quite time as the price varies at different times of the day. there is also a ferry crossing (a big gondola) that will take you across the canal for 50 cents. best way to travel is on the vaporettos (water bus) you need a pass one journey is 6 euros, we got a three day pass for 30 euros and definately got our monies worth. only thing is nobody ever checked our tickets and we must have used the bus at least 12 times.! the bus takes you to murano and the lido as well as the full length of the canal and all the way around the outside of venice. venice itself is very expensive some resturants will charge 14 euros for a beer so you need to check the menus outside unless money is no object! all public toilets charge a euro a pee. and theres not many of them about. lastly, it is a beautiful place to visit and not a car insight.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay In Venice”
Reviews.Author: WonderMan3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari for two nights in mid-August prior to a cruise. I had chosen the property based on the reviews here and it was an excellent choice. The hotel is quite charming and immaculately clean. We booked the Deluxe with view of the Grand Canal and were assigned to #201. I had seen pictures of the room here, but they didn't capture really how large the room was. It was very spacious with high ceilings. The bed was two pushed together as one forming one large king sized bed. I felt a little firm upon first sitting but it proved to be very comfortable and gave me two nights of sound sleeping. There is natural light into the room from two long windows, one of which opened up onto a small balcony overlooking the Canal. Not big enough to sit out on, but nice to stand out on and admire the views. Although the Grand Canal is busy and noisy, when the windows were shut they were very insulated, so noise was not a problem. One note though. They are doing a large renovation project on the building next door. This room abutts all of that. If you are there on a weekday they will be woking there all day. Thankfully the room had enough insulation that we could only hear noise from the renovations when we were in the bathroom. One day though they were ripping up old wooden pylons out front of the hotel and that noise we could not escape from. Since we were on our way out for the day it wasn't an issue. The bathroom was also huge with a two sink vanity, bidet, heated towel racks, bathrobes, and a massively overcomplicated shower/jacuzzi tub set-up. While it's great to have modern equipment, there were just way too many jets and shower head options and was to confusing to deal with when you're groggy in the morning. It was also one of these half-glass shower wall designs (which seem to be common in Europe) so half the tub was wide open, while the other half was enclosed. There was a small glass door that could swing shut to prevent water from spraying out, but it then closed you in to a very tiny space with the water over you all the time. I prefer a shower where I have space to step back and soap then rinse, etc. So that was annoying. We didn't try the jacuzzi tub option so can't comment on that. There was a welcome basket of fruit and two complimentary bottles of water. There was also a mini-bar with items for a fee. The room had a massive wardrobe with plenty of room for storage. And there was a nice thin-screen TV elevated in the room so it was not in the way of anything. High-speed internet was available in the room; if you have a laptop they can provide a cable. The roof deck was wonderful with a 360 degree view of the city. It was a great place to relax after a hot day of touring and also nice to socialize with other guests. We met a nice family who also found the hotel through this site. There is a small bar adjacent to the deck but it was never being attended when we would pass by so we didn't use it. We also noticed that there was also a small bar just off the lobby. Breakfast was a very nice buffet with many choices of breads, cakes, pastries, fruit, cheese, cold cuts, as well as hot dishes like eggs, bacon, and potatoes. Great way to start the day. As far as service goes, this would probably be my only slight complaint. My first impression of the hotel was mixed. Upon arriving by water taxi, the bellman was promptly there to retrieve our bags. When we headed to the front desk though we were met with a clerk named Monica. There was a bit of a pause there though as she wouldn't even acknowledge us. No "hello", "how are you", "can I help you". I had to say to her that we were checking in (which was obvious with bags everywhere) and then she proceeded to do the check-in. She was very reserved and seemed uncomfortable or flustered when we would ask any question. She always had an answer to the question, but she just wasn't very friendly.
