I then asked Monica about an email request I had sent to the hotel a few weeks prior requesting to reserve the secret itineraries tour for The Doge's Palace. She looked around, said nothing was reserved, and basically brushed me off. I said I had gotten a response from Divina who wanted me to choose a time for the tour which I responded to. Monica went to the emails (they keep all of them on file, which is helpful) and said she would let me know. When I came down later to check she asked me if I had gotten a confirmation number from them and I said no. She then said that nothing had been booked. She then went to the emails and tried to say that it was my fault because I hadn't confirmed a time back to them. I told her to read the emails again. She did and saw that I had requested a time. This is where the problem was uncovered. It was Monica, not Divina, who had responded to my email confirming a time. The thing is I had also asked a question about St. Mark's Cathedral in the email. Monica answered that question but ignored my request for a time for the Doge's Palace. And apparently Divina didn't realize I had replied back because Monica had intercepted the email. Realizing that the tour hadn't been booked I didn't find it a big deal and just wanted to know what else we could find to get us on the tour. Monica kept focusing on the emails though and went on and on about them becoming very defensive. She didn't seem to like the fact that it was her screw up that caused the tour not to be booked even though I was not blaming anyone. She kept mentioning that I should have asked for a confirmation number. At that point I was getting annoyed and asked her to please forget what had already happened and to focus on seeing if we could get a tour booked now. She then called the Palace tour office but they had nothing available until the next week. She then pulled out a tour from an outside company and said she could book that for us. It cost 200 Euro per person!!! The other tour was only about 16 Euro, so I said no thank you that we would just tour the palace on our own. We later found ourseleves beset by her trying to sell us on tours the next day when I asked her about taking a vaparetto out to Murano and where we could catch it. Without answering the question she pulled out a tour book and tried to sell us on tours. I said I wasn't interested and asked her to please tell us again where we could take the vaparetto to Murano. I don't know if she got a comission on these tours, but I didn't like her sales tactics. Overall she was just very unhelpful as she either seemed annoyed by questions or really unsure with her answers. Contrast this with Divina who was extremely helpful in answering questions and was friendly. My friend's bag wheels broke off on our way to the water taxi and he needed to find a shop that would sell a massive sized suitcase to replace that one since it was now unusable. Divina called all around to various hotels to see if any contacts she knew were aware of a store that sold large suitcases. The bellman had identified the area of the city but didn't know the name. Divina couldn't find out the name either despite her calls, but she made a great effort which was very appreciated. We went to the area of the city the bellman mentioned and did find the bag store though so all worked out. One other complaint continues with the check-in. The desk clerk has an employee (possibly from housekeeping?) accompany you to your room to show you where it is. The woman took us there opened the door and left. She didn't say anything special about the room. When we walked in the room was hot though as the A/C had been turned off. We weren't sure how to work it. When the bellman came up with bags 10 minutes later he remarked about how hot it was and went over to turn on the A/C and showed us how to control it. We felt that the woman who brought us to the room should've showed us that or any other unique things about the room. Other than these minor service issues it was a wonderful stay and I would highly recommend this property. It's the perfect location in town as it's close to everything but you're not drowning in the tourist craziness of the St. Mark's area.

Reviews.Title: “mirror mirror”
Reviews.Author: flowercat2
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from two days in Venice staying at the Foscari Palace. Lovely room but rather dismayed that we had to pay for coffee in our room. This has never been included in a mini bar before. On our first evening I mentioned to the concierge that lights over the washbasin didn't work ,and that bulbs and wires were visible where a circular mirror should be. The lights were sorted the next day but the mirror never materialised. I mentioned it again to the same concierge but got no apology - I was disappointed. The waiting staff were pleasant. I love Venice and have stayed in appartments and hotels but I don't have any intention of going back to the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it”
Reviews.Author: Almatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace from Monday to Friday last week. We booked it after doing loads of research, including on this site, as it sounded just right for us. We had high expectations, were not disappointed and would go back there without hesitation. One of the things that we liked the most about it was the location and we were very glad that we had decided to stay in that area. As other have said, itâ€™s very near the Caâ€™ Dâ€™Oro vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal as well as the traghetto stop to travel across the Grand Canal. Also, itâ€™s easy to walk to Fondamente Nova (think thatâ€™s how you spell it!) for the boats out to Murano, Burano etc. Itâ€™s in easy strolling distance of the Rialto Bridge (10 mins) and St Markâ€™s Square (20 mins). Best of all, itâ€™s out of the really busy part of Venice and in the main street near the hotel (the Strada Nova) the locals seem to outnumber the tourists. We arrived by water taxi from the airport (worth the 90 euros if you can afford it). The work on the adjacent property is still ongoing so the taxi couldnâ€™t dock right outside the Foscari Palace when we arrived, but it did pick us up from the hotel jetty when we left as a barge thing had been moved. The whole hotel was immaculately clean â€“ bedrooms and public areas. Iâ€™d seen a comment on here about the bedding but we had no such problems, Iâ€™m glad to say. We had a junior suite, which doesnâ€™t have a canal view but has a little sitting area and its own private little roof terrace. I wouldnâ€™t pay extra to book that room if I was going in the winter when it is too cold to sit outside but it was warm when we were there so it was a real bonus to be able to sit there with a bottle of wine (or two) in the evenings. The bed was comfortable, the air conditioning worked well as did the TVs etc and my husband got the complicated shower jets to work â€“ well, he is an engineer! There was complimentary water and fruit on arrival. So, all in all, we were very pleased with our room. The view from the public area roof terrace is awesome and we spent a pleasant hour or so on a couple of days just watching the world go by on the Grand Canal. The breakfast was good we thought â€“ plenty of choice, well presented and it set us up for the day. The hotel staff were all polite and helpful. Thereâ€™s loads of shops, bars and restaurants nearby â€“ itâ€™s just a shame that we didnâ€™t have time to try them all. Still, thereâ€™s always next time!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: 45ice
Reviews.Content: We stayed a for a few nights at the Foscari following previous reviews.It was all good and an excellent location. We saw standard room which looked a little small so stretch to a higher grade if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaTraveladdict
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Foscari Palace hotel. We had a double superior room (208) which has 2 large windows looking out onto S Sofia Square, over the Gondola and Traghetto Station with side views to the Grand Canal. The room was spacious and comfortable, the bathroom has one of the much-mentioned jacuzzi bath/shower arrangements which we never fully utilised â€“ too many options! The hotel is clean and comfortable and good value for money, with an efficient and knowledgable staff. It is quite small - (23 rooms) so it feels intimate. Breakfasts were lovely, all kinds of everything. They even cater to the Bntish requirement for bacon and eggs if you canâ€™t possibly live without it! It has a perfect location, with its own jetty for water taxi drop off, 1 minute walk from the Caâ€™dâ€™Oro Vaporetto stop, and there is a gondola and traghetto stop right outside the door. We had a peak into room 209 which can be adjoined with other rooms to make a suite â€“ this is a lovely room with large windows (with Balcony) right onto the canal, and a larger bathroom with separate shower cubicle. I would highly recommend it and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: FFCgirl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice where we stayed at The Foscari Palace hotel in the Gonzaga suite for threee nights. It exceeded all of our expectations - that's what I call a room with a view. We wanted somewhere special to celebrate our 25th Wedding anniversary and we certainly found it. We took the private water-taxi from the airport directly to the hotel which cost 95 Euros, worth every cent. After a very swift check-in, we were shown to our room where I was actually short for words - that's a first!! It was fabulous and the view was picture postcard perfect. Standing on the balcony overlooking the Grand Canal watching the waterbuses and gondolas go by was one of the highlights of our trip. The roof terrace was a very nice place to enjoy an after dinner drink or two. Venice is a very easy city to explore, either by foot (take VERY comfortable shoes)or by the very efficient waterbus service. We found the restaurants to be of a high standard and prices about the same as London. On our anniversary night we drank Billini's at Harry's Bar, followed by dinner at at The Terrace restaurant at The Monaco hotel. It was a holiday I will never, ever forget.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even get to stay but had to comment”
Reviews.Author: HelenMP
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review even though I haven't stayed here! We booked months ago to stay for 3 nights on 28 - 31 Aug 2007 for my husband's birthday. Flights booked & paid for & 219 euro hotel deposit paid & VERY much looking forward to the trip. We had a sudden death in the family & had to cancel 6 days before the trip as we had just found out the funeral was right in the middle of the trip & on the same day as my husband's birthday. We couldn't rearrange the trip due to work commitments. We had travel insurance but as it was an aunt we weren't covered. I emailed the Foscari palace as soon as I got the funeral date. Divna, from reception, was just lovely. She sent condolences and without question refunded the deposit (less a 30 euro standard fee) despite the fact that strictly speaking it was a minumum of 7 days notice & we had given 6, but she was totaly understanding of the fact that we couldn't give her any sooner notice. We will hopefully be returning to Venice next year and without question will stay at the Foscari Palace - apart from the fact that it looks fantastic & the reviews are excellent, it's this sort of personal undersanding that makes a hotel special.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely phantastic....”
Reviews.Author: cellotraveler
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ll make it short: a great place to stay, located perfectly, friendly staff (we got an upgrade for some reason, so we had the perfect view on the Canale Grande..) Fast and cheap connection with airport Marco Polo, if you donÂ´t mind walking 10 minutes, (only 2 bridges to cross...), take the Alilaguna blue line to Fondamenta Nove, aprox. 30 min. For those, who donÂ´t care about money: the watertaxi-ride is worth the experience, arriving at Foscaris special water-entrance makes you feel like Super-VIP...(90Euro....;o(..). Big Supermarket, if you turn left on Strada Nova, on the right side (BILLA). DonÂ´t miss the roof terrace, a phantastic view and a great place to relax after a sightseeing day! Watch the photos of all the other users - I canÂ´t add anything new...Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Foscari Palace, but is it worth $300 a night?”
Reviews.Author: bangerfelix
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The location was pretty good, about a 10-15 walk to St Marks square, although I am not sure how accurate that is....because when in Venice you can never really be sure how many times you have walked around in a circle. We took a water taxi from the port right to the entrance of the hotel. There is something very exciting and romantic about that. The hotel staff was exceptionally nice and they allowed us to check into our room hours early. The room was well fashioned but a slight disappointment. The furniture was a little over the top. The bed cover was a beautiful thick down blanket attached to the decorative side of the duvet. Meaning that the only blanket available for use is the type of blanket that does not get washed between uses. This and this alone really put me off to the hotel. There were visible white crusty spots all over the blanket. We were completely appalled and quickly removed the blanket, turned down the air conditioner, and slept in layers as we only had a sheet for a cover. When one is paying over $300 a night to stay at a classy romantic place, the standards for cleanliness (among other things) goes up significantly. I was extremely disappointed that the hotel did not have a washable bedspread and think the blanket system they are using needs to change.The bathroom had only a shower, which is a problem for me, but was otherwise quite nice. There is a reception on Saturday nights where the hotel serves complimentary cocktails and snacks and guest can mingle. We thought this was a very nice touch. Overall I really did like this place, like I said my only complaint is that for top dollar we would have appreciated a fresh blanket to sleep with.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Foscari”
Reviews.Author: LondonFruitcake
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 lovely nights at the Foscari Palace 1st-4th July this year for my partners 50th Birthday. I have to say that all the reviews I'd read before we went were true! The hotel itself was right on the Grand Canal and the hotel staff were extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCO_7
Reviews.Content: Great location, 2 mins from vaporetto stop, easy, quick access to all main sights. Beautifully appointed rooms, fruit and complimentary water included. Excellent buffet breakfast with attentive waiters on hand if there was something you could not find. Staff very helpful. Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Yes! Yes! Yes! Foscari Palace is wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: ReinaBoston
Reviews.Content: Foscari Palace was wonderful... we stayed there for our honeymoon and received a complimentary bottle of champange upon check-in. The room was spotless, high ceilings, great windows opened up onto the street with views of the gondola station right outside the hotel. We grabbed a gondola ride in the early morning which took us onto the Grand Canal and into the narrower side canals. The hotel is perfectly located - not near the crowds from St. Marks Square or the Rialto, but an easy walk to both. We took a water taxi from the Marco Polo Airport - 90 Euro - but totally worth the money as it took us directly to the Foscari Palace and we were weary from 12+ hours of travel. We definitely had an amazing time and would stay there again in a heartbeat!! Plus, the breakfast was delicious - great spread. The only negative is loud boat traffic on the Grand Canal until about 2am. This only bothered us 1 out of the 3 nights we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari Palace is on everything!”
Reviews.Author: LVRobinson
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace is definitely a place we would recommend to others. The ladies at the reception desk were very helpful, nice and accommodating. They recommended restaurants and told us of other services offered. The room was very comfortable and sunny. The air conditioning was great and the room overlooked the square. They had robes and comfortable over sized towels. The shower took some figuring out, but once we did, it was great. The rooftop terrace was wonderful. We went up every night and only saw one couple the entire time. It was a beautiful view. The breakfast was good. The lady in charge was very nice. We took advantage of the free water taxi to Murano. On a side note - they had their hotel name on Everything from the sheets to the bath mat in the shower - It was funny. We chose to walk everywhere because the vaporetto could get pricey and everything was relatively close by. We went to Saint Marks early in the morning (8:30am) and took lots of pictures and just hung out. It was the only time it wasn't overrun by tourists. We took the vaporetto from the train station to the Ca d'oro stop and it was very close (no crossing bridges with luggage). They gave us great directions to the closest stop for the airport and only paid 6 euros per person opposed to the 90 euros for a water taxi. Il Fornaio bakery close to the vaporetto stop was wonderful! They had great pastries and this little pink ball thing kind of like a small sugar covered cake that was amazing. We also ate at Trattoria da Gianni by the hotel (make a right when you leave the square). It'll be on your left. It had great calamari and cheap house wine. We liked it so much we ate there 3 nights out of our 5 night stay. Overall, this was a great hotel and fairly priced since it's not right next to Saint Marks Square - which is great. It's still a tourist friendly area, but without the massive crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: HopesandDreams
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat reluctant to book this hotel, due to the pictures of the rooms, as I thought the rooms lacked a venetian feel to them, and seemed almost commercial. Fortunately, I was wrong! Pictures do not adequately reflect these rooms. The marble surround on the doors and the high ceilings are very venetian, and the sunken entryway to the room added an element of elegance and stateliness. I enjoyed the high windows in both the room and the bathroom, as you can completely control the level of light, air and view in both rooms at any time. And speaking of the view. . .Our room, which overlooked the grand canal, was mesmerizing! The Grand Canal view from the room is one not to be missed! It was fantastic to hang out on the balcony and hear and view Venice in all its' spendor! Unlike many reviewers, I thoroughly enjoyed the bath fixtures, and was able to utilize the shower surround jets, and the jacuzzi jets. Granted, at first, they are not user friendly, but they work, with a little tinkering. The radio in the bathroom is a nice touch, and there are wonderful full body bath towels and robes to complete the luxurious feel. I found the bathroom to be a relaxing oasis - one that I missed at other hotels thoughout my trip. The staff was quite accommodating. Monica was very reserved and professional, and Carlo was quite fun - he did a great job of being cheerful, while maintaining a level of sophistication (just what you would expect at a hotel of this level)! The breakfast buffet (which was the largest we have ever enjoyed in Italy) was rich and plentiful, and very well maintained by Luigi. It included both hot and cold items, and a large selection of fruits and pastries/breads. I am sure at other hotels this buffet would cost a pretty penny! From top to bottom, the hotel has an air of comfortable refinement. Well maintained, clean, beautiful decor thoroughout, both in the lounge, bar area, public spaces and the rooms. Great location, tucked away, but not. Welcoming, knowledgable staff. Not too much, not too little. Just right!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolinaTeacher
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in. It is located on the Grand Canal just around the corner from the public water taxi line and gondolas are just outside your door. You are about half way between the train station and St. Mark's Square. We jumped aboard a public water taxi at the train station and arrived in about 15 minutes. We walked about 3 minutes around a building to the hotel. We had been upgraded to a suite, which was absolutely fabulous. The room was huge, with sofa, chairs, dining table, king and twin bedding, two large windows, desk, and huge storage furnishings. The bathroom was great with a jacuzzi shower/tub combination. You even had music piped into the room and bathroom. Everything was spotless. The breakfast was one of the best ever - cannot think of anything not available to us. Venice is very expensive, but we felt we received a great room for a reasonable price. This is the place to stay in Venice if you want a beautiful room in an excellent location away from the "crowds".

Reviews.Title: “Foscari - believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: medwyn
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and booked the hotel Direct. If it's available when you book, choose Room 209 The gonzaga Suite. It has a full Grand Canal frontage and is STUNNING. - it is definitely worth the Cost - remember in Venice, you will be paying a fortune for almost everything. i would return to this hotel in a heartbeat - but i would only choose this room, not because the rest of the hotel is not superb (it definitely is) - but if you only go once, you must do it properly and the views from your windows are the views that you always dreamed of from your trip to Venice. Hotel staff are very efficient, polite and friendly. facilities are superb, position is excellent, 20 mins walk to St Marks Square, 10 mins to Rialto Bridge, 1min from Vaporetto waterbus stop at Ca d' oro. The Gondolas at s.sofia are 20 metres away. You can stand on the Hotel jetty having a champagne cocktail and even dip your toe in the water if you wanted. This is a four star hotel and there are "better" hotels available, but at a crippling cost. Stay here, choose room 209 - thank me later - you'll love it

Reviews.Title: “It's on our list!!”
Reviews.Author: CiaoMilano
Reviews.Content: Foscari Palace is a real findâ€¦â€¦we travel a lot and it has even made it on to our list of places we will always come back to - it is beautifully venetian looking, not too large or over the top, very welcoming, nicely decorated, beautifully maintained and, of course, right on the grand canal. It also has a lovely rooftop patio which has great views. Getting to the hotel from the stazione is easy - it lies a few minutes walk from a vaporetta stop along flat pathways (so no suitcase and staircase issues). The hotel is located right beside a jetty for hiring gondolas and a jetty for the very cheap gondola crossing of the grand canal. It also overlooks the fish markets, parked gondolas and nice old buildings â€¦it really is perfectly situated in a quiet picturesque spot yet still near enough to everything - lying between the stazione and St Marks square - quite close to the Accademia Bridge. We have stayed in two rooms at the hotel â€“ room 201 with a tall narrow window with a fantastic canal vista - and room 211(?) overlooking the small piazza beside the hotel. Both rooms were impeccable and the bathrooms top quality. Our stay was made more enjoyable because the staff were friendly but we must mention Eliana who helped us so much with our booking. We also enjoyed chatting to the barman and we must also mention the talented harpist who played for the guests one evening. We enjoyed the breakfasts - there was a good variety of food. However, I do agree with the comment from another tripadvisor contributorâ€¦.. the coffee needs an urgent rethink!!!! Overall we loved our stay and can hardly wait to visit again!!!!! Footnote: We have noted other comments about the lack of hotel air conditioning..... We did not have such problems because the weather was cooler when we stayed. However, we thought it worth mentioning that there is a law in Italy that permits air conditioners to run only at certain times of the year. There is actually a date they are permitted to be turned on and a date they must be turned off - these dates are never varied by the Italian Government...regardless of how the weather is. This of course can be very hard on hotels, public buildings and workplaces.....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Foscari”
Reviews.Author: twonk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay in the Gonganza Suite at the Foscari. The room was excellent, large, always spotless with great views onto the Grand Canal from the two balconies. The breakfast is very good especially so for an Italian hotel with lots of choice, hot and cold. Despite some reviews to the contrary the staff were always helpful and friendly. The location is also good with a very handy Traghetto ferry right next door to whisk you across the Grand Canal for just 1 Euro. One word of advice if you are arriving/departing by Water Taxi the Hotels own landing stage is inaccessible at the moment (June 4th) due to some renovations next door

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wizard6818
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Very freindly and helpful. Stayed at the Grans Suite Foscari. Outstanding. Nicest room I've ever stayed at. Beautiful architecture. Amazing to realize your staying in a 15th centrury palace where the King of France once stayed at. Expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaMarie30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Foscari Palace for 2 days after 2 weeks of travelling. It was the perfect end to a great vacation. The management was helpful... the cocktail hour in the foyer was lovely, & the veiw from the rooftop patio had some of our best scenic pics. Would suggest this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Excessluggage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in April for five days and the whole experience was a joy. The staff were friendly, breakfast was suberb and the hotel itself was spotless and in a perfect position for exploring either by foot or vaporetto. I will be recommending it to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the bad vibes”
Reviews.Author: Peter K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari in early April 2007 and found the hotel excellent. We paid extra for a canal view and were allocated room 201 The room and the view of the canal & rialto market were stunning and worth the extra cost. The breakfast for an Italian hotel was far more than we expected. We found the staff efficient and helpful for both directions and transport. We usually choose our own restaurants as recommended one always seem to be the most expensive(you do have to work hard to find poor food in Italy !!). Overall we had an excellent five days and this hotel helped make the experience of Venice more enjoyable. An earlier report gave instructions one how to reach the hotel from Marco Polo airport via the airport bus and the vaporetta quickly and cheaply. We followed these instructions both ways and they were excellent. Our only quibble would be having to pay for teabags in this standard of hotel which we thought was penny pinching. However the beer in the mini bar was cheap enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, room with a view, indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: nangela
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior double at this hotel for 3 nights in April on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel itself is beautiful. We had 2 balconies overlooking the Campo Santa Sofia with a side view of the Grand Canal. Absolutely gorgeous, a gondola station right there, as well as a traghetto crossing right over to the famous fish market. Well worth a visit and a crossing. The room was comfortable, bathroom huge and well stocked, the bed really comfy. When we arrived there was a plate of fruit in the room with two bottles of bottled water. Also, free ethernet cord and internet in the room. This luxury came with a very very high price. Too high for the value. On the negative side, I found the staff to be "not very friendly". Almost cold. While the breakfast was good, the room was tiny and we had to wait for a table. The waiter's were overworked and unable to help because they appeared so stressed out. The coffee was the worst coffee I have ever had in Italy. It was bad American coffee. But, Venice is the best, magical place. would recommend the Baccari Grill -- we had so much fun there and the food was spectacular. Also, enjoyed many cuttle fish dishes. Ate in a wonderful restaurant on the island of Murano, with a rooster in its window. Can't remember the exact name. I probably will look for a different hote, the next time I visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: JennySuffolk
Reviews.Content: For our third trip to Venice we booked a three-night break at the Foscari Palace having read the rave reviews on the TripAdvisor site, but unfortunately, we too experienced the supercilious attitude of the management staff that lets this hotel down. The Foscari is in a fantastic location with excellent facilities, and our stay should have been perfect. Our problem was the heat. The temperature in our room was at least 30 degrees Celsius at night-time which was very uncomfortable. When we asked the staff on the front desk to turn on the air-conditioning, they refused. When we pointed out that we had paid for a room with air-conditioning, they just shrugged their shoulders and said that our booking agent had misled us. (Our booking agent insists that the hotel's literature states that there is air-conditioning and the hotel is therefore giving wrong information to them). The Manager also told us that we were the only people to complain, which was an outright lie. Only when my husband strongly insisted that something was done about the situation, did the Manager reluctantly give us the fan from his desk. Even so, we had to sleep with the windows and door of our room wide open all night long. We did not expect to suffer like this in a 4-star hotel. The uncaring attitude of the management ruined our trip. We returned home tired from lack of sleep and covered with mosquito bites. We shall never stay at this hotel again, which is a great shame as it is perfect in every other way.

Reviews.Title: “On the grand canal but it was hot.”
Reviews.Author: pennybob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Venice on April 23th by ship. We took a water taxi to the hotel. Water taxies are outrageously expensive but they save a great deal of hassle getting to where you want to go. Venice has water buses and they are inexpensive, crowded and slow. The hotel is on the Grand Canal, but, only the most expensive rooms can actually see it. The hotel common areas are attractive. There is a neat deck on the roof of the hotel and you can get a marvelous view of Venice from there. We had one of the least expensive rooms and felt that it was overpriced at 230 euros (@ $300) per night. Breakfast was included and it was very nice. The rooms were very clean. The staff was competent We ran into an unexpected problem that the hotel was unwilling or unable to address. While we were there, Venice was enduring a heat wave. (lower 70's F). For $300 a night, we expect air conditioning (the hotel's literature says that it is air conditioned). We could not get the AC to run so we asked the front desk about it. We were not happy to hear "we don't turn on the air conditioning until summer" - June 25th to be exact! Sleeping with the windows open was still warm. Another problem with open windows is that it was very noisy outside. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cwmlbk1
Reviews.Content: We booked Foscari Palace based upon reviews in TripAdvisor. I exchanged emails with Divna at Foscari Palace for several months. She is an absolute jewel! She gave me the names of tour companies, restaurants, etc., and answered every question I had. We booked a deluxe double overlooking the Grand Canal and were given Room 201. Fabulous room with a fabulous view! Also, the bathroom was quite large with everything anyone could possibly need. The breakfast served in the breakfast room was far more than I expected. It was quite a spread! Lots of fresh fruit, breads, meats/cheeses, pastries, juices, etc. We are already planning to return to Europe in 2008 and plan to spend 3-4 days in Venice. I will be booking a room at Foscari Palace as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Outdoorsports09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week in Italy (April 22-28), of which two nights were spent in Venice (our first). We were very pleased with our stay at Foscari Palace! We chose this hotel through much review of traveler feedback on TripAdvisor. We booked directly through e-mail correspondence. The staff were very pleasant and helpful via e-mail and even more so when we arrived, particularly the front desk (Eliana & Divna). We booked a Superior Double room and indicated that we were celebrating a special occasion and would like to reserve a room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. While they could not guarantee this request upon reservation, they came through fabulously upon arrival. We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival that we were going to be staying in suite # 209, with two balconies overlooking the Grand Canal. Upon entry to our room, we were in awe of the room itself and the views from the balcony--absolutely wonderful! We were also greeted with fresh flowers and fruit, which were unexpected extras. The bathroom was all marble with jet tub and separate shower. The breakfast that is included is quite satisfactory. Plenty of offerings to satisfy anyone to get the day started...fruit, pastries, eggs, meats, cheeses, juices, coffee, etc. The location of Foscari Palace is very convenient. There is a traghetto station right outside the entrance that allows you to get to the other side of the canal for .50 Euro p.p., as well as a gondola station. There is a vaporetto (public waterbus) stop Ca' da'Oro that is only about two blocks away that will transport you to/from the train station, which is what we did since we were traveling via train to/from Rome. It is about a 5-10 minute walk to Rialto Bridge and 15-20 minute walk to St. Mark's Square, depending on how casually you stroll. Our room at the Foscari Palace really made our stay so much more memorable! I would definitely recommend spending the extra to reserve a room with a view of the Grand Canal (if available). I would definitely recommend checking Foscari Palace out, it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Little jewel on the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: Tomthesp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back from 4 nights at the Foscari, what a great place to stay if you want to be away from the noisy, touristy areas, the Foscari is 10 minutes away from the Rialto bridge and 20 mins walk from St. Marks square. Easy to get to from the vaporetto stop at Ca' D'Oro. The service was first class, nothing was too much trouble, the room was great with a balcony looking out over the square and also a bit of the grand canal. Great tip is to go to the top floor and onto the roof terrace a fantastic view of the grand canal we whiled away a whole afternoon just watching Venice go by..... Breakfasts were excellent with a good range of everything you want. We thought it was a bit steep charging us for tea bags in the room, so we bought our own from the local supermarket 5 mins walk away in the direction of the Rialto. There is a great fish and fruit and veg market directly opposite the hotel take the 0.50E gondolo over from the square outside the hotel. The bus from the airport and the vaporetto ride are the best and cheapest way of getting there, private water taxi is 90E, one way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: crabbag
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, friendly and helpful staff, great location, wonderful breakfast. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: WHTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel, well-located on the Grand Canal. We stayed for 3 nights in early November. Our room was very clean, quiet, and well-furnished, though I wouldn't bother to pay up for the junior suite next time--we didn't make much use of the sitting area and it was too cold for the little terrace. The breakfast was very good, with plenty of variety offered, and the front desk staff were polite and helpful. One of them recommended a wonderful osteria right in the neighborhood--Osteria Enoteca Giorgio. Ristorante Da Gianni right down the street was also very good, though crowded. The hotel's complimentary Bellinis and hors d-oevres accompanied by harp music made for a festive start to our Saturday night. All in all a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Foscari Place”
Reviews.Author: N.Ston.Trav.
Reviews.Content: My wife, seven year old son and myself stayed at the Foscari Place the last week in February. We stayed a total of four nights. We booked the Gonzaga Suite and it was well worth the extra money. The room itself is stunning. The view is what we all dream of when we think of Venice. The room was very large and had a seperate area with the bathroom off of it. There is a whirlpool tub and a shower. We used the tub almost everyday. (It does work, you just have to give it time.) We found the staff to be very helpful. They always greeted my son by first name. The breakfast was very good. The location is excellent, not far from St. Marks. We would often go to the Rialto Market across the canal. The staff helped us with restaurant recomendations, tours and boat trips. This was our favorite hotel on our trip and you will not be disappointed. Go up to the roof top, the view is great and we had it all to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Agree that the service is frosty at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeyP17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic except for the service. Reception is VERY frosty and unhelpful. An attitude adjustment is desparately needed.

Reviews.Title: “Mature reflection”
Reviews.Author: geoffwCreaton
Reviews.Content: We booked the Foscari Palace expecting an exceptional Hotel. Having just returned and reflected on the overall stay, I still rate it as one of the most pleasurable stays that I have had in the last 30 years. OK so the staff did not prostrate themselves at your feet but they were helpful and polite. The breakfasts were very good, bearing in mind this is a small Hotel. Our room 101 was simply stunning and the view over the Grand Canal was worth the money alone. Yes some things like the jaccuzzi didn't work and the phone ringing at 2am were a bit of a pain. But sitting on the roof terrace drinking coffee for 2 euros made up for it. The staff seemed to think that if you asked for a recommendation for a light lunch that meant paying 50 euros each minimum. They did happily book tables and make other arrangements. I for one will be back there as soon as I can. Oh do go to the Trattoria de Modonna in the Calle de Madonna. It was the best value food of such quality that it felt like robbery paying the bill. Also I recognise that there may be a lack of cherubs in the US but to hear " geez look at those flying babies" in the Doges Palace does not bode well for American foreign policy,

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Venetian”
Reviews.Author: Aion
Reviews.Content: This hotel has surpassed expectations. Actually it looks much better, than on a site of hotel. A smell of fresh lilies, which filled our room (together with an atmosphere of the Grand Canal) will not transfer any photos. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “In response to the management at Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: ohioFindlay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year and I did not give it a good review. I didn't read the response of management or the couple from England until someone asked me for a recommendation of a hotel in Venice. I wish I could recommend this place because it is a beautiful, clean hotel but the staff behind the front desk were cold and rude. I need to clarify that we took no food from the hotel and am not sure why they thought we did. We asked for the name of a good place to eat and how to book a water taxi. I don't consider those questions unreasonable. We are not difficult to please and we loved our hotels in Rome and Florence and have recommended them both to others. This is a nice hotel and is in a convenient location but am not sure why it gets so many raves on this board. I also don't think it's "weird" to complain about frosty service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Foscari”
Reviews.Author: lfg23
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Seemed to have been recently refurbished. Good standard, perfect position, staff very friendly. The roof terrace was lovely with views over the Grand Canal. You could cross the canal by gondola right outside the hotel for just 50 cents. We would highly recommend this hotel, we booked 3 superior rooms but would definitely say 304 was the best with its small balcony and side view of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheNetherlandsAnky
Reviews.Content: We'been here the first weekend of March, we booked a room with a view on the grand canal, but where upgraded to The Foscare Suite with 6 windows and 2 balcony's at the grand canal. And there was a seperate sitting-room with large tv-screen. Also a cocktailparty with music and free drinks. The service was really ok and friendly. We would surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: corar
Reviews.Content: I have been putting off writing this review because I really wanted to love the Foscari Palace. There were some great things to be sure, but overall our experience was very so-so. We stayed at the Foscari for three nights in Feb. It was our honeymoon so we splurged for the Gonzaga Suite, and spent a lot of money on it. So naturally, among the good things was the room itself, the fantastic balconies and the view. Also a plus is the location which many others have commented on, and the cocktail party. Here come the minuses, and let me preface this by saying that Venice was the last stop on our honeymoon, and we had been absolutely spoiled in our first two hotel choices. Nonetheless, this was more expensive than either of those, so I would expect this to be on par. Our first problem was the service, which was at best, cold, and at worst, really frustrating. On a few occassions we asked for advice on how to get somewhere, or whether reservations would be needed, and always we were met with indifference. When we needed an extra pillow, we were treated as if we had asked for the most difficult thing in the world. As others mentioned, the jacuzzi bath did not work, so i expected that, but one night we lost hot water altogether- not even at a time you would expect many to be using it- and again we were treated as if were out of line to inquire when the water may be working again. The bed was uncomfortable, and not because it was a typically firmer european mattress, but rather, it felt just like a very cheap motel mattress. The beds (twins adjoined) would slide across the floor every time you got up or down. My husband and I would wake in the morning with a foot gap between our beds (which was funny but annoying) Finally, the worst part was breakfast. I understand that Italians dont eat hot breakfast like americans, but that wasnt the problem at all- I had come to love having a caprese or other simple breakfast. Here, the hot selections were fine, but the items you would expect to be good in italy were not. I had the worst mozerella here, the meats were very tough, and the breads were subpar. One morning, after giving up on those items, i just had some cereal. After i dumped milk on it and in my coffee, I began to smell something- the milk was completely soured!! Luckily, there was another pitcher of milk out, but my suspicion is that the urn that held the milk was not refrigerated the night before. It was unpleasant to say the least. So basically, i would say that this is a decent hotel. I don't think it deserves the raves it recieves on this board, and in the future I might try another location. It is not like this was the worst experience ever, it's just that those special touches you expect at this price level were not there (ie- in every other hotel we stayed at in Italy, the concierge would leave something special in our room to congratulate us, here my husband spent 50 euro to get a bottle of bad bubbly). Perhaps it was our fault for traveling after carnevale? In any case, I wish I could rave along with the others, but it just wasn't great for us. If you need any more info, please contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Ever!”
Reviews.Author: purple_sweetie1
Reviews.Content: I thought i would leave a review as this site really helped me pick this hotel for a surprise for my boyfriends 21st Birthday! This hotel is amazing the reception staff were amazing. Very helpful and very friendly.Helped us with the Water Buses and gave us a free map! Very close to Rialto Bridge and just 10-15 minutes from St Marks Square. And even has a Mcdonalds and burger king close!! The room was amazing! Massive bed and a massive TV!! Lovely Bathroom with bath robes!! If i went to Venice again i would definately come back here as it is a lovely hotel. There are Gondolas right outside the hotel, expesive but they were the same price everywhere 80 euros! But well worth it as we got a excellent view of the Rialto Bridge (grand canal) and went down some of the side streets! I loved it here in Venice very beautiful, peaceful and it doesnt smell!! Well when we went it didnt smell at all! The catherdral on St Marks Square was my favorite day. There were loads of piegeons! We went into the catherdral where you can look out onto the square, great view. Enjoy your stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault”
Reviews.Author: poohface
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very good choice after alot of help from reviews on this site. Newley refurbished 3 years ago and still in good shape. Staff were very nice and helpfull. When you fly into Venice airport take a walk over to the waterbus situated just outside on the left. It works out to be about Â£6.00 each to get to Venice by boat. Well worth it as you have some lovely views. Do not take speed boat unless you don't mind paying 90 euros ! The Gondolas were expensive 80 euros for about 40 mins but has to be done to enjoy the smell ! If you stay at this hotel there is a restaurant just outside on the right which does good food but you have to wait atleast 30 mins just to pay ! Apart from that a lovely place to visit and made better by a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new find”
Reviews.Author: American_in_Italy
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night here for a quick look at Carnivale season. Overall, we were not disappointed. The pluses: modern room / bathroom, marble public areas, decent breakfast (very small though). Good location. Thanks for the tripadvisor who gave the specific directions from Ca d'Oro & the Georgino ristornante. Excellent! (In the past have had a hard time finding a good restaurant in Venice... this was great!) The minuses: I am beginning to think when you book via an online hotel supershop, they give you the worst room in the place. Our room per say was fine. But, when we arrived my husband went to use the bathroom, only to fall off the toliet as the toliet seat was not bolted. Don't you think someone would have noticed this while cleaning? Also the mirror of the cosmetic lighted mirror was missing. When I told the front desk, they quickly fixed the toliet seat (after all this would have been a deal breaker...) but said a previous guest broke the mirror and they were waiting on a repair. Ok.... Also our room was right outside the maid station. So at 7am, you heard her set up her cart with the towels, etc. And the big plastic garbage bags she hauled around sounded magnified at 7am with the ecoeing in the marble hallway. It sounded like she was right in the room! Also even with the shutters shut, you could hear the base 'ba boom' from the carnivale music on the canel... ok given the spirit of carinval (purpose of our visit) but it gets old at 5am, you know? So I have a lot of little nit picks, which I think would be resolved with a better room / location of room. I would probably give it another stay.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita at the Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: dglambeth
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for a short break over Valentine's Day and booked the Foscari Palace largely because of the excellent reviews of it online. We were not disappointed. I am happy to recommend it too. Our Superior Double was sumptuous, with balconies at both tall shuttered windows, and luxurious white marble shower room. The service on the front desk was cheerful and impressive - they even managed to book us a table at the legendary Osteria da Fiore for Valentine's Day. The breakfast buffet served up each morning was excellent. Access all over the city was easy and water taxis drop you right off at the hotel's dock on the Grand Canal. There's a boat stop right beside the hotel but we walked everywhere as nothing's far. In less than ten minutes, you're walking over the Rialto or into St Mark's Square, and the hotel's just off Cannaregio's Strada Nova which is full of shops and restaurants, both cheap ones and fancy ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Tess57
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Stayed last June and returned February 2007, two consistantly great stays. The staff are really on the ball, nothing is too much bother. This is a small city hotel, great location, water taxi from Airport drops you right to the reception area. Within walking distance of the sights and wonderful views overlooking the canal. This time I stayed in a junior suite, the room and bathroom were really lovely and there was a small balcony overlooking the canal. For a city hotel I would rate Foscari Palace highly. Venice is a fab. city for a long weekend. Make sure to bring comfortabe clothes and shoes and you will be sure to enjoy this magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Four Star Foscari”
Reviews.Author: Hertshopeful
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a Christmas present to my husband on the recommendation of Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The location is excellent as it is within easy walking distance of the major attractions, close to the vaperetto stop Ca D'Oro and right beside the public gondola ferry across to the other side of the Grand Canal. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are large, with high ceilings, good bathrooms and all the amenities one would expect eg plasma tv, safe, double sinks, comfortable beds etc. Although our bath featured a jacuzzi and a spa/jet shower, as with other reviewers, we could not get this to work. I think it was a gimick that has not stood the test of time. The breakfast was plentiful and the staff were polite and spoke good English. Thank you to the reviewer who left directions from the airport to the hotel entrance - we followed them exactly and they were perfect. We experienced two very different restaurants, both were wonderful. The first was on the Saturday evening at the San Georgiano (exit hotel turn right into Strada Nova at the end turn left. Hotel San Georgiano on right corner and restaurant along on left. The food was up market Italian and very good (my husband particularly recommends the pastry with peppers, oil and garlic) I had the lobster special. The second dining experience came on Sunday lunchtime when we visited the island of Murano (don't expect glass blowing demonstrations at the weekend - this is a working island and like the rest of us, they work mon-fri) We ambled along from Faro vaporetto stop along the side of the water, across the bridge next to the glass tree and again across the next bridge to the bigger part of the island. We kept the water on our right and took the first turning left. This led us into the Campo San Bernardo. Everything seemed closed, but we heard the tell tale tinkling of cutlery on plates. We followed our ears, then our noses and found an Osteria in the square that had no publicity outside, no open doors etc. Bravely we pushed open the door and were welcomed with an amazing aroma of fresh food, fish, garlic and warmth. The waiter showed us to the back of the restaurant where we sat amongst tables of 12 - 16 multi-generational families - all locals. We had bowls of steaming spaghetti with tender clams and fresh fish or meat to follow. The restaurant gave us (unasked and complimentary) a dish of venetian hard biscotti and a glass of sweet wine to dunk them into. 1 litre of wine, 1 litre of water and the bill came to less than 40 Euros. We had to come back to Venice, as 17 years ago we didn't take a trip on a gondola, as we thought it too expensive at the time. Although relatively, the gondola trip is still expensive, it was worth every penny and I am so glad we went on one.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: Teeka09
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our one night in Venice at dinner time and where just amazed with this place! It seemed each place we stayed in Italy got better and better :) Absolutely beautiful room, spacious, clean and modern. The bathroom was huge and we even got upgraded to have a slight view of the canal. The beds where soooo comfy and the breakie the next morning was yummy. Although dont ask for toast as they take the bread away and bring it back like a rock... hehe we didn't care just found it funny. Perfect location as we walked the entire parts of Venice in one very long day and found it really easy to get from the train station. The stop was Ca D'oro which was a minute walks from the hotel. Much nicer staying up this part of Venice i felt than around San Marco so i am sooo glad i read the fantastic reviews on here. Definitely going to stay here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious experience on the Gran Canal!”
Reviews.Author: basianov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari for four nights and couldn't have been happier. Our room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The bathroom was quite luxurious. My father in law, who was traveling with us, needed a wheelchair during his stay. Unfortunately, we did not plan very well in advance and surprised the hotel with this request upon our arrival. Although it seems to be very difficult to rent a wheelchair in Venice (of course, the streets/canals in Venice make traveling with a wheelchair quite challenging!), the hotel staff really went out of their way to find us one. We did have to wait for a day, but in all fairness, we didn't let them know in advance of our need. As such, we were quite grateful for their kindness and assistance in this matter. The staff, overall, was wonderfully efficient and friendly. We were surprised with a lovely invitation from the hotel manager to an evening reception with period music, prosecco, and chocolates. Quite an enjoyable surprise for our last evening in Venice! The only thing that would make this hotel even better would be a restaurant on premises. However, the breakfast they provide in the morning was wonderful, and the staff was very good at pointing out restaurants in the area. In addition, the hotel has a charming rooftop deck; one afternoon, we bought salami, bread, and olives and feasted on self-made sandwiches on the roof. It was really divine! So, the lack of a restaurant was not a terrible negative, really (probably got us out of the hotel more anyway!). :-) Overall, it is a wonderful location and an outstanding hotel run by a truly professional staff. I could not be more complimentary to the hotel manager. If it is within your budget, I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled expectations”
Reviews.Author: GarethSouthampton
Reviews.Content: I visited the foscari palace for 3 nights (21st-24th January). Having read the wonderful reviews I was slighty apprehensive that it would not meet my high expectations but am pleased to report that it did! As other reviewers have commented the location is brilliant - not at all hard to locate when you arrive weary from your journey. We were greated by a friendly receptionist who promptly checked us in, depite arriving early and had our bags whisked up to our room in no time. The room was well decorated and had character. The whole hotel was spotlessly clean and lovingly kept by the hotel staff. We were in room 306 and had a side view of the canel. The bed was huge and comforatable and we were impressed with the jets in the bath and shower - which we did get working eventually! Breakfast was very nice with a good selections of cereals, cold meats, bread rolls, croissants, fruits, tea, coffee and juices and even very nice looking cake! There was also a selection of hot food - sausages, bacon eggs e.t.c.. all the food was fresh and very tasty and provided a good start to the day. We paid Â£216 for 3 nights bed and breakfast for a superior double room which we believed to be well worth the money and if we ever return to venice we would only stay at the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Semark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem! We stayed in the hotel from 10th-13th January (great time of year to visit Venice as it wasn't as busy as the summer months - no queues in sight!!). The location is excellent (one block away from the Ca D'oro vaporetto stop). We arrived at Marco Polo airport and got the blue ATVO bus (costing 3 Euros per person) which runs from right outside arrivals. It tool about 10-15 minutes and takes you to the Piazza Roma (the bus station). From here, we got our tickets for the ACTV (vaporetto) - we got a 3 day pass (costing 25 Euros per person - well worth it!) and got the No.1 vaporetto - Ca D'Oro is the 5th stop. After getting off the vaporetto, walk up the alley way (there's only one so you can't go wrong), turn right at the end and take your first right again. The hotel is on your left, right next to the Grand Canal. We had room 304 which was amazing - it was a 'superior' double and was spacious and equipped with everything you could possibly need! The bathroom was lovely - twin marble sinks, toilet, bidet and a hydromassage shower over the jacuzzi bath. The shower wasn't quite as I'd thought - the water only comes from one 'source' and doesn't squirt from all angles at once. We didn't manage to get the jacuzzi working either - the hotel staff tried but could not get it to work either. They said they'd get an engineer to look at it but this did not happen in our time at the hotel. There was a huge mirror on one wall of the bathroom, a lighted shaving mirror and numerous other lighting options - and even a built in radio (about 3 stations). The room itself had a huge double bed (well, it was two singles pushed together), a desk, small armchair, lcd tv mounted on the wall, electronic safe in the wardrobe (no charge). There were also tea and coffee making facilities but I have heard that the hotel charges for tea and coffee etc so worth taking a few supplies. The room also had a patio doors leading to a small balcony (with outside table and 2 chairs). Below there was a view of the street below and looking to the left was a view of the Grand Canal - amazing!! The reception staff were all very helpful. We were given a recommendation of a restaurant - can't quite remember the name but began with a G and was the closer of the two they recommended. We were not impressed - it was rather expensive and the service was not the best we've encountered. The food was ok but again, not the best we've had! The other one (on the coast) was shut so could not try that one. There's a good variety of shops which seem to stretch from the Piazza Roma right to St Marks Square and beyond. St Marks, by the way, is about 10-15 minutes leisurely walk, and the Rialto bridge is about 5 minutes walk. If you haven't been to Venice before, it is all flat walking except for the bridges that cross the canals. The hotel gave us a free water taxi to Murano (a must do when in Venice!). There is no catch with this service and does in fact make you feel like James Bond when travelling through the small canals on a fast boat (felt like a limo on water!!) We were given a demonstration of glass blowing which was amazing. There are many rooms filled with items you can buy. We did feel that we were being followed around by one of the staff which was annoying so we left without buying anything. There are numerous other shops on the island which sell the glass so we bought a couple of little keepsakes from these instead. The vaporetto runs back to Venice from numerous locations around the island so getting back is not a problem. Overall, a fantastic hotel, in a great location, and had a friendly, homely feel about it. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pinky19Somerset
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace from 10th-13th January 2007. Unlike another review, we stayed in room 302 upgraded room, there was no noise from our aircon/ heating, which worked well. Had trouble working out the wirpool bath and only managed to get it going once.We also had a side view of the Grand Canal, which was very noisy from 7am. Breakfast was good and plenty of choice, the room was of a good size, with a coffee maker, take your own tea and coffee, hotel charge for packs in rooms. We had a good stay and would return to this hotel. The location is excellent, with vaporetto stop close by, a short walk to the Rialto bridge and 10 minutes from St Marks Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CHDD
Reviews.Content: Overal this hotel offered the quality youâ€™d expect in this price range in Venice, except for a (minor) problem we had. The location is obviously perfect, itâ€™s just a short walk away from the Rialto and next to a vaporetto stop. The desk personel was friendly, the breakfast buffet is fine. We had a superior room, and requested a side view on the Gran Canale. Since it was a quiet period (early januari), we got a large room on the top with a long terrace overlooking the canal â€“ and still at a very good rate, about 45 % off the normal price through Venere.com. If you want a front view on the canal, you should go to the website of the Hotel group (---), as this is only available in some of the more expensive rooms which have to be booked directly with the hotel. The only complaint we have is that, although the inside isolation is very good, at our floor the heating and cooling system permanently produced noise during the night. If youâ€™re a light sleeper and donâ€™t have ear plugs at hand, this could be an issue. Finally, you can find very good restaurants around but note that some (Da Gianni for example) count an extra 10% service on top of the bill and the coperto . If you want a better bargain, check out Muro Cucine E Vino at the fish market, or very close to the hotel Al Vecio Bragozzo has great pasta an fish dishes, but youâ€™ll have to be patient or make a reservation since these places are as popular as they are good.

Reviews.Title: “Amaxzing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GOREDSOXNeedham
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Italy for in April of 2006. Venice was a true highlight of a multi city trip. The Foscari Palace is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! When I checked in I thought they had made a mistake! My family were taken to a incredible room that served as the Grand Ballroom when The Foscari was an embassy! Our room was enormous with 14 overstuffed chairs and a King size bed. This was not what I expected in europe where rooms tend to be small. There was a large fireplace and a plasma TV(not that you need that when in Venice). There were double doors that opened up to another room that overlooked the Grand Canal It had a few sofas and some beds for my 2 sons. My first reaction was WOW. I told my wife and kids not to unpack as I assumed the hotel booking staff had made a mistake and placed us in the wrong room. I checked back at the front desk and the incredibly helpful staff assured me that the room we were given was the one that suggest for a family. OK... so the room was incredible. The staff was very helpful and provided a lot of guidance for first timers to Venice. We enjoyed catching up with some other travelers at breakfast (it was delicious with lots of hot and cold choices) and meeting up with some at the end of the day in the common room off the lobby. The hotel staff did a fine job of pointing us to restaurants that were tucked away in little neighborhoods rather than the tourist traps. I cannot say enough good things about the rooms, the location, the staff, and the food. Foscari Palace was a great value as we found when we traveled to Florence and Rome and did not have a fine a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Have recommend to a friend”
Reviews.Author: happycamperIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the foscari palace for 4 nights arriving on the 18th of December. I cant recommend this hotel enough, we stayed in rm 107 a classic double room which faced onto a small square, it had 4 lovely big windows, it was a good size with a high ceiling there was a flat screen tv but unfortunately not many channels in english but we werent in venice to watch tv!! The bathroom was marble and had a jacuzzi shower combination which was fab and a built in radio in the bathroom. The whole hotel was spotless and the bedroom was turned down at night and the shutters closed. We received a complimentary bowl of fruit and two bottles of water on arrival and on our last day a packed lunch. The breakfast was brillant lots of variety between fruit, breads, cold meat, cheese and cooked foods. The whole hotel was spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and efficient. It was a short walk fromt he hotel to all the attractions in venice and if you dont feel like walking there is a public transport boat stop one block away. We really enjoyed our stay we found it to be reasonablely priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - higly recommended”
Reviews.Author: kimsloh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late November for 4 nights. Chose the hotel based on the review posted in tripadvisor. These reviews were spot on! I was placed in room 105. Although not overlooking the grand canal, I was not disappointed. The room was spacious - considering the size of the rooms I have stayed in other Italian hotels. The bathroom was large by most standard. The decor was modern and room facilities top class. The location was perfect - far away from the noisy St Marks square but close enough for a leisurely walk. The valporetto stop of C'Daro is just around the corner for the longer trips. Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment though. The variety perhaps can be better improved. However the free cocktail evening was a novel idea. Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “I'm stingy with praise, but this place deserves it fully.”
Reviews.Author: Shyster951
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for my family & we stayed 4 nights from 15 Dec. 2006. My 2 adult daughters stayed in a Classic Double (Rm 103 [--] that overlooks an alley) while I upgraded for 75 Euro/night to a Deluxe Double (Rm 101) that has 2 windows directly overlooking the Grand Canal. Room 101 is HUGE, with what must be 20 foot ceilings (wood beamed and paneled) green marble floors, & a very US sized bathroom. Rm 103 was also very comfortable, with a nicely wood inlaid floor with some rugs, marble floored bathroom as well. Ceiling likewise tall, but not so ornately decorated. Both bathrooms had a tub/shower combination unit that is also a jacuzzi tub! Internet access is via Ethernet cable. No extra charge. Music from 5 different channels can be heard over speakers mounted in the walls of your bedrooms and bathrooms (can listen to different channels in each room) Rooms kept immaculately & were very quiet. Occasionally you'd hear people on boats as they were on the Grand Canal, but not often. You could hear the a number of gondolas rocking in their moorings outside, but this seemed a restful sound, not disturbing. The hotel has a private dock so you can, as we did, take a private taxi from the airport directly to the hotel and not have to navigate your luggage around the sidewalks. Literally right outside the front door is Campo St. Sophia where you will find a traghetto that crosses the Grand Canal for 0.50 Euro/person so you do not have to walk down to the Rialto bridge to cross. Gondoliers are right there as well. A short block up towards the train station is the vaproetto stop for the #1 Vaporetto. The main 'drag' to the Rialto bridge (a major shopping street) is likewise right out of the front door. St. Mark's is about a 10 minute walk, and is quite easy to follow. The Rialto is no more than 5 minutes away. The train station is perhaps a 20 minute walk in the other direction. Good restaurants are less than a 2 minute walk away. There is a nice platform on the rooftop for sitting out with a nice view of the Grand Canal and the rooftops of Venice. We only went up there once however due to the brisk weather we had during our stay. Breakfast was VERY complete. Scrambled Eggs, the European equivalent of bacon, & sausage all hot. Hardboiled eggs and a large table piled high with yogurt, cereal, cheeses, 3 kinds of cold cuts, juices, fruits, torts and you can order up a cappuccino. A mini bar is also provided inn your room. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful, spoke enough English, and had good suggestions for nearby places to eat dinner, & the like. I booked these rooms in Feb 2006 and got a rate of 125 Euro/night for the Classic double through [--]. We paid the same amount to stay in a much less desirable spot (Antica Dimora Firenze) a few days later in Florence. I would definitely return to this property upon my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Just as promised”
Reviews.Author: marco123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the week of Thanksgiving (US). Everything about this hotel exceeded our expectations. Hotel was very clean, staff was very friendly, and provided advice on dining, etc. The location is perfect, right in the middle of Venice. We took the water taxi from Marco Polo to the hotel doorstep, which was very expensive, but worth the unique experience. Within the first day we got very comfortable with the waterbus system, and so we took the express bus back to Marco Polo at the end of the trip, its a couple of Euro. This hotel was literally one block from the Waterbus stop, and so there was nowhere we needed/wanted to go in Venice that was too far of a walk or at all uncomfortable. A great value for Venice. We were shocked by the friendliness of the city, which was very clean, extreamly safe, and gave a sort of small town feel. We got lost one day, and walked to the end of the city, and didn't realize we had been walking for long at all. Definately take the trip to Murano and Burano, but do it yourself on the waterbus. Glass making was very cool, but only buy what you want. Make sure you have a plan to get it home, shipping is very expensive, and glass is breakable (one carryon only allowed).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice”
Reviews.Author: Viajero Del Mundo
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Venice on the train, stepped out of the building and promptly fell in love. Surrounded by water, It is such a beautiful city, it takes your breath away. I was sick with a very bad cold, so had to miss out on some night life, spent it in bed in the hotel. Not so bad, huge comfy bed, flat screen TV (alas, not much on that's English). The hotel does show a nightly movie though. So I just snuggled up in bed, and nursed myself back to health. The breakfast was fantastic and included the cost of the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: patncolin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early December 2006. Everything about the hotel was excellent. Reception staff were very helpful. Barman recommended an excellent restaurant (Algiubagio on the Fondamente Nove) and booked a table for us. Reception staff rang up the bus service for queries etc for us. Facilities in the bathroom were unbelievable, including whirlpool bath, robes, more toiletries than I've seen in any hotel etc. The hotel was very central to everything without being on top of it and the water buses were very close. Breakfast buffet very good. The only negative comments on this site seem to be about paying for the coffee in the room(which was only 1.50 euros), I would say, pay 3 euros in the bar and get biscuits and chocolates served on a silver platter with it too! Cocktail party on the last night (with a harpist) for which there was no charge at all. I would unhesitatingly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A most memorable trip”
Reviews.Author: tonyward
Reviews.Content: Like most reviewers here, I booked Foscari based on the hotels's overwhelming positive feedbacks and rating. Although we didn't get a canal facing room but we were upgraded from a classic double to a Superior. The accomodation was very comfortable, room was very spacious with excellent facilities. The spa bath and jet shower was fantastic especially after a long day of walking around the Ventian canals. The staff were really friendly and extremely helpful. We arrived on the Saturday, and they had an evening reception of canapes and presecco over live harpist whom was magnificient. The hotel is very centrally located and most sites were within 15 minutes walk. Next to the hotel is the Santa Sofia traghetto stop, where you can hop onto a gondola which took you over to the Rialto market and only cost 50 cent. Bargain! There are an abundance of restaurants dotted near the hotel, but my two favourite places are Trattoria alla Madonna at calle della Madonna, San Polo, and also Osteria alla Botte, Calle della Bissa, San Marco. Both are near the Rialto bridge. They are high quality but exceptinal value and frequented mainly by locals and has lots of character! Must try the Sardine Saor at Madoona. Also if you enjoy wine, then it's worth going Osteria hoping during the day. They all serve delicious snack food like breaded sardines, and what better than to wash it down with a nice glass of Valpolicella!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disapointed”
Reviews.Author: ozzie-expat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the wonderful Foscari Palace on the 25th and 26th November. We picked this hotel on the reccomendations on Tripadvisor. We were not dissapointed, as other reviewers have said the hotel is spotless the staff are so welcoming and helpful. We had a wonderful room with a view of the Grand Canal (magic) The position of he hotel is great and so easy to get to. We caught the blue bus from the airport to P. Roma and then the water bus No1 to the Ca' dora and the Foscari palace is just around the corner. Venice is an amazing city and we loved just wandering down any little street that we liked the look of, with a photo opportunity around every corner you can't go wrong. We would definitely love to someday return and we will definitely stay at the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “One of The Best Hotels We've Ever Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: Michael/Steven
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have traveled all over the world and pretty extensively around Europe. And we can honestly say here that this is one of the finest hotels we've even had the pleasure of staying in. The location on the Grand Canal is superb, with the vaporetto stop one block away. It is a 10 to 15 minute walk to St. Mark's Square, if one were to even want to walk straight there and not enjoy all the sights and shops along the way. The hotel staff was amazing from the minute we checked in until the morning of our check out. Absolute attention to detail is everywhere: the rooms are beautiful, with every moderm convenience, including flat-screen televisions, towel warmers and robes. They do a lovely turndown service in the evening. The bartender during our stay was excellent, remembering our drink orders from the evening before and bringing us snacks with our cocktails. The Saturday evening cocktail party is so lovely, with beautiful snacks and complimentary drinks and a harp player in period dress in the lobby area. It feels like one is in someone's sumptuous livingroom. The breakfast was amazingly diverse and fresh. The entire hotel is absolutely spotless and perfection itself. We simply can not recommmend this hotel enough! You will have a lovely stay! In our opinion this should be a five-star property. And we do not make such statements lightly. The staff here is very proud of their beautiful hotel and so attentive to their guests. We absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “So good you'll want to return”
Reviews.Author: Xstar
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of the positive reviews from fellow TripAdvisors. Many thanks folks because this really is a delightful hotel and I wouldn't have found it otherwise. Of course, the hotel's main advantage is it's location directly on the Grand Canal together with the sensible room rates. The No 1 vaporetto stop (Bus/coach/ rail connections - St Marks' Square -Lido) is just a block away. There's also a gondola ferry crossing - a 'Traghetti' - that's literally outside the side door and the gondoliers will ferry you across for 50 (euro) cents a go over to the main fish and vegetable markets - it's like living over Covent Garden but so peaceful and quiet at night! Take my advice and arrive in style from Marco Polo Airport in a water taxi. It's 100 euro but worth every cent and you can always eat pizza for dinner later if you need to make an economy. (There's loads of pizza bars, pavement cafes, 2 supermarkets and decent restaurants around the corner from the hotel. I just liked sitting in the corner cafe reading my book.) Some reviewers have complained about having to buy teabags from the room mini-bar. So, yes, bring your own with you if you must - but you won't starve or go thirsty in this place! - breakast is a joy - even for vegetarians like me - you are really spoiled for choice - and the staff are always happy to oblige with morning tea or espresso. I walked my socks off in Venice - so come prepared with stout walking shoes. There is an exquisite delight to see around each street corner and if this is your first time in Venice, the urge to explore is irresistible. I took vaporetti trips to Murano and Burano (thoroughly recommended) just so I would sit down! Apologies for being so effusive but I've been back in London 3 days now and still haven't wound down from the beauty of the place. I'm planning another out-of-season trip soon and will definitely be staying at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - really loved it”
Reviews.Author: Clivethegreat
