Reviews.Content: So many good things to say about this place...simply loved it. Staff are great, professional and helpful. My "partner" and I both loved it so much we are going to go back next year. On one evening there was a lady playing a harp in the seating room, which was fab, in addition the hotel put on a great spread - with great organisation, detail and presentation. Now if that dont rock your boat tehn you really ought not to be visitin venice! Fresh flowers and smells really welcoming all over the hotel. immaculately clean. staff excellent from reception to cleaners gondola crossing in front of hotel excellent makes your journey to rialto bridge and st marks very short indeed (only 0.50 cents per person) Looking at some of the comments on here it is not surprising that most people rate this 5 star - especially when there is a comment from the hotel management - this in my humble opinion goes to show just how much attention to detail the hotel puts into their guest - well done, looking forward to coming back some day - and promise we wont stay anywhere but Foscari palace. we were warned of noise disturbance from building works - but there was hardly any, and where there was noise it was hardly noticeable. Cant stop raving about this place. Bed turn down service excellent - nice to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rileyjane
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i had a wonderful in this great hotel. Everything was great, wonderful breakfast lots of choice as much as one could eat. If we go back to venice we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: MGerein
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Foscari Palace was quite nice! Our room was a "standard" room, so not the best of views, but how much time do you REALLY spend in your room in Venice, anyways?? The selection at breakfast was excellent (my husband is in withdrawal for the brioche with cream!), our room very comfortable, and the service was good (if slightly "cold", as compared to the service we received elsewhere in Italy). The location of the Foscari Palace is one of its greatest strengths. Nothing is more than a 10-15 minute walk away, and it is right off of a major vaporetto stop. (Big tip: buy the "Venice Card" passes for the vaporetto...certain versions also then cover entry fees to other museums and churches too. It also works for the Vaporetto trips to the other islands, like Murano and Burano). Overall, I was not disappointed with my stay at Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tab+mac
Reviews.Content: Foscari Palace does not disapoint. We stayed in the gonzaga suite, the balcony view was breathtaking The entire staff was warm and helpful. Wonderful breakfast to start the day. Location was ideal. Room was huge and extremly clean. Personal touches many, sound system, elegant, champagne upon arrival turndown service even includes linen on bedside floor. If this is your first trip to Venice then make Foscar Palace your first choice, you will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Venice at the Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: alikat747
Reviews.Content: After meetings in Siena and a week in Umbria, my husband and I took the train from Florence to Venice for a terrific three-day stay at the Hotel Foscari Palace. While I had only been able to book a standard double room with Orbitz, I called the property directly, explaining that we were on a delayed honeymoon and were able to upgrade to the Foscari Suite, which is the room you see on the first floor behind all the flags! It was amazing. The living room, with it's almost floor to ceiling windows (six of them) is directly on the canal with views in all directions. The bedroom is entered through double doors off the living room and is directly above the main street entrance of the hotel. Both rooms are gigantic and beautifully furnished! During the day, there is a constant stream of traffic on the canal which is fascinating to observe (how they don't run each other over with all the barges, water taxis, water buses and gondolas is anyone's guess!). At night, it was wonderfully quiet, with only the sound of the water gently lapping against the building and gondolas parked in front. And, the comfortable bed with traditional pure linen sheets and down comforter made dreamland easy to find. The hotel has a sweet, small rooftop bar which affords great views over all the city, including the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks. One can also sit downstairs in the comfortable lobby as well. The breakfast room is charming and the selection was incredible - by any standard! The front desk staff is excellent and gave us great tips for dining. We didn't want the tourist restaurant (although, OK, we did go to Harry's Bar one afternoon for Bellini's) and they directed us to typical Venetian restaurants all within easy walking distance from the Hotel. Our favorite was Algiubagio, which is right on the Adriatic. WOW! Fabulous food and wine - and service! Right out in front is a gondola service that can take you across to the other main island and is busy all day with Venetians going to and from work and university, etc. Also, you can book private gondola rides there, which we did the last night....splurged on a 1-1/2 hr ride and it was well worth it. This is a really lovely hotel with an accommodating staff and we really enjoyed our stay and hope you will, too.

Reviews.Title: “4 star, well priced hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: msalden
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our honeymoon for 3 nights. for 2 night we had room 101 overlooking the grand canal, and the last night we had 105 overlooking the street to the right of the hotel. both rooms were great, but the room with the view of the canal was amazing. Waking up to the sound of gondeliers and the fish market opposite the canal was such an experience. wathcing the sun go down over venice was so romantic. I was impressed with this hotel in terms of quality of rooms (huge, exceptionally clean and modern) and the breakfast (cute little room bursting with food inc cooked breakfast for UK/USA needs!) staff were positive, location was good for all sights. this hotel is far enough away from St Marks (10 min walk) to avoid being ripped of for everything. buildings either side of the hotel are being restored, but the contruction noise didnt bother us,. I would reccomend this hotel if you want 4 star quality & dont want to pay Hotel Gritti/Cipriani prices. Venice is ultra expensive for hotels and I think this is the best value. try and get a room overlooking the canal if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Rita29
Reviews.Content: Having picked this hotel on the back of Trip Advisor reviews and then subsequently saw a few more unfavourable ones I was a bit nervous about the hotel, particularly as it was for my husband's 40th. However, in all we really enjoyed the hotel and we would stay there again although we will likely have the kids in tow next time so couldn't really afford it. What is recommended though is that before booking you research thoroughly what room you will get. We were on the second floor, deluxe front canal view rm 201 which was fine and yes did have a wonderful frontal view ending with the markets over the other side. However, there was construction work on either side and some of the rooms I would imagine would be facing the scaffolding and not getting much of a view at all. By the way, once the window was closed you couldn't hear anything but if you wanted fresh air then perhaps it could be a bit noisy. The room was spacious, beds very comfortable, furnishings were luxurious, spotlessly clean and the bathroom was great although the jacuzzi bath did not work and while that didn't matter much to me so I didn't report it, but it might to others. Really appreciated the turndown service at night which meant getting fresh towels for use the next day - that's a sign of a good hotel. The breakfast was really good I thought - lots of selection: fresh fruit, cereals, bacon, scrambled eggs, juices, different croissants, breads including a kind of great olive sconebread, cakes, cheeses, meats etc. The staff on at breakfast were very efficient, jolly and helpful. The staff generally were great especially Divna on reception who responded to my booking emails really promptly and who was very helpful and friendly when we were there and the barman who served us a cracking martini. However, my only criticism was that when we arrived the guy on reception didn't really welcome us in a particularly warm way but was politely efficient in his conversation with us. I think it was this slightly 'coldish' behaviour that some of the past reviewers must have been talking about. After that though the reception staff were fine. In all the hotel is in a great spot, so close to the vaporetto that we didn't bother with the expense of a water taxi from the airport and away from the complete madness around St Mark's square. You can also get a gondala ride across the canal for 50 cents to the other side near the Rialto bridge. We loved Venice, walked our feet off, and apart from one restaurant ate really well. The only major disappointment was that the day we had booked the Secret Itineries tour at the Doges Palace, the palace was shut because of a strike.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: fc1
Reviews.Content: My brother and I took my mother to Venice as a birthday present and chose the Foscari Palace based on its TripAdvisor reviews. We weren't let down. The location is excellent (right next to a vaporetto stop and a 10-15 minute walk from San Marco etc.), the staff were professional, helpful and friendly, the room was lovely with comfy beds (although my brother had a truckle bed since we requested a triple and he wasn't so impressed) and a great bathroom, and breakfast was amazing each morning (a choice of pastries, yoghurts, fruits, meats, eggs etc). The best thing about our stay though was the 'cocktail party' they threw on our first night. Delicious drinks and nibbles were provided in the lounge rooms which look over the Grand Canal - if you are lucky enough to stay when they hold one of these definitely pop along.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pearcet100
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Foscari Palace for 3 days as part of our honeymoon. I have to say it was by far the best hotel we stayed in during our tour through Italy. Breakfast was a delight each morning. My wife is alergic to all dairy products and flowers the hotel catered for our needs by providing soya milk and removing the flowers. Nothing was too much trouble. When we return to Venice we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel special”
Reviews.Author: Whiffco
Reviews.Content: It had been my girlfriends dream to visit Venice and I had arranged it for a Christmas present. From our sunset water boat trip across the lagoon it was starting to be a trip of a lifetime. Arriving at the Foscari Palace it set it in stone. The hotel was clean and the desk staff courteous, friendly and very efficient. As soon as we arrived we were handed an invitation to a champagne reception in the lounge where Venetian musicians in 19th century dress played delighful classical music from the period. It was a magical start to the stay. We had booked the Superior double and were only mildly disappointed that the window overlooked a street but the room itself was beautifully decorated and clean. The air-conditioning worked well (which was just as well as it was very cold in February). The bathroom was sumptuous and the addition of the jet-spa bath was simply wonderful. Snow laden streets of Venice are countered wonderfully with a luxurious hot jet spa bath. Service was impaccable with the bed turned down and my girfriends nightdress beautifully folded on her pillow. Breakfast was a lovely buffet in the small but comfortable dining room with attentive serving staff. The hotel is situated a short distance from the Rialto Bridge and next the Traghetto taking you across the Grand Canal to the Rialto Market opposite. It is only a 10 minute walk to St Marks Square (longer if you stop along the way - which you will). The Foscari Palace was the corner stone of one of the most memorable trips I have ever taken. The staff were clean, attentive, courteous, friendly and very helpful. The hotel was clean, very beautiful, comfortable and cosy. I plan to return to Venice and this is the hotel that I shall book, every time.

Reviews.Title: “The cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Diane,Merseyside
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Venice for my 40th birthday and we stayed at the Foscari Palace for 3 nights. Fantastic first impressions,very professional and clean. Our room had a balcony with table and chairs although it was very cold outside we still tried it out. What impressed me the most was the cleanliness of the hotel,especially our room. The maid came into the room after we'd left for the day then again to lay mats at our bedside and to clean the wonderful bathroom after we went out for the evening. The location was great-right on the Grand Canal-the breakfast was lovely.Overall I couldn't fault a thing. There is only one thing-I'm going back to Venice with my sisters but couldn't get a room here because it was booked up.

Reviews.Title: “tripadvisor was right on”
Reviews.Author: sunsfanatic
Reviews.Content: Reserved 3 rooms at the Foscari Palace one year ago or more based on reviews here. Just returned and was pleasantly surprised, being that the hotel is in NO major guidebooks .The palace is a jewel. We had 3 rooms in all price ranges including the Gonzaga Suite. All were beautiful, well-equipped and quiet.We had 3 windows (double glazed) looking out on the Grand Canal. The 600 year old building has been beautifully restored and there was no hustle-bustle in the hotel or its immediate vicinity. A vaporetto stop is only one block away. The prices were excellent compared to other accomodations in Venice if you don't mind the 15 minute walk to Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari stay was great...”
Reviews.Author: T&M12
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Foscari Palace, and our stay was as good as a majority of reviews said it would be... Using a water taxi from the cruise ship we landed at the front dock to the Foscari and were immediately met by the porter. The lobby area of the hotel was spacious and beautiful. Our superior double room was large and well appointed(107), and looked out on the courtyard and had a partial view of the canal. The bathroom was all marble and quite large. The breakfast buffet was very good, including eggs and bacon, as well as numerous additionals such as cereals, fruit selections, breads and sweet buns, and various juices. The Saturday evening cocktail and hors-d'oeuvres party hosted by the Foscari was a welcomed extra treat. All of the staff were courteous and helpfull. We did receive a 3 a.m. morning call and the arranged water taxi was there promply at 4 a.m. for the trip to the airport (the only transport at that early hour). Once on the airport dock, luggage carts were available and we rolled our luggage up to the check-in counter(5 min. walk on smooth surfaces). If you are planning to stay at the Foscari, you may want to go for either the Superior or Canal view rooms. Like many hotels in Venice the gap between buildings is narrow such that the window view may be of the next building and not one of the other 3 open sides as the occasional negative review complained about.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: Gemima
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Foscari Palace to celebrate our 35 wedding anniversary. We took a water taxi from the airport which was excellent - expensive but so fantastic and quick. Our room was lovely and overlooked the Grand Canal. The hotel was ideally situated and made sightseeing very easy. There was a water bus stop roughly 8 minutes stroll from the hotel. We ventured over to the islands one day and had a fantastic time. Borano is beautiful and so is Torcello. Not so enthusiastic about Morano though. The hotel booked us a table at the Fiaschetteria Toscana for our actual anniversary. This was very disappointing. The meal was okay but the service was dreadful, so dreadful in fact that we did not leave a tip. We did find a gem of a restaurant just round the corner from the hotel. It was the Hosteria Al Vecio Bragosso. Superb seafood, lovely atmosphere, very busy (so do book) but lots of locals eat there too. We found the hotel perfect, but thought it was a bit mean to charge for tea bags in your room so following a previous reader's tip, we took our own. Do take comfortable walking shoes as you do lots of walking but there is lots to see. If you do stay at this hotel, DON'T forget to visit the roof terrace. This is superb, especially on a nice day when you can sit back and enjoy a chilled glass of Prosecco - absolute bliss!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Soooper
Reviews.Content: We chose the Foscari Palace because of the good reviews it has on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. Receptionist, Divna, was really helpful when I was trying to find 2 rooms with canal view and not facing the adjacent building works( see other reviews). She arranged a water taxi to collect us from the airport. Unfortunately this didn't arrive and we had to find our own (no problem and 20Euros cheaper than Divna's quotation). When we arrived Divna was most apologetic and later arranged for us to have a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine in the cocktail bar. The hotel is very tastefully decorated and immaculately clean. Our rooms were fantastic, with complimentary bowl of fruit and bottle of mineral water. The marble fitted bathroom was superb and the beds large and very comfortable. The view of the Grand Canal and the market opposite was so fascinating, particularly early morning that I could have stood on the balcony all day, watching the goings-on! The dining room is small but the buffet breakfast was excellent, with a huge choice of cold dishes and a small hot buffet too. On our second morning we crossed swords with a rather bolshy waitress who stopped us from pushing 2 tables together, so that the 4 of us could eat together. No reason was given for this and we were left gobsmacked. It caused much amusement among the other diners. Apart from this one incident we had a wonderful stay, and althought it is one of the more expensive hotels in Venice I would certainly recommend it for "that special occasion"

Reviews.Title: “the Foscari-a hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: DoveCanyonREALTOR
Reviews.Content: We just got home from an overnight at this hotel and I felt compelled to write a review. It's always worrisome to book a hotel in another country, especially if you don't know the language. I've heard horror stories from others about lost reservations and horrible reservation staff but I can say from my own experience at this particular hotel that you will have nothing to worry about. We booked our stay on Expedia, only staying overnight as it was the last night of our cruise (15 night) vacation and I knew we'd want to get home but didn't want to miss out on Venice. Upon embarkation from the cruise ship, we wandered over to the water taxi station to catch a ride. Not cheap, let me advise you there. It was 90 euros to hire a taxi. That said, it was a good choice as we had 4 very heavy suitcases and two carry ons and since we were only staying one night-we didn't have time to waste. The Foscari Palace sits right on the Grand Canal with a gondola station right out front. The reservation staff was friendly and helpful and we had no trouble with our reservation whatsoever. They all speak English, so that was also a bonus. Our room was clean and had unexpected surprises such as a flat screen TV, fluffy robes and a foot massager in the jetted tub. We had a welcome basket of fruit from the manager as well! The location is wonderful-off the main tourist route, quiet at night and the room shut up so dark that I was grateful for my wake up call or else we might have slept until noon. It's a nice hike to St. Mark's, so bring your (flat) walking shoes. We thought we must do a stop at Harry's Bar but let me tell you, it's much too expensive to sit and have a few drinks. Take a look inside and save your money! All restaurants inside St. Mark's are terribly expensive but we found a great place just around the corner where we had a great meal with our ship friends. I don't think it's possible to have a bad meal in Venice unless you're crabby and unadventurous. A gondola ride, 35-40 minutes, ran us 80 euros. We had to do it and no, you don't need to make a reservation unless you wish to do a ride after 7PM. You can catch a gondola at many places along the canals. We chose one that was black and gold and flashy. Our gondolier didn't sing to us but he gave us a nice tour with a history lesson and answered all of our questions. After a nice evening, a good night's rest, we were treated to an EZ check out and a wonderful breakfast. We opted to take the water taxi to the airport for the simplicity of it all and were glad we had made a reservation as a few of the vaparetto *buses* were on strike that day. It was 90 Euros to Marco Polo airport, another 20 Euros for a porter who took us directly to our check in line. Nothing was cheap but the memories were priceless and I would def. recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a restful and romantic getaway in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyluce
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel to celebrate my 30th Birthday. The hotel is beautifully kept and our room was amazing. The breakfast is really worth it, loads of choice. The setting is great, you can sit on the top terrace and look down the grand canel. There is a Vaporatta stop about two minutes away but we walked to most places. It takes about 20-30 minutes to get to San Marco by foot and it is such a wonderful place. Recommened this every time for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A class act”
Reviews.Author: europeandeco
Reviews.Content: Further to other trip advisor reviews, we stayed at the Foscari for my wife 40th Birthday. I would thoroughly recommend the hotel, amongst others, for the following reasons. The location is very central and pleasent and is within easy walking distance of St.Marks square and the associated attractions (Basilica, Doges Palace, Campanile, Bridge of Sighs etc). The Rialto bridge is also just 5 minutes away. There are some nice restaurants close by (ask the Hotel for a recommendation) and for shopaholics you will be spoilt for choice. Now then, the Hotel itself. If you can possibly afford it, get a water taxi from Marco Polo airport right to the door, it's a really memorable way to arrive and worth the extra expense. The Hotel is small and personal and very tastefully furnished and professionally run. The staff are very polite and courteous. The rooms are large and beautifully appointed with flat screen TV's, marble floors and bathrooms and mini bars. The beds are large and comfortable and attention is paid to detail (fruit bowl on arrival, bath robes and slippers, leaving pack etc) with a bed turn down service in the evening. A real MUST is to use the roof terrace (order your drinks at the bar first) as you get fantastic views across the roof tops towards St. Marks square and beyond. I have stayed in a number of quality hotels and I am confident to say that the Foscari takes some beating. There is simply a feel good factor here. I hope they keep to the formula.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Havefuneatwell
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very nice 2 night stay at the Foscari Palace. Since we had a lot of luggage and our 3 year old daughter, we took a water taxi from the train station (50 euros) and to the airport (100 euros). There are definitely cheaper ways to travel as mentioned in other reviews, but if you have tons of luggage, this is the way to go. The hotel is located next to the Santa Sofia Traghetto stop (a traghetto is like a basic gonodola but only crosses the Grand Canal, lasts 3 minutes, and costs 0.50 euros!) and a very short walk from the Ca Dâ€™Oro vaporetto stop. It is located in the Carneggio section of Venice, with several good restaurants and shops nearby. Itâ€™s far enough away from St Markâ€™s square so it is not too crowded. The day reception staff is professional and polite but could be warmer. The night reception woman was very friendly and gave us excellent restaurant recommendations (A la Vecia Cavana is a must, and nearby). We also liked Giorgioneâ€™s nearby. The hotel itself is very nicely decorated inside. The rooms are somewhat like those in standard American hotels but a very nice size for Europe. The bathroom is modern with 2 showerheads and body sprays. The breakfast, we believe, is outstanding, with pastries, eggs, many juices, yogurt, etc. You could certainly skip lunch after eating here! The only negative about the entire stay was on the day of our departure when they forgot to give us a wake up call at 630am. It forced us to miss breakfast and head straight to the airport. The departing gift box is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: tabbykins
Reviews.Content: We were at the Foscari Palace last week, staying in the Gonzaga Suite. This suite is fabulous, huge, split level, marble floors, massive marble bathroom with seperate bath & big shower cubicle, seperate dressing area, original coffered ceiling, 2 exquisite chandeliers, 3 french windows with balconies providing what must be one of the most wonderful views in the world. Best quality towels & linens. To celebrate our special trip we found a beautiful display of scented Stargazer lillies & a bottle of Prosecco on ice waiting for us as well as bottled water & basket of very fresh fruit. We arrived by water taxi which I think is part of the Venice experience. We were greeted warmly by name & made to feel very welcome. All the staff at this hotel provide an impeccable & very personal level of service which I believe can only be offered in a hotel of this size. Literally nothing is too much trouble. The good service starts before arrival as all my EMails were answered warmly & within hours. When we left Divna came out to see us off in our watertaxi, it was like leaving friends. There have been a small number of reviewers who say they were treated coldly, this puzzles me as this differs totally from my own experience. Divna, Magdellana(sp?), Roger & the other 2 gentlemen were outstanding with the right balance of friendliness & professionalism & the service they provided for us could not be beaten. The roof terrace & bar is lovely, & the drinks are served to you with a little tray of nibbles. By the way, the price of the drinks were a welcome surprise for a city like Venice, less than some of the bars outside of the hotel & with such a view! On a personal note, Hi to Marty & Rosalee from LA if you are reading this, thank you for your company & we enjoyed meeting you, (from Pete & Renee). Some reviewers appear to have issues with their room & views. It really is a question of receiving what you pay for, particularly in an expensive city like Venice. There is no such thing as a free lunch, if you require a full canal view then you must pay for it. The prices at the Foscari are remarkably reasonable when compared to other hotels in Venice. I thought our lovely suite for what we paid was a bargain. This is my fourth trip to Venice so I feel familiar with what is on offer at what price. The location is perfect & I will not add to what has already been explained fully and very well by other reviewers. To sum up, the Foscari Palace made our latest visit to Venice the best yet & although I usually like to try different places to stay wherever I go, I will make the exception for the Foscari Palace & will return there as soon as possible. If you are thinking of a stay here, don't hesitate, I can highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and could be better”
Reviews.Author: Mr Steve-1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was No.1 when I booked in jan- now it's No.6 and I can see why. Firstly the good points. Excellent location, very swish interior, staff good, breakfast ok (but not 4 star quality). You get a built in radio. and mini bar. They make your bed in the evening and leave funny mats on the floor. Now the bad, we were in a classic double room (202), the advertised price is 320euro, and I'm pleased I didn't pay that! The room was tiny. The space was swallowed up by a big bed and wardrobe. Not enough room for 2 people. The view was pathetic, (see picture) of a building being renovated, no glass in the windows, sited 7 feet away. Consequently the room was dark despite the sunny weather. LCD TV in room, probably only because there is no room for a fatter tv. There is no space to put your cases. The bathroom looked good- shower with body jets and whirl bath. However the shower was rubbish as space was so limited, if you did not bump the shower screen (causing bathroom to flood) you would bump the hoses/nozzles/taps changing temperature or pressure of water- most annoying!. The mirrors could do with replacing too. Bring your own shower gel, as the sachets you get here are impossible to open with wet hands. My advice?- make sure you don't get room 202.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Italian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: broadcast9
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Venice and the Foscari Palace as our last hotel on a two week Italian honeymoon. It was the finest hotel we stayed at. We booked a superior room- with a view of the canal and a balcony. The room was the largest of any we visited. Like others in Italy- a king size bed is actually two twins put together. The room was superb- wonderful shower and spa tub- exceptionally clean. The staff was friendly and cordial- helpful with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Foscari”
Reviews.Author: travelinfools
Reviews.Content: I can only say good about this hotel. There was a group of us that stayed. 14 people and 6-7 rooms for between 2 and 5 nights. Everyone in our group raved to me for picking this hotel. The staff was great. Especially the lady night desk clerk and Giseppi. The breakfast was amazing. I have never seen such a feast. The hotel was easy to find and centrally located. When we had to leave for our cruise, 14 people and all that luggage, they got us water transportation right at the door!! Fresh fruit on arrival and a departing gift box with cookies and juice. I would suggest this hotel to everyone and hope to come back again. J. Murney

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Foscari Palace.- small and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PAZZERIA
Reviews.Content: Great location, warm reception and a beautiful room especially the bathroom. Was greeted with a beautiful fruit basket and bottles of water. The staff was pleasant and helpful and the location was superb. The bathroom was comfortable and the shower very unusual. ONe of the best air-conditioned rooms. When we left a CIAO basket was sent on our departure. Loved this hotel. Jo-Ann and family, Staten Island, New york

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Trav25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our silver wedding anniversary. A great location, quiet yet close to everywhere either on foot or by vaporetto ( ca' d'oror stop is a few yards from hotel). The hotel is great, very comfortable, excellent service (room cleaned twice a day) and unlike some reviewers we found the staff helpful and friendly. Where it lets itself down is with the crazy notion of providing a tea \ coffee maker in the room but charging for the tea and coffee. I suspect like us most guests buy supplies from the supermarket and just use the machine anyway, so as an attempt to raise revenue it's somewhat futile. It's only a small detail but does give the impression that the hotel is a bit mean spirited, which isn't in fact the case. On our first night there was an excellent cocktail party for guests with unlimited free food and drink. It is still a great hotel and we would happily stay there again and recommend to anyone who wanted affordable luxury in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Frost at reception”
Reviews.Author: Vegasdebut007
Reviews.Content: The weather during our short break in Venice was just just too hot. It was just about bearable because this hotel was central-ish and we could do short trips to the places we wanted to see and then go back and recover. We won't be going in July / August again. We have got away with it for the last few years but that really was hot to bear. The hotel is modern with good facilities. There is building across the way which did not really disturb us - just unsightly. The breakfast was very good but we have had better. The sitting rooms were cool and luxurious and had the bonus of a view onto the grand canal. I thought the price we paid was at the top end for what we got. We have stayed in the three other hotels (Rialto, Duodo Palace and the Columbina) and got better value in all of those. Probably my biggest criticism is for the concierge chaps who seemed cold even frosty when I asked questions about route and restaurants. They were haughty and dismissive and it frankly tarnished the trip. I was keen to enjoy Venice and travel with a positive attitude but they were cold blanket on the start to the day. I had to remember that it was ME who was the guest. I really do not want to put others off because this is a very good hotel and deserves it ratings and good reviews here. It is just that I believe in Trip Advisor and its influence and that we should speak as we find in the most objective manner. Very good hotel but there are better for the money and closer to St Marks. Front people need to cheer up and develop a sense of humour and a willingness to help others - that is exactly what they are there for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Arlene&Co
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the Grand Canal ie(the water laps the door)! If you have to book a water taxi from the airport make sure you do it from the uk as it is a lot cheaper. The hotel is a cracker all the staff are very friendly and helpful, the breakfast(buffet) is superb whith a great selection, we booked a superior room which was excellent it had a spa suite lovely marbled room ,and all expected facilities in the room. The room was cleaned to a superb standard every day and every evening the beds were turned. This hotel has a real good roof terrace that serves drinks 3pm-10.30pm, at a reasonable price, well worth staying for the view!!! The mini bar prices are the same as the local shops, some hotels are cheaper of course, however if you want to drag a suitcase through the alleyways and over the small bridges thats your choice!! I enjoyed stepping off the boat directly on to the Foscari Palace welcome mat!! The lounge area and small downstairs bar are superb as is the rest of the hotel, lovely cocktail party on a Saturday night!!! Go on stay here its Ace!!! Rod and family U.k. p.s lots of Americans stay here and they like it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JANET33
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: 19 August 2006 Reviewer: Tripadvisor Member, Grantham, Lincs, UK We enjoyed a wonderful stay for four nights celebrating our 30th anniversary, We were in room 101 overlooking the canal, well worth the extra money! Divna and Madaleena were charming and informative. It was easy to book our stay conversing with Divna by Email and we also arranged to have a water taxi from the airport to the hotel. Bit pricey at 120 euros but what an experience! However coming home we found it quite easy to take our cases to Fondamente Nove, 5 minutes walk through the back streets, and hop on boat to airport for 6 euros each. We would certainly arrive this way next time now we know where the hotel is. We were surprised that tea and coffee was not complimentary in the room, never come across this before (tea bag costing 1.40 euros) - take your own! On the whole hotel was just perfect. Breakfast room was lovely with plenty of choice. Sitting on the roof enjoying a cocktail in the evening looking out over the rooftops of Venice was an unforgettable experience! Our room was sumptuously furnished and beds were very comfortable. We did not notice any noise from the work going on next door and this should certainly not put anyone off staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: nutthatch
Reviews.Content: My expectations were extremely high after reading the reviews on this site and I was especially impressed that the management took the time to respond to any negative reviews. I stayed at the Foscari with my wife and 10 yr old daughter for one night, taking a day out of our two-week seaside holiday at another of the groupâ€™s hotels on Lido di Jesolo. The hotel is fantastic and in a great location and we had wonderful views over the Grand Canal. So why the disappointment, firstly I have to agree with several other reviewers that the staff can be quite abrupt and this especially surprised me as the warmth of the staff at the Jesolo hotel could not have been better. Secondly there is building work being carried out on both sides of this hotel and from a superficial look this is not likely to end sometime soon despite management assurances, work also commences before 9 in the morning so beware. Thirdly although there is a nice touch of complementary fruit and warm bottled water in the room, having to pay extra for the coffee and biscuits sticks in your throat a bit. Breakfast was no more than satisfactory, especially when compared to the Jesolo although I appreciate that there are restricted facilities to prepare this. Hi to the couple from NJ we met queuing outside San Marco. Overall, do stay at this hotel it is great, but the management need to take some action to make it the stay all that it could be.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: fussyfussy
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights 25-28 aug hotel gives little extras stayed in room 101 with canal view which overlooks across to the famous fish market. Breakfast good - toast would be a plus! room has a japanese shower and jacuzzi , beds great slept very well, dvd in english on channel 17 flat screen tv -mini bar and not over priced which makes a change. fruit on arrival in the room - also leaving picnic box for your onward journey. Location great easy walking distance to most places - easy to find hotel from airport only 8 euros 3 euros for the bus to terminal then pick up a water boat ACTV (NO1or 82) for 5 euros get off at stop c'd'ora walk down the alley turn right and first right again. 3 minute walk - you can watch the gondalers preparing for the days works and if lucky like me they may serande you while watching from the verander. Would stay again. Good breakfast to start your day off.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Fred123XYZ
Reviews.Content: There is a saying that a hotel will make or break your stay and Foscari Palace is a fine example of that. Seeing the sights of Venice was special but finding a great hotel such as Foscari Palace to return too afterwards simply made our tripâ€¦magical. Venice is a pricey destination in just about every respect, but Foscari is an excellent value and well worth the price. The previous positive reviews say it all. Immaculate interior decor, receptive and knowledgeable staff, outstanding service across-the-board, and of courseâ€¦.the rooms. We have traveled to many European countries and this is the first time I have seen a bathroom of this size and caliber. The multiple shower nozzles/Jacuzzi/bath and piped in music if you so desire are all great touches. Trust meâ€¦.not your typical European bathroom. I could go on and on about the breakfast buffet but I think itâ€™s been covered enough in previous posts. In shortâ€¦.awesome! On the 3rd floor, you can go up the stairs to the rooftop where there are chairs and tables and enjoy one of the most breathtaking views of the Grand Canal. As they say in a familiar commercialâ€¦.priceless. Location is a big plus. We did not have the luxury to explore every nook and crevice of Venice on foot because our 5 year old son gets tired after just 30-60 minutes of walking so we utilized the heck out of the waterbuses. Foscari Palace is just a couple of minutes away from the Ca dâ€™Oro water bus stop (route #1) that brought us to every stop on our â€œmust seeâ€� list. I highly recommend the waterbus pass for the duration of your stay for unlimited hop on-hop off convenience. Foscari is also a quick walk to lots of shops and restaurants on Strada Nova. There is also a grocery store (Billa) that sells everything at a reasonable price (not like the 7 euro plus sodas down at the Square). We turned to Billa for our bottled water, soda, toiletries, fresh fruit and suchâ€¦.a life saver. If you start from the hotel, turn left at the street and keep going straight until you hit a little bridge, cross over it and Billa is on your right. The hotel has no restaurant for lunch or dinner but there are several restaurants, bars, gellato stands, pizza and kebab places to suit everyoneâ€™s taste. Yesâ€¦even a McDonalds is just around the corner from the hotel. You are also within walking distance of the Fondamenta Nove strip. The strip has a waterbus stop (route #41/42) to go island hopping towards Murano (famous for itâ€™s Venetian glass). I noticed that the Murano glass wares were more expensive on the island than on the streets of Venice. Do some comparison shopping before you flat out make a purchase on Murano. SOME TIPS: Buy a waterbus pass for the duration of your stay â€“ Itâ€™s a great way to see Venice via the Grand Canal. It was like 25 euro for a three day bus and waterbus pass. Pack light â€“ If you must take "everything" with youâ€¦then a Water Taxi is the way to go (approx 90 euro) from Airport to Hotel. Otherwise, a simple ACTV bus from the Airport to Piazzale Roma (main drop off point for waterbuses), then waterbus to hotel will suffice (all for less than 10 euro per person). Dining â€“ Be aware! Meal cost include much more than just your first and second course. Restaurants add an unavoidable â€œbread and coverâ€� charge plus a "service charge" to your meal. Some restaurants also charge by weight of the fish or meat (per gram). So, after ordering the wine, appetizer, dessert and a digestivo (after-dinner drink), your bill can quickly add up. Also, the quality of the food tends to get better the farther away from the beaten path. Final thoughts â€“ Foscari Palace is truly a wonderful place to stay. It is just a hop, skip and a jump (or boat ride) away from all the main sights/attractions, yet far enough from the crowd and touristy atmosphere. The professional staff (Divna, Madallena, Giuseppe, Menelio, Gerald all the way to the cleaning ladies) were very accommodating throughout our stay. This hotel goes above and beyond and I would highly recommend this place to anyone thinking of visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon Trip”
Reviews.Author: Brits_abroad_73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Foscari Palace 27th June - 4th July 2006 for our honeymoon. We found Foscari spotlessly clean, staff polite, helpful, fully air conditoned - a welcome relief from the summer heat. Our room faced a building which was being renovated, the builders were present during the day, but as we were out sightseeing during the day it was not a problem to us at all. Breakfast was fantastic, a help yourself buffet consisting of fruit, croissants, sliced meats, cheeses, cereals, and/or cooked breakfast. Two or three evenings during our stay cocktails and entertainment were laid on. The hotel was situated very conviently near to the Rialto bridge, with a 10 min walk via major shopping area to San Marco or in the opposite direction to the train/ bus station. With a water bus stop on the grand canal just round the corner, and a gondola able to take you across the Grand Canal literally on the doorstep of the hotel we felt the location was perfect. It was only rudness of three guests in pursuit of checking their emails on thier laptop during an hour of muscial entertainment one evening which annoyed us. Otherwise Foscari....we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmom28
Reviews.Content: This is truly a five star property. I was on holiday with two teenagers and a single mom this trip. The staff was helpful and accurate with all recommendations. We stayed in the Junior Suite Gonzaga. We truly were in a palace. There was fresh fruit and water in our room upon arrival with crisp clean robes and slippers. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. The staff provided excellent service every minute of the day. The rooftop terrace was magical. The water taxi was right outside the hotel and was convenient and easy to use. When booking through their website, I got immediate responses and information on all questions asked. I hope to return with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thecraigs
Reviews.Content: Finished off our tour of North Italy with a couple of nights at this hotel. Took a water taxi from Marco Polo airport (90 euros) pricey but what an entrance to Venice. Extra plus to this is that the driver knows exactly where to take you and you step of the boat directly into the entrance hallway of the hotel. Staff are very helpful. We had booked two rooms, one suite with terrace (no canal view) and one double room with balcony. They were both excellent. The suite had an extra living area and a very private terrace with furniture and parasol. The bathrooms in both rooms were fabulous. The hotel was placed beside a water bus stop and easy access to Rialto bridge and St Marks Square. A wonderful end to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Phantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bretscr
Reviews.Content: We planned our first trip to Venice, and I wanted it to become something special. After lengthy research online about the Venice hotel landscape, I booked a Superior Double room at the Foscari Palace for a reasonable price. We stayed two nights and enjoyed a very warm welcome - friendly and helpful staff, great room with personal welcome note, nice balcony with Canal view (sideways). The hotel is wonderfully renovated and has a phantastic rooftop terrace, which proved to be the perfect location when I proposed to my fiancÃ©. We were lucky to be the only hotel guests on the terrace at that time, and it was a wonderful experience. Enjoy the romantic stay at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great change in plans”
Reviews.Author: MRPOg
Reviews.Content: In April we made reservations for our three night stay in Venice. Fortunately we read some Trip Advisor reviews on hotels in Venice and changed our reservation to the Foscari Palace. We could not have asked for a better hotel. It was a very nice hotel away from the tourist area of St. Markâ€™s Square. The staff were very helpful and courteous. There was a great variety of food in the breakfast buffet. Certainly something for everyone. On one of our evenings there was a charming reception with music off the lobby area. If you have several people and/or many bags, I would suggest you take a water taxi from the train station. Not many people knew where the hotel was and we had a difficult time finding it. We also had six people, several bags, and a stroller which was a challenge with the various bridges we had to navigate to get to the hotel. Had we researched the boats better I am sure we would have had an easier time finding it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wandrin
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to the Foscari July 1-4. We stayed in the Foscari suite. I wish I had a camera to get a picture of his face when he saw the size of our rooms (I emphasize the plural). We basically had the first floor of the hotel and could have had a party for 40 people in our rooms. The hotel is in a great location - near everything, but away from the masses. The staff were very helpful and gave us great dinner recommendations. The rooftop bar was splendid, with great views of the city. All in all, a fabulous experience and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Foscari”
Reviews.Author: Dive, Ski, Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Foscariâ€™s Junior Suite Gonzaga, a fabulous, huge room with three (!) windows and balconies directly overlooking Grand Canal. Marble bathroom, beautiful furnishings, very clean. Foscari is not cheap, but is well worth the price. An excellent value for pricey Venice. Staff very polite, helpful with restaurant reservations and other arrangements. Few minutes walk to Rialto Bridge, ten minutes walk to Plaza San Marco. â€œVaporettoâ€� (water bus) stops just few yards from main door. There is some room for improvement in the breakfast buffet department (at least by American standards). Overall - a very good hotel. Weâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ahoskrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Foscari Palace July 1-4 in a Double supieror room and after reading all the reviews of this hotel I can only warn you that it appears that the room you stay in may make or break your experience. The first impression of the hotel and the lobby are positive. It was freezing cold and beautifully decorated and I was impressed. However, our room, although rather large, was a big disappointment. First of all it was dreadfully hot and stuffy when we entered , and there were several flys flying around an overly ripe fruit basket that was meant to welcome us. Trying to have a positve attitude, we chased and swatted the flys, turned on the air and hoped for the best. On to the bathroom, it was so dark even with all the lights turned on, the makeup mirror was cracked and the light didnt work and there was an "odor" about it that we smelled every time we entered our room. The bathtub was so small that I (5'6" and 130lbs) could not move or turn around in it, and the shower contraptions were difficult to figure out and had very little water pressure to them. When we went downstairs several hours after checking in and inquired if the air in our room should be as cold as the lobby, the somewhat aloof ( and they were aloof the entire stay..I can see why others have complained)staff said they would check into it. We left to find dinner, and when we had returned to our room,hoping to find it had cooled off, we found that they had turned OFF the air. It was now about a stiffling 85 degrees in our room. The next morning, as it had still not cooled off, we inquired again, and this time asked that no one please turn off our air again. They said they would check into it, but nothing was ever done. We stayed in 4 different Italian hotels, all reviewed on this site, and this was the only one we felt did not measure up at all as to what others were saying. The only thing I can figure out is that it must depend on which room you stay in. Also, we had construction to look at and hear outside our window, I am talking large cranes and clanking machienery. We had no canal view, and we had a double superior room, so don't think you automatically get a view by having a superior room. The odd thing about this hotel is that they appear to be trying to be a level 4 star hotel (turn down service with little towels place on the floor next to your bed) but they are seriously lacking in the comforts and service that really distinguish a good hotel from an average one. The other two 3 star hotels we stayed at during this trip, were far superior in service and in accomadations. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved Foscari Palace! The entire property is very well kept, with clean and spacious rooms. The staff was more than gracious, and even surprised us with flowers when they found out it was my birthday! They had some special evenings with cocktail socials, and a lovely breakfast every morning that kept us full most of the day. The building is right on the grand canal, and our room had a view if you poked your head entirely out the window....Next door is undergoing renovations, but did not interfere with our sleep nor our stay. The location is great, and gave us the opportunity to venture to the local Venetian spots. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect by every measure”
Reviews.Author: Jacqal
Reviews.Content: My partner had a special birthday and deserved a special treat. After a lot of research and much help from the postings on this site (I owe a great deal to those who take the time to write !), I booked a Grand Canal view room directly with the Foscari Palace. For the first time in many years of purchasing over the internet, there was a problem (I got two bookings!). Very efficient (and English speaking) rapid responses to my emails and it was all sorted very rapidly. IMPRESSIVE! I made the booking several months in advance and checked everything was OK two weeks before by mail explaining the importance of the stay and the details of our likely arrival time. On arrival we were greeted by name (just how impressive is that?) and had a bottle of sparkling wine on ice awaiting us in our room with a Happy Birthday message. As stated by other reviewers the hotel was excellent, the room superb and, in our case, the Grand Canal view just made it the perfect stay. Everything was spotless with nice touches of fresh fruit in the room and a leaving box of juice and cookies. The breakfast buffet (served in a smallish dining room) had a variety of fresh fruit, meats, cheeses, breads, teas, coffee, yougourts,.....and a few hot dishes. The rooftop balcony was lovely for a nightcap before bed. And the service was just perfect - polite and friendly with special mention to the femaile receptionist (sorry we ddn't get her name) who was particularly helpful and the barman who on our second visit to the rooftop terrace remembered our drink choice from the first and our room number. This IS a boutique hotel and meets every criterion I can think of as measures of what it purports to be. It IS NOT a large luxury hotel with large communal areas and its own restaurant. The hotel also has a narrow frontage onto the Grand Canal with other rooms either looking out onto a narrow alley or a small Campo so unless you book one of the few special rooms, don't expect great views of Venice but the that's probably true of most of the hotels in Venice. I say this becuase Venice is expensive and so is the Foscari so it is important to understand what you get and then you won't be disappointed. For us, we cannot thank the staff enough for their thoughtfulness and service - it has been one of the most enjoyable few days we have spent anywhere. Getting there. Because it was such a special time, we splashed out on a Water taxi from the airport direct the hotel front door - just magical. However, the airport water bus line stops at Fondamenta Nuove (6 euros each way). It takes about 40 minutes as you don't need to go to St Marks Square via the Lido. From Fondamenta Nuove it is a 10 minute walk and if you choose the right route, there are only two brdiges to cross. In reality nowehere in Venice is far from anywhere else. It may take 40 minutes on the vapaetto from the hotel to San Marco but we walked it in under 20 minutes. It is about 10 minutes walk to the Rialto but take the traghetto outside the hotel across the Grand Canal and the walk is less than 5 minutes. So in summary, a lovely hotel with beautiful rooms in a good location with perfect service.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: John and Tony
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed by the negative reviews from the Ohio couple who stayed during the same period as we did. We found the hotel superb - clean, cool (important in temperatures of 32 degrees celsius!), comfortable and very conveniently situated. The staff were attentive, friendly and knowledgeable arranging meals in local restaurants and booking water taxis. A word of advice for visitors from North America - it is considered rude in Europe to steal food from the breakfast buffet for later consumption! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: woodyck
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at the Foscari Palace for 2 nights at the end of June. It is a delightful and beautiful hotel. We were upgraded to the Foscari suite. If you are traveling with a large family that is the room for you. It is HUGE and a has a great canal view. The location is perfect. It is close to the vaporetto stop and just far enough away from Piazza San Marco to get away from tourists but yet still comfortably walk there. The staff is courteous and helpful. Make sure you have an evening cocktail on the rooftop terrace. It has quite an enjoyable view. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: faprodz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and two teens. We booked two rooms for two nights. The hotel is beautiful, new and very clean. The beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was abundant and good. The staff was very friendly for the most part. It is a comfortable walking distance to the major sites with the advantage of being in more of a residential area. It was fun to see the locals walking their dogs and babies instead of seeing tourists all the time. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best we have ever stayed in. I cannot rate it highly enough. We stayed for almost a week. The quality of the building and the friendliness of the staff and its beautiful location made my wife's 50th birthday something I hope she and I will never forget. Our room was immaculate, with an ideal outlook onto the Grand Canal. The staff were friendly and helpful in every way. The cocktail party and free concert on the Thursday evening of our stay was a lovely touch. "Divna" one of the receptionists was a gem, frequently offering help and advice with politeness and humour. I requested a room with a canal view via email and the room we received was perfect from every aspect. We will be returning! Please do not change a thing.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: YDFreeborn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Fosacri Palace for a long weekend in June having never been to Venice. The hotel was one of the best we have ever stayed in. All the staff were so helpful and courteous and couldn't do enough to make our stay memorable. The room was superbly furnished with an en-suite jacuzzi and there was a large basket of fresh fruit on our arrival. Breakfast was a feast of fresh fruits, eggs, ham, pastries, cheeses fruit juices which meant you only needed something small midday which you could eat on the hoof! On departure, a box packed with drinks, biscuits and crackers was left for us. It's these little touches that you remember. A highly recommended hotel; if we return to Venice(which was spectacular) we will certainly stay at the Foscari again. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “"Fabulous Foscari"”
Reviews.Author: WendySurrey_England
Reviews.Content: We just returned home last night from Foscari Palace after having a fantastic stay. Before we booked I'd gone through so many brochures to try and find the right hotel, ended up even more confused. Eventually I came across Trip Advisor, can I just say what a fantastic site this is! After reading many good reviews we decided to book Foscari Palace. We made our reservation via e-mail. We booked a double deluxe room with a view of the Grand Canal (201), the room was lovely very spacious and clean. The canal view made it, a definite must. It was so nice to open up the doors in morning and look over the balcony on to the canal and see all the hustle and bustle of the Rialto market going on over the other side. You can catch the traghetto outside the hotel to take you across the canal to the market (50 cents each way). We had been recommended to get a water taxi to the hotel from the airport , which we did. We e-mailed the hotel and Divna very kindly arranged it for us. It was fairly expensive (120 euros) but well worth it to be taken from the airport directly to the hotel door, also a great way to arrive in Venice with no stress of the water buses.(also took a water taxi back when we left, Divna arranged a taxi of which we shared with another couple which halved the cost) The location was great, just enough away from the crowds but not cut off. (10-15 mins walk to St Marks) We walked miles (take a range of flat comfortable shoes) was great to see the tiny walkways and bridges. RECOMENDED SIGHTS: St Marks Basilica(obviously!) Campanile - (tower) Take a trip up the tower for fantastic views (hired Dictaphone 4 euros for 2 people) Doge's Palace - (booked secret itinery tour before we went at --- prevents queuing, 16 euros pp includes palace entrance) The guided tour took you away from the crowds and behind a locked door, showing you Casanovas cell where he tried to escape, the torture room and various other things no one else sees. Then after the tour you can go around the palace on your own. Jewish Ghetto - worth a visit Campo Rocco (in Santa Croce) - Nice Square and lovely church Gondola ride - Business seems to slacken about 3ish so good prices to be had. Paid 80 euros for about 40 mins. Lido - if you have enough time and in need of some R and R ( rest and relaxation!) We took the water bus (vaporetto) from outside the hotel to the Lido (5 euro pp each way) when you get of the bus just go straight down Gran Viale Elisabetta (main street) turn left at the bottom to the public beach (spiaggia pubblica) You can hire 2 beds and an umbrella for about 22 euros for the whole day (is cheaper after 2.30pm) RECOMENDED RESTAURANT Algiubagio in Cannaregio next to the Fondamente Nove water bus stop. (---) This restaurant had a huge inventive meat menu ( fillet steak to die for, Ostrich, duck etc) a welcome relieve from fish. This was the best restaurant we had been to in Venice and went back the following night for a fantastic pizza also! Recommend booking (Divna at hotel reception sorted this out for us) We Stayed at Foscari Palace for 4 nights and had 5 full days, this was a nice length time. We came to Venice to celebrate our 10th Wedding anniversary and loved it, we have some wonderful memories that we'll always cherish. Thank you trip advisor and Divna at Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AgadorSpartacus
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I just returned from three weeks in Italy, and the Foscari Palace was the perfect ending to a wonderful trip. It is a beautiful hotel, and the location and service could not be better. We booked the Foscari Suite as a grand finale to our trip, and it was huge, with an amazing view of the canal. The marble bath was great - and spotlessly clean. My husband couldn't stop commenting on the very nice bed linens! We were travelling with our 6-year-old daughter, and the staff of the hotel could not have been more friendly or welcoming to us - especially to her! She felt like a princess! The desk staff gave us a fantastic restaurant recommendation - Algiubagio, within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel's location one block from a vaporetto stop, and directly at a traghetto stop was perfect. It was a nice walk to Piazza San Marco, not too long (15-20 minutes with a 6-year old), and not too close to the tourist madness. We loved the Foscari Palace, and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice, loved the Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our first trip to Venice. What an amazing city and what a gem the foscari Palace is. Venice is VERY expensive in european terms but this small hotel represents such good value for money. If you like small and classy with six star service this hotel is for you. The staff were very helpful and friendly, our room was lovely, well furnished with everything needed including complimentary fruit and water. Breakfast is comprehensive offering everything from fresh fruit and rolls to full cooked We will be going back to Venice and staying at the Foscari Palace. Just a note for first timers to Venice - quality of restaurants is very mixed and not governed by price. Do a bit of research if you want to eat well for a sensible price. PS I have read the recent poor review - yes the building opposite is covered in and undergoing work but is across the square and definitely not within touching distance or even very close. Our room faced this but the shutters and glazing were very efffective and no noise could be heard in the room. If you want a canal view then pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mem2699
Reviews.Content: Foscari Palace was a wonderful place to stay in Venice. The service is excellent- front desk, housekeeping, and breakfast staff were all more than accomodating. The rooms are large and clean. The roof-top deck is a fantastic place to read or just sit and relax. We stayed in many hotels on our trip to Italy, and this one was the best.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: robgo84
Reviews.Content: i planned a special trip for my 80-year old parents and my 21-year old daughter to go to venice for the 1st time and then on to a cruise. my parents are well-travelled and very picky, so i was nervous about being the one to make these plans. but, i read the reviews on TA and after i exchanged many, many emails with the hotel about rooms and arrangements, i felt better. both elena and divna were so gracious, helpful, an accomodating. they even arranged for a private water taxi to pick up my parents at the airport. well, the foscari palace certainly went all out for them ! the room--the grande suite foscari-- was fantastic! HUGE. it basically was the whole 1st floor. the suite consisted of a bedroom and a separate living room, where they put a nice rollaway bed for my daughter. both rooms has a view up the grand canal and about 14 windows. when you look at pictures of this hotel, the suite is right where the hotel has flags hanging. the hotel nicely made reservations for them to go to a vivaldi concert in his church and booked some restaurants also. and it was nice that the hotel was away from the craziness of st mark's square. there are many little restaurnats near by. both my parents and my daughter were delighted with the hotel, the level of service and care, and their room. efinitely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venetian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Foscari Palace for one night during my 10 day trip to Italy in May. This hotel experience was one of the best I have ever had- I wish that I could have stayed for longer than one night. The location was excellent- right on the canal- and my room had a large balcony with a view of the canal. The Foscari Palace is located right near the D'Oro watertaxi stop- and was very convenient to shopping and restaurants. The hotel also has a rooftop patio where drinks were served- also with a breathtaking view. The room itself was small but had all the ammenities that one needed including a flat panel T.V., massaging jets in the tub and shower, robes, and a very comfortable bed. The service was unbeatable- the staff was very attentive and helpful yet not intrusive. The hotel also kept my luggage for the day while I was sighseeing. I am looking forward to going back to Venice- and especially to stay at the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Let Down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I booked this hotel from both the reviews on this site and from family recommendations. This was the second hotel of our honeymoon - the first being the Moat House at Gatwick airport. We arrived at this hotel on May 15 very excited to be in Venice. We were expecting rather alot from the hotel and perhaps this was part of the problem. The hotel lobby was beautiful and we were immediatly helped with our bags. We were checked in an shown to our room on the second floor. The room was of a good standard but quite small. The disappointing part was the view - or lack of it. We had not paid for a canal view but what we got was really disappointing. We could not even open the shutters on one window due to the positioning of the furniture making the room really dark and hot. The other window would open - however we had to keep it closed most of the time due to the building work next door. This started at around 7.30am and WAS loud enough to wake us up. The 'view' was the protective covering over the building next door whilst building work took place - this was so close you could reach out and toucg it. The most disappointing part of the stay was the unaffected attitude of the staff (with the exception of the lady who ran the breakfast area - v.friendly and efficient!). We explained at reception that we had specifically requested a quite room when booking as it was our honeymoon and could we be moved. We were told that the type of room we had paid for was full and that there was nothing in the same price range to offer us. We weren't even asked if we wanted to pay to upgrade. This 'unaffected' attitude greeted us from most members of staff - we were rather glad we had alot planned as it made the time in the hotel minimal. On the upside it is a clean hotel in a great location with some nice bars and resteraunts near by and they do make a great cocktail - providing you getto the bar before around 10.00pm when the bar man goes home!.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, stunning location”
Reviews.Author: megasmile
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Foscari Palace was lovely. The hotel is very, very well located. Rooms were large, comfortable, nicely decorated and very clean. The breakfast buffet was very good. We walked our feet off in Venice and returning to our hotel was great. The staff off-hours is a bit inexperienced and we had some sketchy moments when we were checking out and they couldn't print a receipt, but really only a minor glitch.

Reviews.Title: “STOP ! Look no further-- this is THE Hotel you want”
Reviews.Author: Reet15
Reviews.Content: STOP searching now ! I cant fault this Hotel and I cant really add much that hasnt already been mentioned in the other reviews [ Foscari Palace deserves rich praise ] We booked through the Hotel's own website so that we could have a Grand Canal view [ room 101 ] This has to be the main reason to go to this hotel. You will know what I mean when you get there and constantly have your widow open and are staring out AWESOME. I dithered for weeks and trawled through every review before booking because I though we needed to be nearer to San Marco but believe me you do NOT wanna stay there-- it is mayhem-- not to mention price differences for meals drinks etc.Of course you have to visit San Marco but if you stay there you will need tranquilisers. The location of Foscari Palace is ideal , handy for everything-- all major sights ,vaporetto ,traghetto , shops ,restaurants and bars . It is also very easy to reach. We arrived at Treviso Airport-- you buy your bus ticket [ and Vaporetto ticket ] there and the bus is waiting for you outside when your flight arrives.The coach takes you to Piazzale Roma.From here you take Vaporetto Line 1 to Ca' d'oro the 5th stop. walk through the alleyway-- right and right again--you are there. Here is a little tip-- if you are walking back to the Hotel from the madness of San Marco and it is sweltering and so are you , There is a cute little bar between the Hotel and Rialto Bridge called Bacaro Jazz. The beer is ICE cold and they have Happy Hour between 4pm & 7pm--ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Worry free stay”
Reviews.Author: HungryTraveler13
Reviews.Content: First I need to start by saying our room was magnificent! The service was impeccable and their arraignments were flawless. We only spent one night in this hotel and I regrete that. We should have stayed two to three more. Our room was upgraded to a room fit for royalty. The people in Venice were wonderful. I recommend you have the hotel arrange a private water taxi take you to the hotel...at 75 euro it is a little expensive but they take you directly to the hotel and you donâ€™t have to wait in a line for the water bus. I could go on and on about the fresh flowers, the breakfast...etc but I won't. The staff is wonderful as is the hotel itself. You can not go wrong staying here. My family will be back and we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rgriffiths
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my first visit to Venice, it was more than I expected. After reading reviews for different hotels on trip advisor the Foscari Palace was my choice, I was not sorry. The hotel arranged a private water taxi to collect us at the airport and take us straight to the hotel; it was rather special way to arrive. We had booked a twin deluxe room and were rather disappointed to find it was on the side of the hotel which has work ongoing next door. After speaking to reception, they were more than happy to change our room. The next afternoon on our return to the hotel we were given a HUGE room with great views over the Grand Canal. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. Every night someone turned the beds down tidied the rooms and left the lights on for our return such a nice a touch. The choice for breakfast was more than you could want, full English, hams, cheeses, cereal, fruit and I am sure other things I have forgotten to mention. Again the staff here were more than helpful at all times. I would recommend a trip to the islands of Murano and Burano where the houses are painted the most wonderful colours. The cheapest way to do this a buy a waterbus pass, for three days it was 25 euro each and you can get on and off when you want.

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely”
Reviews.Author: Marguerite2006
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace was lovely in Venice. The hotel was beautiful with white steps, wrought iron gates and railings. Just beautiful. The room was very clean and the bed was lovely. It was close enough to a bus station that transportation was easy but far enough away you didnt hear the noise from it. There were working shutters on the windows and the room was blue and gold with a desk a chair an armoire and a flat screen TV. However the room was very small. And here I dont mean European small, the room did not allow two of us to pass the bed at the same time and there no places to open a suitcase except on the bed. This was disappointing especially since there was a large armoire in the room that I thought would hold the suitcases. But due to the way the drawers were set up in the armoire you couldnt use it to hold the suitcases. We ended up hauling the suitcases to the top of the armoire to store them which others had done before as there was carpet on the top. But when you had to get into a suitcase you had to haul it down and put it on the bed. The last night there it rained and since we were on the top of the third floor the rain was very loud above us. It may as well have been a tin roof. I think this could have been avoided if you stay away from a couple of rooms on the third floor. All in all the hotel was pleasant. The entire hotel was furnished lovely. The brunch in the morning was awesome. They had a lovely cocktail hour. And Luigi at the front desk was everything you wanted. Helpful and attentive. Thank you Luigi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingdawg
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights in this beautiful hotel. I went based on Tripadvisor recommendations, and once again I wasn't disapointed. We stayed in a deluxe double room (101) with a view of the grand canal. The hotel is less than 2 years old, built in the palace of an 18th centuy Doge. The room was great as were the public areas. The location is perfect, on the Grand Canal, about a 15 minute walk from San Marco and the Rialto bridge, avoiding some of the tourist hoards. Great restaurants within a 5 or 10 minute walk. My only complaint is that I have had better breakfasts in european hotels. The meat and cheese selection was a little limited and the only bread they had was "white". This may seem picky, but I love the typical european breakfast with hearty breads and meats. If you're into fruit or cereal, there's no problem. I wouldn't let the breakfast keep me away from the hotel. I'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Another Trip Advisor gem!”
Reviews.Author: SusieG
Reviews.Content: I found a wonderful hotel in Rome last year through Trip Advisor reviews (the Ponte Sisto) - and you did it again this week for Venice! We have just celebrated a very special wedding anniversary there, and finding this hotel made it extra-special. As other reviewers have said, the location is superb - on the Grand Canal, far enough away from the noise of the tourists round San Marco, but within easy walking distance of all the sights. Two minutes from the Ca d'oro vaporetto stop, and opposite the Traghetto, which takes you on a slightly precarious, but quick standing-room only ferry across the canal to the Rialto markets. Perfect! Our 'superior' room was huge, obviously only recently restored ,with an elegant, light and airy decor, plasma satellite TV and a great marble bathroom. The bath and shower with all their extra fittings (jacuzzi, massage etc) took some working out, but were worth it!! We too appreciated the fresh fruit on arrival, and the farewell goodies for the journey home. We found all the staff unfailingly helpful; they booked us into some fantastic restaurants, which tourists wouldnt normally find, including a fish restaurant nearby that took some finding even with directions! We were the only non-locals there, and the owner, who also had a fish stall on the Rialto market, served up the most amazing selection of the freshest fish you could imagine. The cocktail party at the hotel on the Saturday evening was a bonus - great fun - and also an opportunity to meet up with another couple on the same flight home - we were able to share the cost of a water taxi back to the airport with them - from the hotel landing stage to the airport cost a total of 90 Euros for the four of us, but was worth it with an early flight to catch. One of the best attractions of this small hotel has to be the roof terrace where we sat in the sun and drank cocktails overlooking the Grand Canal - not many hotels can offer that! The only downside is the renovation work currently going on on both sides of the hotel. It didnt affect us at all as we were there for the weekend and a Bank Holiday, but could possibly annoy you if you were there when work was going on. Personally, it wouldnt stop us going back there again - this hotel is an absolute gem - small, luxurious, but not at all pretentious. Do go, but please make sure you don't take up all the rooms - we will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for a romantic trip”
Reviews.Author: razamataz
