Reviews.Content: I took my wife on a suprise visit to Venice, the culmination of 6 months planning - much of it spent in the Venice forum and Venice hotel guides section of tripadviser[-]! I had selected the Foscari Palace on the basis of the reviews. I wanted a place with a water view, close enough to the sites, but not slap bang in the centre of a tourist hotspot. What a great choice I made. I booked the Foscari Suite and could not have made a better choice for my wife. The suite is made up of a living room *and* room 108 with it's bathroom. The 'living room' is 35 X 20 ft ish with 14 windows (yes I am not joking) and a superb view of the Grand Canal, sitting almost right next door to Ca D'Oro, and opposite one of the markets of San Polo (though the hotel is in Cannaregio). The hustle and bustle of everything is in front of your eyes and it is truly great. The room had masses of sitting places and a table for 8 (I think it gets used as a general purpose hotel room for all guests when not booked as part of the suite). 50 inch plasma TV with English channels (but BBC World needed to be retuned) though we rarely used it, prefering to be out in the city or staring out the window. The bedroom was even bigger at say 35 X 35 ft, fitted with twin beds (would have been nice to have a double but they were very large single beds, easily long enough for my 6ft 4 inch frame). French doors to the two balconies which looked sidewards on to the Grand Canal and overlooked the small campo (or square) to the front of the side entrance of the hotel. All you would expect of such a hotel, plus another plasma screen, and selectable radio through the in-room (and in bathroom) system. Bathroom had a good shower/jacuzzi bath (note - don't use bubble bath and jacuzzi at the same time!). Towel robes you expect, but courtesy slippers is what makes the difference. Marble floors throughout, original wood roof, etc etc etc. The rest of the hotel was impeccable, great handrails, doors, seats. Subtle decor. I found all the staff to be polite and friendly. Lets not forget I had a running email thread going on checking and rechecking things for 3-4 months and they were superb always. They sorted my watertaxi from the airport and the restuarant for my wife's 40th birthday - and what a super recommendation that was as well. As others have said, the properties on either side are under construction but we never heard anything (probably because it was a weekend and a public holiday). We never got to check out the roof terrace but it looked good from what we saw. Breakfasts were enormous. Cheese, meats, bread, toast, fruit juice, eggs, beans, mushrooms, bacon, hot dogs, cereals, fruit, croissants - they had everything and masses of it. Attentative and polite as with the desk staff and bellhop. Okay it cost a lot, but it was easily worth every penny for the impact it made. A welcome basket of fruit and water, flowers, and the 'ciao' box on the last night. Drinks and nibbles on the Saturday evening. Did I mention the Gondala rank outside, or the tragetto 4 steps from the front door - so you can get to the other side of the canal without any hassle. A vaporetto stop (the water bus) within 100 steps. Supermarket close by, reasonable local restuarants. Touring the Grand Canal, we didn't see any other hotel that seemed to have the same combo of location and views - it was 15 minutes fast walk from St Marks Square, but there were so many ways to get there each with a different set of shops/sites that there was little need to run. Cannaregio was interesting, and the hotel was opposite San Polo, and next to Castello so you had the best of all the areas to sample. For the record - the fastest way back to the airport seemed to be the coach from Pizalle de Roma, stand D2, which was 25 minutes from the hotel by water boat, pay on the bus (3E). Useful when you are squeezing every last minute out of your visit!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: hankypanky505
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! It sits right on the Grand Canal and is close to everything! There is a little water taxi station right next to the hotel and all kinds of great shopping and restaurants. When we first arrived, our room had a wonderful basket full of fresh fruits and little snacks. I think the staff at this hotel is excellent and very friendly. They also have great tips for places to eat that are not too expensive, so be sure to ask when you get there. Our room was HUGE! We had a room overlooking the canal and the rooms are all beautiful. It is a small hotel, but very upscale, yet not stuffy. I was reading one reviewer's take on the breakfast saying that there should be more meats and juice. Well, I don't know where they were looking, but there were four huge pitchers of fresh water, orange juice, milk, and also a huge assortment of meats and fresh eggs and bacon and fresh pastries. If you cannot find something that satisfies your tastebuds at this breakfast buffet, you have some definite issues! It is more than plenty of food for anyone and it's right there in your hotel. Also, the reason they don't want you to leave with food from the breakfast room is because it is rude! Also, having been to a few buffets in my day in the States, people in America are large for a reason! We love to grab food and rush, rush, rush! I'm American, so don't start with the attitude, we just don't know how to relax and enjoy some things the way other cultures do. You are there in their country and you should abide by their rules. Relax and be courteous. And most of all, have fun. Bottom line, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. Beautiful rooms, wonderful staff all the way around, and great location. One thing of note, however, there were two places next door doing construction. The rooms at this hotel are very well sound proofed. I'm a very light sleeper so I wake up when I hear a mosquito flying around. But I did NOT hear a thing and slept like a baby every night. I did not hear any workers or jackhammers or anything going on, so I wouldn't let that scare you. But you should definitely know about it, because for some people it might be a nuisance or frighten them away. Anyway, it's a VERY beautiful hotel and also very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace last week to celebrate our wedding anniversary and were delighted with our choice of hotel and that we had booked a canal facing room - there is something magical about the sights and sounds from the balcony. We found the staff to be extremely courteous and efficient, the hotel is clean, fresh and very comfortable. I am not sure why there are a few gripes about breakfast - as the hotel doesn't have a restaurant why expect an a la carte selection? What was on offer was fresh, tasty and well presented with pleasant young staff that may not be hugely experienced but try very hard to please. If you are thinking of visiting Venice, we would highly recommend this hotel, and definitely arriving by private water taxi from the airport - with the vaperetto/traghetto stops so close, sightseeing is easy. Beautiful city, great hotel, ideal romantic trip

Reviews.Title: “a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace is a charming hotel at a superb location for a couple on honeymoon, like we were. The friendly receptionist, Divna, had a surprise for us: we got our room upgraded to a room with a direct view on the Grand Canal. This view exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed to open our (two) windows to watch the early morning traffic! The room and bathroom were spacious and clean and the bath even had a whirlpool! The hotel has no restaurant for lunch or dinner, but around the corner are several bars, restaurants and a supermarket. For the addicted ones: Mc Donalds is whithin half a minute walking distance. The roof terrace of Foscari is a wonderful place to enjoy lunch with tramezzini you can buy in the bars everywhere. The view from there is splendid. Although the breakfast waiters do their best, we found the breakfast a little disappointing. Instead of heavy chocolat and other pies, money could be better spent on a larger choice of famous Italian meat and cheese (no Vache qui rit please!) and fresh orange juice. And do NOT try to take anything from the buffet: you are treated like a shoplifter! The day we left, we got a Ciao packet with cookies, delicious juices and mineral water. That was a nice surprise. Our overall conclusion: The Foscari Palace is a little gem in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari April 8-12 and couldn't have been more pleased--our only disappointmenst were not reserving early enough to get two rooms facing the Grand Canal and the fact that one room was warmer than we would have liked. Our deluxe double room on the Canal was almost palatial and our superior deluxe, facing the S. Sofia plaza was very roomy. Bathrooms in both rooms were spacious and very well supplied. When we checked in we found complimentary bowls of fresh fruit ahd chocolates and bottled water in each room, and the night before our departure we were delighted to find travel packs filled with snacks, water and juices--this was a delightful touch, in addition to the nightly turn-down service and the complimentary cocktail party in the lobby on the Saturday evening when we checked in. The downstairs bar was a great place for an afternoon apertif and we enjoyed the the included bounteous breakfast buffet. The staff was unfailingly gracious and helpful in every way. There are plenty of modest cafes within a few minutes of the door, in addition to several top-quality restaurants with exceptional wine cellars, where we had unforgettable meals. The staff arranged for the water taxis to meet us at the airport and to pick us up at the front door for our return trip. The traghetto to cross the canal is right outside the hotel and the vaporetto stop is just a few minutes away. We managed all of the reservations and taxi arrangements via email in English and found everything matched our expectations in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Italy hotel”
Reviews.Author: judythetourguide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace over spring break and it was so wonderful. The room is beautifully decorated, fresh fruit upon arrival in room, many ammenities, and the largest bathroom we saw throughout Italy. The shower is incredible. The breakfast was nice. Could improve on the hot items (eggs runny, and bacon/sausage a little fatty, etc.) But that's being really picky. The rest is nice. We completely overslept (beware of closing your shutters!) It makes the room so dark and so quiet. So I went down while they were putting all the breakfast food away and they still allowed me to take what I needed and even had the bell cap help me. I thought they were very helpful. The front desk isn't overly friendly...but they are very professional and if you need help or recommendations...they are very good. We loved the Foscari Palace and felt the location was great. Only about 5 vaperotto stops from the train station and so close to where you get off. I would most definetly stay there again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: siobhan42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Foscari Palace with my husband for three nights at the end of March. We booked a superior room which was a good size with a large sofa. The bathroom was large with a jacussi style bath and shower. There was an extensive choice of hot and cold food at breakfast, and the bacon was well enough done for our northern european tastes! All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We found the hotel to be ideally situiated for sightseeing either on foot or by Vaparetto. I think it is the small touches that made our stay special, for example a drinks reception on the Saturday night of our stay and also the "Ciao" box, we were left on our last night, containing juice, water and biscuits for our journey home, . A lovely hotel in a good location that I would not hesitate to reccomend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed with the Froscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: Pennylane-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on the 10th and 11th March 06. We were very impressed with the hotel and especially the staff. They helped us with everything from waterbus time tables to restaurants and what was on at the opera during our stay. The hotel is approx 10-15 mins walk to St Marks Square or a couple of stops away on the number 1 waterbus. Our flight home was cancelled due to heavy snow back home, and the only available flight was to Stanstead the following day. We went back to the Foscari and the staff really looked after us. We had booked a superior room for our stay but as it was just an additional night we asked just for a standard. The hotel insisted on giving us a superior room but for the same price as a standard. I would deffo stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone who wants to be away from the crowds of San Marco but with easy walking distance to it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, professionally staffed & run”
Reviews.Author: Essexman_Abroad
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Venice as a 50th birthday treat & my decision to book the Foscari was based on the previous reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not dissappointed, the hotel is truly four star class in a fabulous location. Standards of cleanliness were extremely high & the professionalism & helpfulness of the staff is to be commended. We had a standard room & I was slightly concerned beforehand that the room might be a little cramped. I needn't have worried, our room was more than amply sized with a great bathroom & although building work was taking place next door this didn't detract from the quality of our stay. Would we return? You bet! Any future trip to Venice & The Foscari Palace will be top of our list!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Foscari Palace”
Reviews.Author: LDWLancashire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Foscari Palace in February this year. The hotel is excellent. Lovely bedroom - quite big with beautiful bathroom. The breakfast is first-class with everything you could wish for. The mini-bar and drinks in the bar are very reasonably priced. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with some issues to consider”
Reviews.Author: brian6u
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an eight day holiday in Italy, with five nights of the journey split across two hotels in Venice. One of these was the Foscari Palace. The hotel is in a very enjoyable location: close to the Vaporetto, a quick gondola ride across from the city marketplace, and in a nice neighborhood. It sits on the bank of the Grand Canal and is kept meticulously clean. HOWEVER, and there IS in this case a "however", this property has many quirks to consider. The phone system is a nightmare, and if easy contact with your home or office ouside the country is a concern, this may not be the place for you. We ultimately had to leave the hotel and call from a public phone because the hotel staff was unable to help us reach the USA. Our room, number 103, had windows to nowhere, so if you don't mind sleeping in a black hole, this is for you. The beds are very hard and typically Ventian, but the rooms and bathrooms are quite nice although very small. The hotel breakfast was the best we encountered in Italy, the lobby area is truly beautiful, and you could not have found a more impeccably clean property. The front desk staff are abrupt, almost unfriendly, and they make you feel somewhat unwelcome from the moment you arrive. So, the Foscari Palace is a neutral for us. If you want a great price and nice location, this property may be worth considering. If this is a "special" trip for you and a significant other, I'd stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace Hotel is truely a magical place to stay ,have just come back from 3 night stay .The hotel lives up to the reputation is exceeding clean and the rooms are definately four star .We stayed in room 304 over looking the courtyard and the Grand Canel , great room if you can get it.There is building work going on the building next door but dont let that put you off.The staff are friendly and diligent in providing excellent service to all the guests.The morning breakfast provided is very good and are never rushed to leave. Definately would return.

Reviews.Title: “This can`t be the same hotel as the person from Philadelphia stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends at The Foscari Palace for 4 nights from the 18th of March 2006 and found the hotel to be every thing other Trip Advisors had said. Spotless,super breakfast,ideal position for sight seeing,large bedroom withn all mod cons that worked and above all THE MOST HELPFUL and cheerful staff. The staff were not fawning over you as often happens in the U.S.A. but were friendly, polite, discreet and very attentive. What more can you ask for. It is an excellent hotel,believe me and we travel alot. Thank you Foscari ,we shall be back as soon as possible. Trip Advisor Member from Worcestershire

Reviews.Title: “First class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Venice for my 40th Birthday In December 2005, and on the recommendation of Trip Advisor reviews we stayed at the Foscari Palace. I can say there was not one disappointing aspect of our stay. The E-mail correspondence with the hotel staff before our stay was extremely helpful with regard to travel and accomodation available. We upgraded to a superior room, which was still a reasonable price for the high standard of accomodation, and had a view overlooking the Grand Canal which was simply magical at all times of the day or night. The room was spectacular with high wooden ceilings and chandeliers and the marble bathroom was spacious and luxurious. The breakfast room was delightful and the food was varied and plentiful. The hotel was extremely clean and well maintained. The location was excellent for either the waterbus or simply strolling through the streets and the fabulous shops.We will definitely return to Venice and the Foscari Palace

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coolmover
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay at the Foscari Palace. The hotel was perfect in every way. We stayed in the Foscari Suite which was about the size of most houses in Lancashire! The staff were great and friendly and the breakfast was glorious. We arrived by water taxi - surely there is no better way to arrive from the airport! - and it just got better every day. The location is great. Far enough away from the centre to have it's own charm and yet within easy walking distance of everything. We just walked out of the door, crossed over the Canal to the fish market and just spent our time getting lost. Other days we went and explored the Ghetto area. We also found three wonderful restaurants, the best being the Alla Madonna just the other side of the Rialto bridge. The Antiche Carampane was another great find! All in all a great time was had by us both.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari Palace is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Seasider72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Foscari Palace during late February - during the masked festival. The hotel is situated right in the centre of the city, on the Grand Canal with easy access to the waterbus. The hotel is fairly modern inside, but has an air of sophistication. The harp in the lounge says it all! The staff are lovely and could not do enough for us. The room was fairly cramped, but extremely comfortable, with twin beds, a minibar and a flat screen TV (not that we used it!). The bathroom had a jacuzzi bath and power shower with music piped in throughout the bedroom and bathroom. The hotel also has a roof terrace for viewing the grand canal from above. My only gripe was that it was impossible to get the temperature of the bathroom down below 80 degrees, although it was great to come in from the cold to! The surrounding buildings are undergoing some construction work at present (Feb 06), but this does not detract from the fantastic location and views. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would consider staying here again if we return to Venice. If you're feeling nostalgic (and rich!), take a trip to Harry's bar, on the Grand Canal, expensive food and drink, but a fantastic 1940s feel to it. Two glasses of belini was 30 euros, but well worth the expense. Waterbuses arrive every 10 minutes or so and it's worth getting the 3-day pass if you're there for a few days - this costs 25 euros each and allows you to travel on any waterbus, all around the city and to Lido and Murano. The bars and restaurants at St Mark's Square are a little pricey, so I'd recommend finding an off-the-beaten track, authentic Italian restaurant, where you'll get cheaper, higher quality food and service than the main tourist areas. Most restaurants we ate in had service charge included, so watch for this if you feel like leaving a tip. Have a great time in Venice. It's a magical city and I cannot wait to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about Foscari Palace!”
Reviews.Author: CJBab
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with this hotel in Venice! Arrival was easy from the train station: just a few steps from the Ca D'Oro stop. From the moment we entered, we knew we'd be happy here. We remodel old homes back in the states and were struck by the beauty of the place. It was apparent that it had been recently renovated. All the common areas have beamed ceilings, lovely marble floors, and beautiful wrought iron on the stairs. When you check in, be sure and notice the gorgeous wall and ceiling light fixtures in the lobby...a beautiful eclectic mix of old crystal and very high tech chrome or stainless steel. Stunning! Up the elevator to our double superior room (304). I agree with the reviewer who said rooms are equivalent to a high-end U.S. hotel. Very nice furnishings, fine bedding, high ceiling, nice appointments like varnished wood windows and pretty draperies. English TV was available. Lovely French doors opened on to a good sized terrace, 5' x 12' with a patio table and chairs. The view from the window was unremarkable, but from the terrace there's a great side view of the Grand Canal. And now for the bath...wow! Beautiful marble throughout, double sinks, jacuzzi tub and multi-head shower. All new and beautifully designed. Fluffy robes, towel warmer. It was heaven. We also had a nice welcome basket of fruit, chocolate, and biscuits. Had no problem with the coffee maker...it was much like the one at home. We're early risers and really appreciated having coffee when we wanted it. The breakfast was great, too, even included scrambled eggs and bacon! And, yes, Luigi was there to make our stay even more perfect. The "soiree" was most appreciated...guests sipping champagne, listening to the music, all the while watching the snow falling on the Grand Canal. Does it get any better than that?! It was easy walking everywhere...Venice isn't that big. One suggestion for those going in nicer weather. There's a supermarket down the street where I bought olive oil, balsamico and salamis for gifts. While I was in there I noticed their "deli" counter. Oh my! Though I'd just had breakfast, my mouth was watering: crusty sandwiches of baby shrimps, curry chicken, etc. This would be a great place to fill a picnic basket! From the hotel, turn left at the street, pass the turn to the vaporetto stop, go over a little bridge and the store is on your right. I hope this review isn't over the top. I really feel I can't apply enough superlatives to this hotel. We were very happy there and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari Palace--A great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great find in Venice. An easy walk to all the main sites, this hotel is one of my favorites in Europe. In a city where a hotel room can easily approach 500 bucks a night, FP provides a peaceful and quiet oasis in a very active city for a little over half of that. The rooms are very big and akin to a top notch US hotel in size and appointments(ie flatscreen). But what differentiated this hotel were the staff. We stayed there at Christmas 04, so I was shocked to see the average review from a reviewer from this year. When we stayed there, almost every night we were there, FP provided a complimentary appetizer and cocktail hour, with champagne for the guest. It was very refined and relaxing, and my wife and I took part in every one. Plus, the hotel brought in local musicians and dancers to celebrate the holiday with live songs and dance--a real treat. We even prevailed upon the bar staff to keep open the cozy bar one evening when we were in need of a night cap very late. The other guests with whom we spoke all had the same very positive feelings about FP. I have recommended to several friends, and they have all raved about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super bath if you know how to operate it!”
Reviews.Author: MaryMM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 17.1.06 till 20.01.06. Lovely hotel, had the usual superior room but was disappointed not to have a view of the canal. For that you need to be in the suites or the de luxe rooms at much higher cost. The room was lovely and very warm which was welcome as we arrived in the snowstorm. The coffee making machine was too high tech for me, no idea how to operate it, would suggest you take your kettle as they charge for tea and coffee taken in the room. The spa bath/shower was again a mystery, however the manager came and showed me how to switch it on and it was wonderfull. Invited to a soiree where two ladies performed on the flute and cello, greensleaves, well known type stuff, the champagne was flowing and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Would stay here again, central and near the sights. Getting from Marco Polo to the hotel was a long nightmare. Took the water bus which involved a long walk from the airport to the jetty, then a long boring ride stopping at every stop to St Marks Square where we had to change boats and finally arrived about 2 hours after landing. The cost of this was 33Euros. Coming back we shared a water taxi with a couple which got us there in 20 exhilerating minutes, cost 90 Euros for all of us, so it worked out very well. Would recommend this form of transfer if the pocket permits. Getting around by boat is not easy, there is a lot of walking and step climbing in Venice, I am fit so had no problems but others did. Return flight was one long queue from minute entering airport to boarding, security checks and very sensitive machines caused a terrible hold up, no time for a drink or browse, straight onto the plane. Also for the addicts reading this, Italy is a non smoking country.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Foscari Palace on 14th and 15th of January, in a double deluxe room. Foscari Palace is a superb hotel where you can find a lovely venecian design and kind people who take care of you. It's just 5 min. to St. Mark Square, 2 min. to Rialto Bridge, and 2 min. to Venice CasinÃ². Thanks to Foscari Palace for the superb accomodation...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rymat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel during Christmas week. Hotel is small and newly renovated. Common areas in lobby are usable. Breakfast was wonderful. Rooms, we had a suite overlooking the Grand Canal, were large, well decorated, clean and with great beds and bedding. Bathroom was 5 star with all the amenities you could ask for. Staff was helpful. Location was excellent, just far enough away from tourist locations. Area had good restauarants and basic shoppping. Located near a main stop on the water bus line , just across from a large fresh daily market. All was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Shuggy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights mid January o6. No need for a protracted review as it has pretty much all been said. Delightful hotel, very well located; warm, spacious room, all very clean; staff very friendly and helpful; breakfast superb. A couple of do's and don'ts in our opinion - Do book the Foscari with confidence, terriffic value: do buy a 72 hour vaparetto (Actv waterbus) pass, cost 22 Euros but we used it more than a dozen times (normally 5 Euros each time)and it helped us get a lot out of the three days: do go to the short cocktail party if there is one. Don't worry if you've never been to Venice before, everything is dead easy to find (including the hotel) and it's impossible to get lost.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeeJay
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here with the family in mid December. Not for the first time, I consulted Trip Advisor and booked on the basis of reviews found on this site. Once again, I wasnâ€™t disappointed by the selection. As pointed out in previous reviews, it is a VERY good hotel. The rooms are well appointed, the location good (on the main canal, just a few hundred yards from the Rialto Bridge) and the staff very attentive. On the evening we were there, the hotel laid on a champagne reception for the guests. On a related note, for those who like taking guided tours, I would also recommend Fernando Viotto (---). We took us on a three hour introductory tour that was very informative and very entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Venice, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyebaby
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace Hotel deserves a high rating. The staff is excellent, the rooms are beautiful, the breakfast hearty, the waiters handsome and the location perfect. We stayed here in December 2005, Venice weather was in the 40's and 50's, colder at night. Hotel is 2 minutes from C'D'Or vaporetto (waterbus) stop. Easy to find with the right direction. Rooms are beautiful, we had a deluxe grand canal view. High ceilings, fireplace, huge bathroom. VERY CLEAN. Staff is excellent. Some dope left a shirt on a lamp in another room which caused smoke. Staff was quick to address. Safe area. Construction next door, should be finished soon. Breakfast was awesome; cereals, breads, fruits, cheeses, meats, eggs, juices, coffee, tea, was fabulous. The waiters were wonderful, I only wished they served dinner too. Venice is enchanting. The view from here nice, right on the canal. I don't sleep well, during the night i took a peek across and the market was already in full swing on the other side (but u cant hear anything). Only thing I heard was the gondoliers lapping in the water, was awesome. Hotel open all year, I would highly recommend. They have a beautiful sitting area with harp, a bar, tv's, flat screens, inet access if u have your own laptop. The staff arranged for a private taxi back to airport (we arrived by train and took the vaporetto there). I was there with my teenage son. The hotel is perfect for everyone. I would definitely return, Venice has alot of shops :)

Reviews.Title: “Gonzaga Suite, even better than last year”
Reviews.Author: kat1
Reviews.Content: One year after from our first stay at Foscari Palace, we returned there and stayed 01 - 04 December. Things were as great as last year. The same staff (good sign), couteous and helpful. A girl at the reception even playful (in a good way) with me because she remembered me. She was the one who gave me very detailed services last year. We splurged and took Gonzaga Suite on the 2nd floor. We were very happy last year with our 2nd floor corner room with frontal G.Canal view but this Gonzaga room next to it was still much better. Much larger, two high windows facing the G.Canal and the fishmarket. Besides two large beds, there were two sitting areas, one with sofas and another with a table and chairs. On the table of the latter, there was always a vase of fresh flowers. Roof top terrace I appreciated so much last year was not as good this time because of a construction work next door but being happy in our room, we were not too sorry about it. Bathroom clean and with shower cabin and a jacuzzi tub, slippers and bathrobe, all good. The rate was â‚¬711 (â‚¬237 per night) for three nights. Obviously this is the low season price + they give 10 % discount from 3 nights stay. This was much more than we pay for private travels usually (we would have been happy with a superior double, â‚¬160 per night)but from the Venice standard, I think we got more than we paid. Thank heavens this hotel remains 4*. Hope they will keep their rates next year. I will post photos but they will mainly be the views from our room. I took the photos of the room but they don't show the niceness/spaciousness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for a birthday celebration and would thoroughly recommend this hotel. The location is great - 1 minute from a water bus stop, or a short walk from the Rialto bridge and St Mark's Square. We booked a superior double room which was well equipped with flat screen satellite tv, very comfortable twin beds and a small terrace with table and chairs with a sideways view of the Grand Canal. The bathroom had a multi-spray shower and a jacuzzi bath (this didn't work - I reported it so hopefully it will be fixed for the next guests)- the towels were changed twice a day if used and there were bathrobes as well. Like other reviewers I found the system of paying for tea and coffee taken in your room slightly strange. Also there were two small bottles of water in our room on arrival, but these were a one-off and weren't replaced. However I don't want to quibble over small things as overall it was a very good experience and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and all the staff were extremely helpful. We were invited to a 'manager's cocktail party' on the Saturday night with canapes, cocktails and sparkling wine - all complimentary. Venice is lovely in December (we were lucky with the weather but I realise that's not always the case)there were none of the long queues I'd read about - we just walked straight into the Basilica. We had a very special weekend and the hotel was definitely a part of that.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful 6 nights!”
Reviews.Author: margaretlb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, spent a lovely 6 nights from Nov 25 to Dec 1. We found the staff very efficient and friendly. Our first impression upon arrival was Gerald's beautiful smile! In particular, Davina was very helpful and a pleasure to hold a conversation with. The breakfast buffet was astounding; we all felt that it was the best buffet we'd ever encountered in Europe. Luigi and Michel were extremely diligent and attentive during breakfast service. The rooms are beautiful with very comfortable beds and luxury linens. The shower was a lot of fun but we couldn't quite figure out all of the options! Loved the TV with an English language movie every night. And for me, the music system was an added treat. The cocktail reception was a real surprise even though I had read about it in previous posts; I really never expected such extravegant hor d'ourves. What a luxurious touch. In conclusion, the hotel is truly lovely but what makes this a truely memorable stay is the hospitality and pride displayed by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a Fabulous City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a wonderful stay!! We are hotel managers and therefore expect the best - we got the best! Great room, great service and some lovely unexpected little things that made the stay more memorable. Thank you to the staff and management, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great palace”
Reviews.Author: Borya
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice.Excellent hotel, great value.Perfect location,big well-maintained room,delicious breakfast,friendly professional reception.THANK YOU

Reviews.Title: “Fab Foscari”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights in the Foscari Palace for our 10th Wedding Anniversary. I used reviews from Tripadvisor.com & Expedia to select our hotel and agree with all the outstanding reviews, which this hotel has received. We arrived by water taxi (pre-paid or 90 euros) to the front door, but would recommend better value of Alilaguna ferry (hourly) @ 5 euros each to Fondamenta Nove (10-15 min walk). We were upgraded to superior double with a great dual-view (room 101 !). Marble floors/Carved Ceiling - LCD tv - Jacuzzi bath - clean/warm/spacious. The staff were polite and efficient. The hotel is clean and modern, plus ideally situated to explore all of Venice with a great shopping street (Strada Nova)right outside. Rialto Bridge (5 mins) and St Marks (15 mins). Getting lost of beaten track is the best fun. End Nov/early Dec is an great time to visit (weather permitting) with few crowds esp before lunch. We walked around the Doge's palace, Basilica and Campanile had no queues. The gondola ride is very expensive but a must have experience (60 euros). Drinking : Bacaro Jazz (Bellini @ 2 for 1 (7 euro) in happy hour) is a great bar; Harry's Bar is a novelty - size of a front room with Bellini's @ 16 euro each ! Eating : Restaurant in alley opposite Ca' d'Oro (100m from hotel) is a treat (eating with the locals); but we also ate at Foscari recommendation 'Ristorante Al Fontego del Pescaori' was expensive and was only frequented by English voices. We would certainly return to Venice and choose the Foscari Palace every time !

Reviews.Title: “'Perfect'”
Reviews.Author: HelenS67
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked 3 nights at the Foscari Palace as a surprise 60th birthday present for our mother in early Dec 2005 (and dad got to go too!). We have never been to Venice and so had no idea which hotel to choose. However, after much indecision we finally chose this hotel in large part due to the overwhelming number of good reviews it had got. All I can say is I would not hesitate to recommend the Foscari Palace. My parents had a fantastic time there. We booked directly with the hotel, which also organised the taxi transfer from the airport â€“ all very efficient. They stayed in the junior suite Gonzaga, and my mum said she nearly cried when she saw how lovely it was! All in all, a great hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel except difficult to eat breakfast in your room”
Reviews.Author: dadakosovo
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at Foscari Palace, the receptionist greeted us with top-rated friendliness. Our room was beautiful!!--marble floors and ceiling. We did find pieces of broken plastic on the floor in the bathroom which we didn't mention to management--we were busy and didn't want to bother them either. I'm sure they would have been courteous about it if we told them however. The breakfast buffet was very nice. However, you have to eat in the breakfast room and are not allowed to take trays up to your room. If you would like to eat in your room, there is an extra 15 Euro fee. This is the only reason why I rated the hotel above average and not excellent. I've never stayed at a hotel where you can't take food from the buffet to your room. Other hotels have always offered me a tray right away and allowed me to take food to my room. This has always been a must for me since I'm not a morning person and would prefer to stay in my room in the mornings. So if this isn't important to you, then you would love Foscari Palace despite this. The only thing to consider in staying in this hotel is that if you have children, the marble floors may not be the best thing. Otherwise, for honeymooners, etc., get a room with a view overlooking the waters---so romantic, fun and beautiful to look outside your bedroom window. The hotel has a great location and I really appreciated all the reviews that gave helpful tips on getting to/from the hotel/airport. And service was superb at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for the end of our Italy travels!”
Reviews.Author: kmbmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Foscari Palace from November 3 - 5 and it was a perfect way to end our week-long visit to Italy. We found it easily from the Ca d'Oro vaporetto stop (go through the alley, make a right and then another right and it is on the left side directly on the Grand Canal). The standard double room was modern and clean, if just a tad bit on the small/crowded side. Since we did not upgrade to a room with a view, our view was of a building next door that was being renovated. We were able to completely close out the noise/offensive view by closing the windows and shutters. The king bed was two twin beds side by side, but not too troublesome. The shower was quite modern, but as seems to be the case with most hotels in Italy, the water gets everywhere! Their towels and toiletries were first-rate and they also supplied comfy bathrobes. The service at the Foscari was very proper and impeccable. They had a lovely flute/harp duet playing on Thursday evening. Their breakfast buffet was plentiful and delicious. Again, everything just was so proper -- beautifully monogrammed with "Foscari Palace" on all the linens, silverware and crystal. The front desk was helpful in offering dining suggestions, calling ahead for reservations, and giving us directions. One thing that we didn't realize until our 2nd day there was that you are supposed to drop off your key before you leave the hotel to explore Venice. This lets them know that you have left your room and they can turn down your bed in the evening. We are used to a more modern system of key cards. Here, they give you an actual key with a very large and heavy key ring! It was quite cumbersome to carry around our first day! The location is very convenient. We walked to St. Mark's Square and if you want to visit Murano, it is a short walk to the Hospedale vaporetto stop which is just a few stops away from Murano. I just loved Venice and I loved the Foscari Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a super 2 night stay in this friendly, clean hotel. There are shuttered windows, it's quiet, the bathroom facilities are good with a powerful shower and the breakfast selection is varied. All the staff are most obliging and friendly. It is near the Rialto Bridge, good restaurants and shops. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Foscari Palace on November 2-6, 2005 and have only glowing reviews of our stay. Our room was newly redone, sparkling, with modern amenities such as a flat screen tv, ultra-modern bath, quiet & with a view of the Grand Canal. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast included bacon and eggs and much more. Two evenings they sponsored a "Cocktail party" - one with live music - with champagne and food. The hotel had a roof patio with spectacular views. The location was pleasantly away from the most crowded areas but a short walk to everything. We have absolutely no complaints. It was much better than we expected and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Venice as part of our honeymoon travels. We couldn't have been happier with choosing Foscari Palace as our hotel. It is only 1 street away from the Ca'd'oro vaporetto stop, making it easy to find & helps when you have large luggage. We walked in to a beautiful lobby and a very friendly staff. We booked the hotel online and there was no problems checking in. They even gave us a free upgrade on our room location. The staff was willing to help with any request from directions to restaraunt recommendations/reservations. The room was huge and clean! It was just as large as an American hotel chain. The furniture was modern, including a flat screen TV (not that we watched it much). The private bath was all marble & fairly spacious. The shower/tub was the best though. I wanted to take it home with me. It had a rain shower, side jets, and a spray nossel - wow! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable stay. Plus, if you book online you can get a significant discount on room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari Hotel was Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were all thoroughly impressed with this lovely Hotel. The location was perfect and being right on the canal was something else. I have to commend the extremely friendly and helpful staff. It was far better than we expected and the Roof Terrace was something else. Would definately stay here again if we return to Venice and will recommend to friends. Superb and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending our first wedding anniversary at the Foscari Palace and couldn't have been more pleased! We spent a lot of time narrowing our choices in an effort to enjoy Venice (and our anniversary) as much as possible. Foscari Palace did not disappoint. We booked directly through the hotel website and were in one of two rooms with a private balcony overlooking the street and grand canal. The room was clean and spacious, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location ideal. As other reviewers have stated, there is a vaporetto station 2 min away that you can use to get to San Marco Square or you can walk the beautiful 15 minute walk, if you prefer. The hotel is plenty close to the action, but also far enough away to get away from the crowds a bit (and even in October, the crowds were outrageous!). Regardless, Venice was magical and this hotel was worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - all the great reviews are true - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Helen Hughes
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 visits Venice for the second time and want an excellent hotel with fabulous Grand Canal views, great location and friendly and efficient staff. So we read the reviews for the Foscari Palace Hotel, booked and got back an hour ago. This was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in and we've had some good ones in US, Spain, Geneva, London, New York etc. We stayed in Suite 108 and this converted ex Doges' Palace was magnificent. The two roomed suite was big enough to accomodate a couple , a teenager and a 7 yaer old with ease. It had 4 sofas, six armchairs and a table that could seat 8 for dinner if you need it! All the family enjoyed the two flat screen TVs that we could connect up to laptops for DVD viewing and ipod listening. I've never taken so many photos of a hotel suite bfore nor gazed at such equistly painted panelled and cavernously high ceilings. The boys had fun in the jacussi bath and I loved the power jets in the great shower. The staff were all charming and friendly; do take up their recommendations for restaurants as we had one of the best Italian meals we've ever had in a nearby restaurant with mainly local residents. The hotel location was great - within walking distance of where we wanted to go, right nearby a vaporetta stop and not too touristy either. Breakfast was indeed great and despite that the clientele were mainly couples our pretty much well behaved boys were alway greeted with smiles. We always stay in 4 or 5 star hotels and I can't recommend this hotel more highly. We will return here and I expect to recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari Palace many pluses but a big minus”
Reviews.Author: ladyelaine
Reviews.Content: october 2005 The Foscari Palace, with its great location along the Grand canal, offers a traghetto and gondola stop in front and a convenient vaporetto stop just around the corner. The location is perfect for the 15 minute, interesting walk to San Marco browsing at all the shops and twisting canals along the way. It is in fact faster to walk than take the vaporetto. The Foscari is a classy hotel with a lovely little front room salon and superb staff. The breakfasts are fantastic, served in a delightful breakfast room. As to the rooms, there are two problems here: we had a "superior" double which offered a street view. Our friends, who stayed in a double, opened their shutters to see a brick wall 4 inches away. so much for the view...unacceptable without advance info on this. The only rooms available facing the Canal are suites which can only be booked through the hotel and are 380 and 420 euros. There is a coffee maker in the room but you have to pay for it, rather nickel and diming, I think for the cost of this room. The snazzy bathroom is simply illogical in design. Nowhere to put soap or anything else in the shower and frequently a wet floor. What were they thinking? At the foot of our bed, taking up monstrous space, was this huge, out of place sofa ????? Someone, take it away! Soooo...pluses and minuses here.

Reviews.Title: “The Foscari Palace should be 5 stars !”
Reviews.Author: sjoantwe
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Foscari Palace and I can not say enough about this "boutique" hotel. If your travel agent cant book it, do yourself a favor and book it on-line: you will love it. The hotel is in a great location on the Grand Canal, with a dock so water taxis can unload and you dont have to drag your luggage. Next to the hotel is a gondola station for private rides and the ones that ferry you across the canal. Around the corner is the vaporetta stop. The hotel had fresh flowers and a bowl of fruit waiting for us in the room. The rooms are absolutely beautiful as well as clean & spacious, with wonderful beds( husband has a bad back) and soft linens. Plasma TV's, safe, club chairs, windows with balconies and beautiful marble bathrooms. In addition there is a rooftop terrace ffor late afternoon drinks and a great view of the canal. One evening we came in around 6pm to find a combo and champagne in the lobby. The staff is wonderful, I emailed them to alert them of an early arrival, they accomodated us, made all our dinner reservations, had a "care package" for our departure with water, juice, fruit and cookies. I would return there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari was great!!”
Reviews.Author: SA Rose 41
Reviews.Content: After touring Tuscany, we arrived in Venice on my birthday October 15. We had read the many reviews on tripadvisor and had selected Foscari Palace. We were not disappointed. We had a deluxe double overlooking the canal --- it was larger than the hotel pictured and very nicely appointed. We were very pleased with the accommodations, the breakfast, the rooftop, the staff, etc. The staff made reservations at restaurants and water taxi for us. We wish we had allowed more time for Venice and for the Foscari. We recommend it for anyone wanting a good location and a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Booklover58
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 weeks in Italy of which our last 5 nights were spent at the Foscari. All I can say is "wow"! From the minute we rode up in the water taxi and were met at the door, everyone at the hotel exhibited tremendous hospitality. Upon entering, we were greeted with a fresh glass of juice, shown immediately to our room, where a bowl of fresh fruit was awaiting. What a great welcome. Our positive experiences just continued. Our room was luxurious....large (3 club chairs, king bed, desk, flat screen TV), comfortable bathroom with a European "crazy" shower...a view of the canal (leaning out the window). Breakfasts were, as other reviewers have indicated, excellent...certainly something for even the pickiest of eaters. The desk staff was accomodating in all ways: recommendations of places to eat, reservations, directions, and in general, friendly and appropriate. I would highly recommend this hotel. Not being close by St. Mark's is not a problem, it's an easy walk and you avoid a lot of the crowds. Lots of good restaurants and shops close by. Vaporetto stop Ca' D'or right around the corner for added convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel with friends to find that our two Superior Rooms had diminshed to one room with a conference room annexe containing two small camp beds. The hotel was fully booked and they were obviously hoping that a booking for 2 rooms, for 4 people, in one name, was for a family who would be thrilled at the prospect of a suite for a slightly lower rate than 2 Superior rooms. Unfortunatley as 2 couples who had booked for a romantic weekend this was less than satisfactory. To be told it was our own fault for booking through a hotel agency website rather than direct with the hotel did not help the situation. Beware anyone who books other than direct with the hotel - we are not the first not to have our booking honoured. After an extremely uncomfortable night on camp beds only suitable for children they did agree to reduce the rate to that of one room and allocated us a second room. Unfortunately it rained that night and it is now apparently an 'Act of God' if the roof leaks in Venice - an acceptable excuse perhaps if the water levels in the canals rise but less so to cover poor maintenance - there was evidence in the room of previous damp patches. On the plus side the hotel is in an excellent location and the breakfasts are generous but they charge for the coffee in the rooms (not normally the case in a 4 star hotel) and the staff could unbend a little and be less condescending to the guests, who after all are their bread and butter. Nice hotel, great location but we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: needavacationplanned
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Foscari Palace after reading reviews on this site. I was NOT disappointed. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were upgraded to a Deluxe room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. There was a delicious bowl of fruit upon arrival and a "Ciao" basket of goodies on departure. The room was extremely comfortable and the breakfast extensive. This was my splurge for this trip and it was worth every euro. Thank you to everyone for the recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: McDufus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Foscari Palace and were very impressed. From Marco Polo airport we took the Alilaguna water bus to S. Marco (Blu, Red or Ora Line are all OK, tickets available at the booth on the right hand side as you exit the arrivals area) and then swapped onto the No 1 Vaporetti to Ca'D'oro. To find the hotel, at Ca'D'oro you simply walk along the alleyway, turn right at the end and then next right onto Campo Santo Sofia. As we checked-in we were offered complimentary fruit juice. We had booked a superior double room. It was very spacious with 3 large windows overlooking Campo Santo Sofia and providing a partial view of the Grand Canal. The room was tastefully decorated with a wooden floor and an entrance 'hall' with large mirror and coat hooks. There was plenty of hanging/storage space and my husband was able to hook up his iPod to the flat screen TV! The king-size bed was very comfortable and the hotel provided a turn-down service each night. The marble bathroom was clean and we were provided with ample towels, bathrobes and all the necesary soaps/shampoo etc. Breakfast was plentiful and varied - scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes, pastries, cheese, sliced meats, fruit, yoghurt, cereals, cakes and pastries, bread, fruit juice, coffee and tea. The roof terrace (level 3) provides a superb view of the Grand Canal, although due to building work next door, a large crane currently spoils the view - not the fault of the Foscari Palace though! We found the staff very pleasant and polite. On our final night (Thursday), the Manager hosted a cocktail party with music provided by 2 violinists and a cellist in authentic costume. The location of the hotel is superb as there are nice shops, restaurants and bars within strolling distance along the Strada Nova and the vaporetti stop and traghetto which takes you directly to the opposite side of the Grand Canal are seconds away. We returned to the airport via the blue ATVO bus, which departs from stand D2 at Piazza de la Roma (â‚¬3 each). Much quicker and cheaper than the Alilaguna! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just So You Know”
Reviews.Author: Tagabar
Reviews.Content: We based our decision to stay at Foscari Palace on it's location, right by the Ca D'oro vaporetto stop, and because of all the great comments I read on Trip Advisor. We were more than satisfied....large room, flat screen wall panel TV, stylish furnishings, hearty breakfast, accommodating staff. But you should be aware of two things: renovation of buildings on either side of Foscari Palace is going on; to get a Grand Canal front view you can't book through Venere as we did. They are a boutique hotel, part of the Giannetti Group, with a very limited number of rooms that front the Grand Canal, so if you want that view, you better book directly. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!!”
Reviews.Author: travelngurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. This was the best hotel I feel out of all the hotels we stayed at this trip. Very modern with plasma TVs, down comforters (incredibly comfortable beds!), great showers with multiple jets, good hair dryers, 3 phones in room (one in bathroom but only 2 worked), radios in room and bathroom, beautifully decorated also. They had free movies in english on the TV that you could see in your room which was a nice diversion considering we saw very little english tv in the evenings. Breakfast was very good, nicest place so far out of any of the breakfasts. Same typical fare you find at most hotels in europe (rolls, meats, danish, cereal, etc) but also had scrambled eggs & bacon which was nice. The staff in the breakfast room was very polite and always working had it seemed. The staff was very friendly overall and helped us with arrangements to Murano (which was a complimentary transfer from the hotel to the island) and for our trip to the airport. If you fly out of Venice airport, leave yourself 2 to 3 hours to get through this ridiculous airport. It was the worst I'v ever seen, ugh!!! The location is great which is just above the Rialto Bridge which means it was a little quieter since it was not in the tourist zone as much. And being right off the grand canal meant not hauling our luggage over bridges. We did not have any view from our windows but the roof top was nice but obviously under utilized in my opinion. Very nice views from up there. The only bad thing about this hotel was that the room had a "funky" smell and we could never figure out what it was. We don't think it was the water but something in the airducts maybe. If we had stayed there longer I would've asked for a room change but for a couple of days we lived with it. We did tell them about it upon checking out but they didn't seem too interested. I would stay here again as long as the same smell isn't there the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a palace!”
Reviews.Author: 7mlf
Reviews.Content: The Foscari Palace is a beautiful place in a fabulous location. The room we had, a superior double, was very well appointed, large with plenty of room for a king sized bed and a couch. The plasma TV was the largest TV we saw in a hotel in Italy! The marble bathroom was huge though the shower was a bit peculiar and we'd have preferred something simpler to use. We found the reception staff to be perfectly efficient, but limited and unable to offer much beyond what must be the "company line". When we asked for a dinner recommendation the only name we were given was that of the restaurant in their "sister" hotel. When we asked about public transportation to Murano the clerk suggested they arrange a private tour to the glass factory (fortunately we had read enough to know this is a common practice in Venice that you never want to do unless you like being pressured to buy expensive items that you'll have to ship home!) which we politely refused and then she could give us virtually no information or opinion about prices of jewelry on Murano versus Venice. I found the atmosphere of the hotel to be more formal than I like, and a bit stuffy. If you wanted a drink on the small but charming rooftop bar, it was delivered by a waiter in black jacket with prices to match. On the other hand, the breakfast buffet was quite extensive and substantial. Overall though, I did not find this hotel to be a good value, and when I return to Venice (soon I hope!) I'd probably look for something a little less fancy, off the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Martin057
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 superior rooms for ourselves and our friends in January 05 for a stay in September for 3 nights. We booked through Hotels in Venice and the confirmation definitely stated 2 superior rooms. On arriving at the hotel it was immediately apparent that there was going to be a problem. We were told that for our first night that we would have to share a 2 bedroomed suite with our friends as the Hotels in Venice confirmation was for 4 people with the booking under 1 name but for 2 superior rooms. We tried to discuss this with the Manager on duty(Vicente) but were stonewalled at every turn. He is the most intractable person who operates behind a reception desk possible. I asked to see the Hotels in Venice confirmation but when he looked at it he then refused to show it to us. We were then shown to our room which was 1 large suite with twin beds and an adjoining conference room where the maid was actually making up 2 small camp beds as we went in. This was totally unsatisfactory and we went to TRY and discuss this with Vincente - no apologies or even a reasonable explanation other than to say we would receive our superior rooms for the following 2 nights. We were to be charged for 1 night for 2 people in a superior room - no privacy or real sleep on 2 camp beds. The next night yes we received a suite on the floor above whilst our friends kept the original room after alot of hassle. However it started to rain heavily in the early evening - we went to bed around midnight - my wife woke up around 1.15am saying she was getting wet - water was dripping off the ceiling beams onto the bed. I reported this to the night porter who checked if any other rooms were available(none were) so helped me push the bed to one side of the room and produced a towel to collect the drips. Chinese water torture comes to mind especially for my wife as the drips continued all night. I reported this to Vincente as soon as he arrived on duty next morning and he promised to move us to another room - again no apology or any reduction in room rates - his attitude was that this was an act of God(even Italians can be inventive). Our 3rd room was pretty standard but acceptable and we finally had a decent nights sleep. On trying to sort out a compromise with Vincente over the final bill we had more chance of winning the lottery - we had a final reduction of 40 Euros with still no apology. I do not know what charm school he went to but some serious management issues need to be resolved(it seems he was only the Under Manager as the actual Manager was off ill/holiday depending on when you asked).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: petit_chou-fleur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Foscari in march with my boyfriend for our 4 year anniversary. The hotel made it such a perfect romantic weekend. The staff were very friendly and helpul, the hotel was clean and in a perfect spot to visit every corner of Venice. Take your time just wandering round and getting lost in the side streets then end your evening watching the sun set with a bottle of wine on the amazing roof terrace. I dont think you could get a better view of Venice. I recommend taking a gondola late afternoon/early evening when its a bit quieter, and you can watch the sun set. we got a gondola from the station by the Foscari palace, which shuts around 6. To get around get a pass for the Vaperetto that covers the duration of your stay, you can get passes for one day to one week, which saves having to buy a ticket for every journey and means you can hop on and off with ease. And make sure you have comfy shoes! We were disappointed with Murano Island, make sure you pick a good place to watch them making the glass, as some places charge visitors when next door does it for free. Everyone should see venice during their lifetime, its truely wonderful. And dont think its only suitable for couples, im going back next year with the girls for a weekend of culture.

Reviews.Title: “A wondeful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everthing about this place was great. We had the double superior and it was very nice. The service is excellent and very personalized. The hotel is in a great location. The rooms and every part of the hotel were very clean!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff was Awful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband I and stayed for 2 nights. We asked for a wake up call to get to the airport (because there are no alarm clocks in the rooms) and no wake up call was ever given. When asked why, the manager on duty said "well, you are up now" and started yelling at me. We also paid for a room upgrade and they tried to give us a handicapped room, when we said we did not want this type of room (definate room differences) they got snotty about it and said they did not have any other rooms available. But, they did find another room for us and it was definately not worth the extra money we spent as it was exactly the same as the lower priced room with "maybe" and extra 3 feet of floor space. The staff was very unfriendly and short with us and other guests. BEWARE! they think you owe them!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful; You will not be dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: travelinspiration
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. It deserves 4.5 stars in my opinion = excellent service in all areas, pristinely clean, and great location. We stayed in the Junior Suite Gonzaga which is on the 2nd floor overlooking the magnificent Grand Canal. The room is over 550 square feet, beautifully decorated, and has 2 balconies. All the glowing reviews of this hotel are correct so there is not much else to say. Easy 10 minute walk to Rialto and then 10 more minutes to St.Mark's. Private terrace on top of hotel is magnificent. This hotel is worth every penny! While in venice, we booked 2 short tours with "tours-italy". After extensive travelling abroad and going on many great tours w/small groups, this is the 1st company I do not recommend - at least for the Venice walking tour (2 hours). Huge groups, no detailed info. - guide spoke as fast as auctioneer, and overall very rushed. We spoke to couples that went with 2 other guides, also w/this company and same tour, and they also were EXTREMELY dissappointed. In fact, we all left the tour early - it was that bad. On a positive note however, we had booked them also for the Grand Canal boat tour (70 minutes long) and the guide/tour was excellent. Only negative for this tour - they take the max 8 people and so boat is very crowded for everyone is forced to sit up front. The only reason why our tour ended up to be so great, was one of the couple's went inside the boat (covered area) for more room - though I felt bad for them because their views would not have been as good (small windows) and they couldn't hear the guide as well. Overall, Venice is very magical and well worth a visit. Sept. seemed to be a great time to visit re: weather, crowds, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari Palace An Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Leonasgirl
Reviews.Content: Our brief stay in magical Venice was enhanced by the wonderful Foscari Palace Hotel. Room was very comfortable and clean, staff were unfailingly gracious and polite. Thursday afternoon chamber music in the lobby was an unexpected delight! Breakfast was excellent. Location was perfect...a very short walk to C'a d'Oro vaporetto stop, and a lovely neighborhood with pleasant shops and cafes on Strada Nuovo just behind the hotel. The value for the expenditure could not have been any better. I recommend the Foscari most highly and hope I will have the opportunity to visit them again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Of The Trip”
Reviews.Author: alproc
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in the Foscari Palace in late July, early August '05 (five days). Of the three hotels in Italy I chose through TripAdvisor (the Dei Mellini in Rome, excellent, and the Hotel Pierre in Florence, good, were the others), this was the best. The location is great, right on the Grand Canal about five minutes walk from the Ponte Rialto. To get there from the International Airport, we walked 10 minutes from the Terminal to the Alilaguna ferry (40 Euro for 4, via Lido and Murano, however, and hour+ ride!), then got the #1 Vaporitti at San Marco (water bus - 20 Euro for 4), up the Grand Canal to Ca' d'Oro (House Of Gold). To the hotel is then just two minutes walk - to the main street, right, and first right at the square. On reflection, for four of us, a water taxi from the airport might have been cheaper, faster and more fun (EURO 44.95 from the airport to San Marco, I believe, after that I don't know). The main train station (Ferrovia) and the bus station are just a few vaporetto stops north up the Canal. Remember only the #1 stops at Ca' d'Oro. Apart from the nearby Vaporitti stop, you can cross the Grand Canal to the wonderful fresh fish and produce market (be there early), by traghetto (a gondola) for 50 cents, right outside the hotel. One of the better deals in Venice. I found the all the hotel staff friendly, personable and very helpful. They also knew our names and spoke excellent English, if that's important for you. The breakfasts were really quite good - something to look forward to, in fact. And the rooms and bathrooms were quite luxurious, with robes and good turndown service. The shower fittings were cool and techno, but large and somewhat over-complicated - it was a bit like sharing the shower with a white plastic robot. I liked being away from the gondola-crazy San Marco tourist melee, and in the morning I enjoyed early morning, cool-air walks north, into Cannnaregio, one of the more local areas of Venice. (Go towards the train station, then bear off right - Fondamente di Cannaregio, and Fondamente delle Cappucine, Ormesini, Misericordia and della Sensa are all fine canal-side walks, with cafes where you can get an early morning coffee. All are refreshingly tourist-free.) The hotel roof was kind of deserted when I was there, but I did see a nice mid-summer thunderstorm from there on our first night. The large room and the suite at the front of the hotel (overlooking the Grand Canal) appear to be really cool, but I was told you have to book them directly with the hotel. The Foscari Palace is a hotel I would revist without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Made our Venice trip memorable.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Foscari Palace. It is a beautiful hotel with excellent service. The location is excellent as well. The extra touches they provide make this hotel special. For example - complimentary fruit or snack baskets, a rose given to me on the final day of our stay etc. This hotel really made us feel special. Thank you for making our trip to Venice so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “WOW ! Look no further - this is it !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is a reason this is number 1- and they are right . beautiful Hotel- great service- very abundant breakfast- large rooms (for Europe) .. We can not wait to go back--yes you are a 15 minute walk from St. Marks, but you came to walk the streets of Venice- so hop to it ! Grocery store a few minutes from hotel- stock up on cheap water, wine, cheese and go up to the rooftop at night and have your own party - Best out of 7 Hotels we stayed at in Italy- even edged out the Grand Hotel Continental in Sienna.....and that is a 5 star- start packing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: August 2005 - The Foscari Palace in Venice is a first class, elegant hotel with a very friendly, professional, and capable staff. We had a "superior triple" room that had windows overlooking the Grand Canal. Very nice. The room had two twin beds and a comfortable fold up, twin size bed. The size of the room was above average for European hotels. There was a large bathroom with a tile floor and a nice shower / bath / jacuzi tub. Everything was very clean and the daily room service was excellent. There's a nice ground floor restaurant where we had an included breakfast every morning. This was by far the best breakfast spread of any of the hotels we stayed at during our visit to Italy. The hotel is convenient to all the places you'll want to walk to in Venice. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: molly1989
Reviews.Content: my husband,daughter and i stayed there from july 16 through the 23rd..best hotel ever! Extremely attentive staff,knew our names right off the bat. The bed was gigantic and comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful and brand new. the breakfast buffet had everything thing you could ever want. what a way to start a day, especially in high price venice..close to everything,but away from crowded st marks. many great shops nearby, its down the street from some great bakeries, and restaurants. I cant wait to go back..

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: mbernst
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 3 nights at the Foscari Palace. What a wonderful hotel! We stayed in a junior suite which came with a nice sitting area, king size bed and beautifully appointed bathroom. Everything about the hotel was classy without being stuffy. There was lots of marble and granite, fresh carpets, pretty bannisters, etc. They served complimentary juices in the afternoon. On Sat night they had a couple of musicians in the lobby and served appetizers and champagne. The staff was exceptional, friendly and courteous. The location is great in that it's not as touristy as it is closer to St. Mark's. You do have to walk approx. 20 mins to get to St Mark's but that didn't bother us at all. The breakfast buffet was fabulous. Fresh fruits, cereals, pastries, breads, eggs, etc. One of our fellow guests gave the front desk a brochure with a list of the top restaurants in Venice. We ate at one of them (Vini de Gigio), which is just down the street, and it was our best meal. When asking for restaurant suggestions be sure to ask to see the brochure - it's at the front desk in their restaurant folder. The best part of the hotel was the cost - only 180 euros per night. We know people who stayed at hotels close to St. Marks and they paid MUCH more for not nearly as nice a hotel. I have no reservations in recommending the Foscari Palace and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! YOU WILL LOVE IT HERE!”
Reviews.Author: dmytreboe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from July 16-19 and loved it! This was our third destination in Italy and this hotel was by far the best. The hotel was absolutely beautiful with a great location on the canal. Our room was extremely clean and our bathroom was perfect. We particulary liked the jacuzzi tub and the LCD television in the room. Not only was the hotel amazing but the staff was sooo nice. When we first arrived, they invited us down to the lobby for some drinks while we listened to two musicians. They also recommended and made reservations to a great restaurant for dinner. In addition, this breakfast was by far the best we had in Italy. We actually had a hot buffet in addition to the fruit and cereals. I would definatly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice. By the way, we only paid $620 American dollars for 3 nights which included all of our taxes and fees. (we used expedia and hotels.com) You will love the Foscari Palace!! Definately stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “High Quality Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Dundee_Family
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on the recommendations on this site and was not disappointed at all. From the moment we arrived the staff were helpful and the quiet air conditioned atmosphere really relaxed us after our journey. Room was high quality and comfortable, breakfast was also very good. Location is good with a Vaporetta stop within 50 yards. (PS We bought a 3 day pass and got good value for money as everytime we got tired you could just cruise round the canels for an hour to get your second wind.) I would add my recommendations for this hotel to the many others already on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Setting”
Reviews.Author: rpw50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three wonderful nights at the Foscari Palace July 4th thru the 7th. The location is perfect. The views from the terrace magnificent and our room was great. The breakfast is a real bonus. We would gladly stay again and have already recommended the hotel to some of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel from our Italy trip!”
Reviews.Author: ErinPhoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Foscari Palace for 2 nights in July 2005. The staff was super nice and accomodating. We arrived very early in the morning and were allowed to check in quite early. We very much enjoyed that it is a smaller hotel, and felt that the staff was much more personable than other, larger hotels we stayed at in Italy. The location could not be beat; you're very close to a vaporetto stop and about a 10 minute, easy walk to San Marco. We really enjoyed being a bit away from that area. Also, the restaurants were quite good around the area of the hotel. Would definitely recommend eating out at least one night in the vicinity of the hotel; some of the restaurants near San Marco are overpriced and generic. The rooftop bar has beautiful views of the Grand Canal - and if you'd like - there is a gondola stop right outside the hotel. We used it and the guys then gave us a great restaurant recommendation. We would love to return to Venice someday, and if we do, we would definitely stay at Foscari Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: asaj59
Reviews.Content: A 4 star hotel that treats you like a 5 star hotel. Easy access with front door on the Grand Canal (water taxi) or just 4 valporetto stops from the train station at CA' D'Oro. Walked everywhere, 5 minutes to Rialto Bridge, 10 minutes to the Ghetto and 15 minutes to S. Marco - or just let the valporetto (number 1 line) take you up and down the grand canal. On Saturday night the Manager hosted a cocktail party - it was our first night there and we really appreciated it. Our room was a double with a wonderful bathroom (bath/shower combo) and plenty of room to move around. Didn't watch TV but it was a plasma screen. Our only disappointment (and this went for all rooms in Italy) was that the refridgerator does not get cold enough. Breakfast was the best. Plenty of standard Italian breakfast food with a great selection of fruits, juices and desserts, they also had pancakes, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. Side Note: Plenty of Murano glass in Venice, a MUST is to go to Burano and just walk around the little island (a mini Venice without crowds) and don't forget to shop for the linen and lace.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: madiolosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace in May 2005 and were very pleased. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very nice. The rooftop patio had a wonderful view, and the hotel was in a good location. We recommend this place to anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the balcony”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited the Foscari Palce this past June 3-5th and were very suprised how quaint and modern the hotel was. We had a great room with a balcony and couldnt have asked for a better time or better service. I highly recommend! PS: I left the Foscari Palace engaged to be married!

Reviews.Title: “not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ime
Reviews.Content: Chose the Foscari after reading through many reviews of various hotels.Many thanks to those who wrote about the Foscari, it was perfect. Good location,excellant room ,friendly staff, breakfast was super, pity we couldn't eat a bit of everything it all looked delicious.Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Foscari Palace a great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foscari Palace for 3 nights in a standard room. It really was a fantastic place. Our room was very nice, the bathroom very nice. The front desk staff was very helpful in terms of helping us plan an excursion to the islands of Morano, Burano, and Torcello through American Express, and helping us find many locations on maps of Venice. The breakfast was awesome. However, best of all was the ROOF TOP DECK!!!! It didn't seem that this was all that advertised at the hotel, but it is available to all, and absolutely a beautiful place to sit and look out over the Grand Canal and the city roof tops while sipping wine in the evening, and even late at night under a full moon! Have a great time! We certainly did!

HotelInfo.Name: Foscari Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Campo Santa Sofia 4200 / 1 / 2, 30121 Venice, Italy
